Source: Ohio Department of Health. Ohio Death Index, 1958-2000
 
Matz, Lewis E.
               Lewis E. Matz was born February 14. 1866. Lewis and Anna Barbara Egger  were married on Thursday, May 24, 1894 by Rev. J.R.Meuller in the parents  home, Mr. and Mrs. Samuel Egger, at 3:30 p.m. Anna was born on Egger  Ridge on Woodsfield Rt. 3. She was the daughter of Samuel and Magdalena  Christman Egger. Lewis was a prominent attorney in the city of Woodsfield,  Ohio. He and Anna were lifelong Woodsfield residents. Attorney L. E. Matz  was president of The Monroe County Shenandoah Trail Association, trustee of  The Ohio Good Roads Federation, member of the Monroe County Bar  Association, St. Pauls Evangelical and Reformed Church, and Monroe Lodge  No. 189, F.&A.N.  Lewis was a pioneer good roads advocate in Monroe  County and had given generously of time, money in helping get our County out  of the mud and connected up with the State System. Anna died at the age of  73, about 7:30 Wednesday evening, October 7, 1936 at her home on Maple Avenue in Woodsfield. She died of coronary thrombosis. She was a member of St. Pauls Evangelical and Reformed Church and a member of the Senior Womens Union of ======= style='mso-tab-count:1'> Lewis E. Matz was born February 14. 1866. Lewis and Anna Barbara Egger were married on Thursday, May 24, 1894 by Rev. J.R.Meuller in the parent s home, Mr. and Mrs. Samuel Egger, at 3:30 p.m. Anna was born on Egger Ridge on Woodsfield Rt. 3. She was the daughter of Samuel and Magdalena Christman Egger. Lewis was a prominent attorney in the city of Woodsfield, Ohio. He and Anna were lifelong Woodsfield residents. Attorney L. E. Matz was president of The Monroe County Shenandoah Trail Association, trustee of The Ohio Good Roads Federation, member of the Monroe County Bar Association, St. Paul s Evangelical and Reformed Church, and Monroe Lodge No. 189, F.&A.N. Lewis was a pioneer good roads advocate in Monroe County and had given generously of time, money in helping get our County out of the mud and connected up with the State System. Anna died at the age of 73, about 7:30 Wednesday evening, October 7, 1936 at her home on Maple Avenue in Woodsfield. She died of coronary thrombosis. She was a member of St. Paul s Evangelical and Reformed Church and a member of the Senior Women s Union of >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 that church. Anna was primarily interested in her home, family and church. She was a woman of many sterling qualities, capable and self-reliant. It is there she was best known and loved. Funeral services were held at the Evangelical Church in charge was Rev. Henry Fox. Interment was in Oak Lawn Cemetery.
Article published by the Monroe County Historical Society in 1984
Louis E. Matz, Attorney at Law
               In seeking a lawyer the would-be ======= style='mso-tab-count:1'> In seeking a lawyer the would-be >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 client invariably desires to place his business with an attorney who knows the law, is well versed in decisions and can manage a case in all its details to the very best advantage. Among the several attorneys of this class in Woodsfield will be found Mr. L.E. Matz, than who there is no more prompt, careful and painstaking attorney in the County. All business entrusted to him is attended to in an entirely satisfactory manner. Like many other good men, <<<<<<< HEAD Mr. Matz came from the farm and the teachers desk. Born on his fathers farm ======= Mr. Matz came from the farm and the teacher s desk. Born on his father s farm >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 near Lewisville, Ohio, February 14th, 1836. Thus located his early educational advantages were limited to the common country schools; but his ambition to secure an education caused him to so improve his opportunities that at an early age he was prepared to teach. In this profession he had little or no trouble in securing some of the best schools in the vicinity of his home. By labor on the farm and in the school room he managed to procure funds for a better education. <<<<<<< HEAD A few years after entering the teachers profession he took up the study of ======= A few years after entering the teacher s profession he took up the study of >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 law, to which he devoted as much time as he could spare from his other work. To complete his common education he took a college course at Lebanon, Warren County, Ohio, after which he came to Woodsfield in January, 1892, and served as assistant probate law at this place. Shortly after opening an office at this place he formed a partnership with C.S. Buchanan, which continued about two years. In July, 1895, he formed a partnership with Hon. James Watson; but as this partnership no longer exists he is doing business for himself, and will take charge of cases in adjoining counties as well as at home. Mr. Matz speaks German as well as English, and for this reason alone his services are preferred in consultation and actual practice by many of our older German citizens. Office: in lower front room of the Driggs House on Main street. Residence: A fine new structure in the northern part of town in Woodsfield. L.E. Matz, died Sunday afternoon, August 17, 1952, age 86, in Bellaire Hospital. Bauer and Turner Funeral Home was in charge of the arrangements. Masonic services were <<<<<<< HEAD held on Tuesday evening at 7:30 at Lewiss home on Maple Avenue. Services were held in the home on Wednesday afternoon at 1:30 with additional services at two oclock at St. Pauls Evangelical and Reformed Church.  Rev. H.J. Kopke was the officiate and the ======= held on Tuesday evening at 7:30 at Lewis s home on Maple Avenue. Services were held in the home on Wednesday afternoon at 1:30 with additional services at two o clock at St. Paul s Evangelical and Reformed Church. Rev. H.J. Kopke was the officiate and the >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Interment was in Oaklawn Cemetery. Three sons were born to Lewis and Anna Egger Matz: Capel, Edmund, and Wallace.
 
L. E. Matz
               Woodsfield-On Wednesday Attorney ======= style='mso-tab-count:1'> Woodsfield-On Wednesday Attorney >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 L. E. Matz entertained six sisters and one brother at his home on Maple avenue. At noon dinner was served. Those
present were Mrs. Alma Legg of Massillon, Mrs. Elizabeth Hines, Mrs. Mary
Faber, Mrs. Rachel Christman, and Mrs. Lena Christman, all of Lewisville;
Mrs. Amelia Neuhart of Sycamore Street and W. F. Matz of North Main Street.

               Woodsfield-On St. Valentine's ======= style='mso-tab-count:1'> Woodsfield-On St. Valentine's >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Day, Attorney L. E. Matz and his grandson, Louis Matz, celebrated their birthdays at the L. E. Matz home on Maple avenue. The former was 84 years old and his grandson was 10.  About 35 relatives, friends and neighbors gathered to celebrate the event.

Matz, Lewis Wayne and Shirley Auten
 Lewis Wayne Matz was born in Center twp, Woodsfield,    Ohio. Lewis married Shirley Auten on October 30, 1965, by J.V.A.    Traylor in Woodsfield, Ohio. Shirley is the daughter of Harry and Gaynell    Auten of New Matamoras.  Lewis is farming on the family dairy farm.    Shirley began working as an assistant librarian for the Monroe County    District Library in Woodsfield, Ohio in 1978.  In 1989 she was promoted    to the position of director.  Lewis and Shirley are members of the     Woodsfield Church of Christ. Lewis and Shirley celebrated their 25th    wedding ======= style='mso-spacerun:yes'> Lewis Wayne Matz was born in Center twp, Woodsfield, Ohio. Lewis married Shirley Auten on October 30, 1965, by J.V.A. Traylor in Woodsfield, Ohio. Shirley is the daughter of Harry and Gaynell Auten of New Matamoras. Lewis is farming on the family dairy farm. Shirley began working as an assistant librarian for the Monroe County District Library in Woodsfield, Ohio in 1978. In 1989 she was promoted to the position of director. Lewis and Shirley are members of the Woodsfield Church of Christ. Lewis and Shirley celebrated their 25th wedding >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 anniversary in 1990.

Matz, Louis A.
Source--Monroe <<<<<<< HEAD County Beacon    Woodsfield, Ohio
======= County Beacon Woodsfield, Ohio >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711
Published--July 14, 1983
Matz, Louis A. , 72, of 310 North Main Street, Woodsfield, died July 9, in the Barnesville Hospital.
He was born March 31, 1911, in Monroe County, the son of the late William F. and Mary Ann Schaub Matz.
He was preceded in death by a brother, Leland M. Matz.
Mr. Matz is survived by two sisters, Thelma M. Matz of Woodsfield and Mrs. Francis (Sarah) Borns of Iron River, Michigan; two brothers, Herzel Matz of Fort Lauderdale, Florida and Ralph E. Matz of Chillicothe; several nieces and nephews.
Friends were received at the Bauer-Turner Funeral Home, Woodsfield, on Monday and Tuesday, where services were held Wednesday with Reverend Gene Kraus officiating.
Burial in Oaklawn Cemetery, Woodsfield.

Matz, Ludwig
               Ludwig Matz, the subject of this sketch was born in Reinppalz, Balsen, province of Germany, (St. Johns ======= style='mso-tab-count:1'> Ludwig Matz, the subject of this sketch was born in Reinppalz, Balsen, province of Germany, (St. John s >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Evangelical church records lists the birthplace as Oberschlettenbach, Rumbach, Bavaria) on October 19, 1831, and died near Lewisville, Monroe County, Ohio, Saturday evening, July 13, 1912, being at the time of his 80 years, 8 months, and 24 days.
               At the age of 14 years he united ======= style='mso-tab-count:1'> At the age of 14 years he united >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 with the Evangelical church of which he lived a faithful member until called home. He emigrated to America with his parents, Jacob and Louise Walther Matz in 1855 and with the exception of a few years lived the remainder of his life in Monroe County.
               On April 23, 1858, Ludwig Matz ======= style='mso-tab-count:1'> On April 23, 1858, Ludwig Matz >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 and Christina Meckling were united in marriage. To this union were born 12 children, five sons and seven daughters namely, Philip W. and Christian A., Matz of Lewisville, Lewis E. Matz of Woodsfield, William F. Matz of Summit Township, Monroe County, Ohio, Herman F. Matz who preceded him in, January 6, 1906, Mrs. Amelia E. Matz Neuhart, of Summit township, Mrs. Elizabeth Matz Hines, of Lewisville, Mrs. Rachel Matz Christman of Summit township, Louisa Matz Leibarfth, Magdalena Matz Christman, Mary Matz Faber, and Elma Matz at home. Also 33 grandchildren, one great grandchild, together with a host of friends to mourn his departure. His was due to a fall received while returning form a visit to his neighbor and other illness incident to old age. He was a farmer. His wife, Christina died February 18, 1900.
               Mr. Matz was a kind and loving ======= style='mso-tab-count:1'> Mr. Matz was a kind and loving >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 father, and by example and precept reared his children up righteously.
               His Christian faith enabled him to bear patiently the many trying experiences that confronted him during his sojourn in our midst. He never gave up lifes struggle until God called him to ======= style='mso-tab-count:1'> His Christian faith enabled him to bear patiently the many trying experiences that confronted him during his sojourn in our midst. He never gave up life s struggle until God called him to >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 his fold where suffering is no more.
               The funeral services were held Tuesday morning, July 16. Brief services were held at the residence, after which the remains were conveyed to the St. Johns Middle Church cemetery for ======= style='mso-tab-count:1'> The funeral services were held Tuesday morning, July 16. Brief services were held at the residence, after which the remains were conveyed to the St. John s Middle Church cemetery for >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 burial. The funeral sermon was delivered in the Evangelical church by his pastor, the Reverend G. W. Krause. A large concourse of friends attended.
Source: The Monroe County Republican, Woodsfield, Ohio, Monday, July 29, 1912

Matz, Magdalena Saloma Christman
            Lena Matz Christman was born on July 9, ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> Lena Matz Christman was born on July 9, >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 1878, a daughter of Lois and Christina Meckling Matz. She departed this life on April 2, 1957 at the age of 78 years, 8 months and 23 days.
            Mrs. Christman was baptized into the ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> Mrs. Christman was baptized into the >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Christian faith on March 6, 1879 and she took the vows of confirmation on December 26, 1892 being in the same confirmation class as her future husband.
            She was married to George L. Christman ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> She was married to George L. Christman >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 on June 19, 1900 and to this union were born nine children. One daughter died in infancy.
            Surviving are her husband; one sister, ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> Surviving are her husband; one sister, >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Rachel Christman of Lewisville, Rural Route and one brother, William Matz, of Woodsfield; and her eight children, three sons and five daughters; Arthur Christman of Wooster, Route 4; Elma Christman, of Lewisville, Route 1; Esther Claus, of Lewisville, Route 1; Clarence Christman, of Apple Creek; Gertrude Kahrig of Woodsfield, Route 3; Laura Kahrig of Lewisville, Route 2; Paul Christman of Cambridge, Ohio and Beryl Claus of Lewisville, Route 1, who lived in the home with her parents. Twenty- four grandchildren and eight great-children also survive.
            Mrs. Christman lived her entire life in ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> Mrs. Christman lived her entire life in >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 the St. John's Church community. She was a life member of St. John's Evangelical and Reformed Church. She was devoted to her family and shared with them her deep and abiding faith in God.
            Brief services were held at the Bauer ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> Brief services were held at the Bauer >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 and Turner Funeral Chapel on Saturday afternoon at one o'clock with additional services at two o'clock at St. john's Evangelical and Reformed Church. Reverend George W. Varns officiated. Interment was in the church cemetery,
When I have crossed the bar.
   Sunset and evening star
     And one clear call for me!
   And may there be no moaning at the bar,
     When I put out to sea,
   But such a tide as moving seems asleep,
     Too full for sound and foam,
    When that which drew from out the boundless ======= style='mso-spacerun:yes'> Sunset and evening star
And one clear call for me!
And may there be no moaning at the bar,
When I put out to sea,
But such a tide as moving seems asleep,
Too full for sound and foam,
When that which drew from out the boundless >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 deep
      Turns again home.
======= style='mso-spacerun:yes'> Turns again home. >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711
 
    Twilight and evening bell,
      And after that the dark!
    And may there be no sadness of farewell,
      When I embark;
    For tho' from out our bourne of Time and ======= style='mso-spacerun:yes'> Twilight and evening bell,
And after that the dark!
And may there be no sadness of farewell,
When I embark;

       I hope to see my Pilot face to face

She worked as an art teacher for Marion Catholic and Marion City Schools. She moved here from Waldo in 1998. She was a member of First Presbyterian Church and had been active in the Marion Meals on Wheels, Marion County Homemakers and the Ohio State University Extension Service. She excelled in creating and teaching others to create beautiful art and craft pieces.

               Today, the 11th of February 1851, ======= style='mso-tab-count:1'> Today, the 11th of February 1851, >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 the marriage bond of Peter MATZ a linen-weaver, 24 years old, of unmarried status, resident at Oberschlettenbach, son of the married linen-weavers Jacob MATZ and Louisa WALTHER, all of Protestant Lutheran confession, and Maria Eva HETTIG, 27 years old, of unmarried status, resident at Oberschlettenbach, daughter of the married day-laborers Johannes HETTIG and Barbara GLEICHMANN, all of Protestant Lutheran confession, was solemnized in Church, after two banns in Church on the 3rd and 4th Sundays after Epiphany, the 26th of January and the 2nd of February of this year, by the undersigned pastor and in the presence of the witnesses: Heinrich KELLER, farmer at Darstein; Marx HELFER, farmer in Oberschlettenbach; Heinrich Keller, farmer in Oberschlettenbach, all of Protestant Lutheran confession. A certificate of civil marriage of the newly blessed couple was given to the undersigned pastor by the Civil Registration Officer at Oberschlettenbach dated the 11th of February 1851; Pastor <<<<<<< HEAD DIETMANN.  (Peter and Maria Eva settled near Lewisville, Ohio)

Rachel Matz Christman - celebrates birthday
            The ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> The >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 new Fellowship Hall, near Lewisville, was the scene of a surprise
birthday party, on Sunday, March 29, 1953 in honor of <<<<<<< HEAD Mrs. Rachel Christmans
======= Mrs. Rachel Christman s >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711
eightieth birthday.
            After ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> After >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 most of the guests attended church services in the hall, they took
well filled baskets from their cars to the Hall's dining room. Over a
hundred relatives and friends joined in celebrating. Reverend George Varns,
pastor of the Evangelical and Reformed Church, gave thanks and asked God's
blessing on the honored guest and her loved ones.
Sharing honors with Mrs Christman were her sisters, Mrs. Elma Legg, of
Massillon, who also celebrates her birthday on April 2, Mrs. George L.
Christman of Lewisville, Route 1, and their brother, Wm. F. Matz, of
Woodsfield.
            "Happy ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> "Happy >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Birthday" was also sung to Mrs. Phillip Ludwig, of Woodsfield, and
George L. Christman whose birthdays were March 29.
            Mrs. Christmans grandchildren presented her with an orchid corsage which she wore. Many other gifts were received, all of which are greatly appreciated.

and children Lewis, Marlene, and Myrna Kaye; Mr. and Mrs. Gilbert Claus and

This is your life, Ralph Edmund Matz, 1998
            Ralph Edmund Matz was born September 4, 1916, at 1 a.m, in a log house in Summit township, Monroe County, on Northern Road, near Lewisville, Ohio.  The home was later owned by the Hettig family. He is the son of the late William F. (born-1876-died-1956), and Mary Ann Schaub Matz (born-1887-died-1967). Ralph was christened in St. Johns Evangelical and Reformed, Middle Church, near Lewisville. He attended first grade at Johnsons one-room school on Egger Ridge and then continued his education from second grade through high school in Woodsfield. His family moved to Woodsfield in 1923. Ralph was confirmed at St. Pauls Evangelical and Reformed Church in Woodsfield.
            Mr. Matz grew to be a six foot, 190 pound, tow headed, right-handed, brown eyed young adult. He played the violin in the Woodsfield high school orchestra. He also played softball, basketball, and was captain of the football team during his senior year. Ralph says that he was very good in sports.  He graduated in 1934.
            Ralph is enjoying living. There is no ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> Ralph Edmund Matz was born September 4, 1916, at 1 a.m, in a log house in Summit township, Monroe County, on Northern Road, near Lewisville, Ohio. The home was later owned by the Hettig family. He is the son of the late William F. (born-1876-died-1956), and Mary Ann Schaub Matz (born-1887-died-1967). Ralph was christened in St. John s Evangelical and Reformed, Middle Church, near Lewisville. He attended first grade at Johnson s one-room school on Egger Ridge and then continued his education from second grade through high school in Woodsfield. His family moved to Woodsfield in 1923. Ralph was confirmed at St. Paul s Evangelical and Reformed Church in Woodsfield.
Mr. Matz grew to be a six foot, 190 pound, tow headed, right-handed, brown eyed young adult. He played the violin in the Woodsfield high school orchestra. He also played softball, basketball, and was captain of the football team during his senior year. Ralph says that he was very good in sports. He graduated in 1934.
Ralph is enjoying living. There is no >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 special day because every day is a great day. He likes a variety of music and his favorite food is creamed chicken over biscuits, the way his mother made it.
             Ralphs dad, William F. Matz, pumped oil wells and was a custodian at the Monroe County Court House. William F. was the son of Ludwig (Louis) and Christina Meckling Matz. Williams wife, Mary Ann Schaub ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> Ralph s dad, William F. Matz, pumped oil wells and was a custodian at the Monroe County Court House. William F. was the son of Ludwig (Louis) and Christina Meckling Matz. William s wife, Mary Ann Schaub >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Matz, was the daughter of Andrew and Sarah Groves Schaub. William and Mary Ann were blessed with six children: Herzel (born-1907-died-1988), Thelma (born-1908-died-1995), Lewis A. (born-1910-died-1983), Sarah (Borns) (born-1912-died-1985), Leland (born-1914-died-1981) and Ralph E. Matz who was born September 4, 1916 and lives in Chillicothe.
            After graduating from high school, Ralph joined the Civilian Conservation Corp. (the Three Cs) and was stationed in West Virginia, where he and others were responsible for the building of both Hawks Nest and Babcock State Parks.               He later moved to Greenville, Ohio. He met his first wife, Martha Nealeigh and married in 1940. Later they moved to Youngstown, Ohio where he worked for a steel fabrication company. One son, William Edmund Matz was born to this union on March 1, 1941.  In January, 1943 the family ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> After graduating from high school, Ralph joined the Civilian Conservation Corp. (the Three Cs) and was stationed in West Virginia, where he and others were responsible for the building of both Hawk s Nest and Babcock State Parks. He later moved to Greenville, Ohio. He met his first wife, Martha Nealeigh and married in 1940. Later they moved to Youngstown, Ohio where he worked for a steel fabrication company. One son, William Edmund Matz was born to this union on March 1, 1941. In January, 1943 the family >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 moved to Chillicothe, Ohio. Ralph obtained the equivalent of two years of college with a major in sociology through Ohio University, Chillicothe.
            He ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> He >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 entered the U.S. Navy, during World War II, 1944-1946, and served with the Seebees in the Pacific Theater. In January, 1948 he began working for the Federal Prison Service in Chillicothe and after 20 years retired as a correctional officer in January 1968. In 1968, Ralph began working for the State of Ohio at the Chillicothe Correctional Institute and retired as a Plumber 2 in 1980. During the years that he and his family have lived in Chillicothe, they have been members and active in the Salem United Church of Christ, and most recently, the Orchard Hill United Church of Christ.
            On May 15, 1949, Ralph married his ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> On May 15, 1949, Ralph married his >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 second wife, Dorothy Ann Miller (b-1918-d-1996) the daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Arthur C. and Laura Hafler Miller, of Laurel Street, Chillicothe. To this union a son Roger Alan Matz, was born on April 21, 1950.
            Ralphs family now consists of his son, William E. and his wife, Connie who are living in Boerne, Texas. Bill is Senior Property Examiner, Central Region, for USAA Property and Casualty Insurance, San Antonio, Texas. They both have grown children. Ralphs second ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> Ralph s family now consists of his son, William E. and his wife, Connie who are living in Boerne, Texas. Bill is Senior Property Examiner, Central Region, for USAA Property and Casualty Insurance, San Antonio, Texas. They both have grown children. Ralph s second >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 son, Roger Alan Matz married Jenny Kay Niehaus and is living in Wheeling, West Virginia. Roger is a Senior Account Executive at WTRF-TV. Roger and Jenny have three children: Laura June,Gregory Alan, and Katherine Ann. Ralph also has many nieces, nephews, and other relatives which are all special to him.
            Ralph just celebrated his 82nd birthday and was reminded just how special he is by receiving many cards and notes from his family and friends. When an occasion arrived, whether happy or sad, Ralph and Dorothy were always there to be with his family and friends. Dorothy was deceased in 1996.  Ralph is recuperating from replacement knee surgery but still has that pleasing personality and a ready smile to greet everyone, and he loves everyone dearly.  Written by his cousin, Lena ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> Ralph just celebrated his 82nd birthday and was reminded just how special he is by receiving many cards and notes from his family and friends. When an occasion arrived, whether happy or sad, Ralph and Dorothy were always there to be with his family and friends. Dorothy was deceased in 1996. Ralph is recuperating from replacement knee surgery but still has that pleasing personality and a ready smile to greet everyone, and he loves everyone dearly. Written by his cousin, Lena >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 (Kahrig) Pettit. Source: The Monroe County Beacon, 1998
 
            Ralph Edmund Matz, 84, Chillicothe, ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> Ralph Edmund Matz, 84, Chillicothe, >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 died November 20, 2000, in Chillicothe following a brief illness. He was born September 4, 1916, in Woodsfield, the son of William F. and Mary Ann Schaub Matz.
            He was a retired corrections officer ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> He was a retired corrections officer >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 with the Federal Prison Service. A United States Navy veteran, he served with the Seabees in World War II. As a member of the Civilian Conservation Corps in West Virginia, his group was responsible for the construction of two State Parks. For many years he was active in the National Association of Retired Federal Employees on the local and state level. He was an active member of the Orchard Hill United Church of Christ, Chillicothe.
            Surviving ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> Surviving >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 are two sons and daughters-in-law, Roger and Jenny Matz, Wheeling, William E. and Connie Matz, Boerne, Texas; five grandchildren, Laura, Gregory, Katherine, Andrew and Kathleen; a great-grandson, Marcellus; nephew, Jim and wife, Rita Matz, Lebanon.

Matz, Wilfred and Dortha  150 East Henry Street, Dalton, Ohio ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'>
Matz, Wilfred and Dortha 150 East Henry Street, Dalton, Ohio >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 celebrated their 50th wedding anniversary on March 25. They were married in 1951 at Saint Peter's Evangelical Church, Lewisville, by Reverend George Varns.
They are the parents of Donnie (Fran) Matz, Dalton , Linda (Donis) Kirk, Orrville, Tim (Jackie) Matz, London, Carol (Blaine) Immel, Wooster; five grandchildren complete the family.
"Whitey" retired from K&B Transport, Incorporated in 1997. He enjoys golfing and his computer. "Dot" is employed as manager of Dalton Dari-Ette. She enjoys working, cleaning and spending time with her family, especially the grandchildren.
The couple celebrated their anniversary with family on March 31 at the Town-Country Resturant in Wooster.

Matz, Willie and Nellie Morris
               Willie (Bill) T. Matz was born June 8, 1910, in Sunbury township, Monroe  County, Ohio. Willie married Nellie Morris November 8, 1933, in Woodsfield, by Squire Cronin, Justice of Peace. They had made their home at 1011 Orange Street, Ashland, Ohio. Willies 70th birthday was celebrated with a card and dime shower in June 1980. Willie and Nellie celebrated their Golden Wedding anniversary in 1983 at the Union Hall on Orange Street near their home. Willie retired from Eagle Rubber Company. Nellie was born August 14, 1915, in Pennsboro, West Virginia, the   daughter ======= style='mso-tab-count:1'> Willie (Bill) T. Matz was born June 8, 1910, in Sunbury township, Monroe County, Ohio. Willie married Nellie Morris November 8, 1933, in Woodsfield, by Squire Cronin, Justice of Peace. They had made their home at 1011 Orange Street, Ashland, Ohio. Willie s 70th birthday was celebrated with a card and dime shower in June 1980. Willie and Nellie celebrated their Golden Wedding anniversary in 1983 at the Union Hall on Orange Street near their home. Willie retired from Eagle Rubber Company. Nellie was born August 14, 1915, in Pennsboro, West Virginia, the daughter >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 of Adolph and Emma Barker Morris. Willie and Nellie were members of the Steele Avenue Church of Christ. Nellie, 71, died at her home in Ashland on Thursday, August 13, 1987. Services were held on Saturday, August 15, 1987, at 2 p.m. at the Steele Avenue Church of Christ with pastor Travis Irwin officiating. Burial was in Ashland County Memorial Park. Fifth Street, with the Reverend William J. Rauch officiating. Burial will follow in Newark Memorial Gardens.
            She ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> She >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 died Saturday, August 7, 2004, at Licking Memorial Hospital. She was born November 6, 1935, in Woodsfield, to the late Wilbert and Sarah Jane Parks Ayers. She was a graduate of Crooksville High School and a homemaker. She was a member of Saint Paul's Evangelical Lutheran Church and United Commercial Travelers.

            Calling ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> Calling >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 hours will be held from 2 to 4 and 6 to 8 p.m. Tuesday, August 10, at Newark Chapel of Henderson, Van Atta & Johnston Funeral Service, 59 North Fifth Street.

======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711
Maxwell, Anna M., nee Biedenbach
Source--Journal Leader    Caldwell, Ohio
======= style='mso-spacerun:yes'> Caldwell, Ohio >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711
Published--July 2, 2001
 
======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711
Maxwell, Anna Margaret, 80, of Malta, died at 4:46 a.m. Tuesday, June 19, 2001, at Good Samaritan Hospital.
She was born May 17, 1921, in Monroe County, a daughter of the late Ambrose and Gertrude Wall Biedenbach.
Mrs. Maxwell had worked for Essex Wire in Zanesville and the TRW Plant in Crooksville. She was a member of the Church of the Atonement in Crooksville.
She is survivied by her husband, Dean Maxwell, whom she married July 5, 1941; three daughters, Delilah Johnson of Morgantown, Kentucky, Becky Dilley of Nashport, and Susie Gibbs of Crooksville; six sons, Robert Maxwell of Malta, Mark Maxwell of McConnelsville, Fred Maxwell of Crooksville, Tony Maxwell of Cincinnati, Tim Maxwell of Cincinnati and Claude Maxwell of Malta; 16 grandchildren; nine great-grandchildren; one sister, Stella Brown of Enon and one brother, Paul Biedenbach of Caldwell.
In addition to her parents, she was preceded in death by two sisters, Phyllis Shell and Lucille Huffman.
Mass of Christian Burial was held at 11 a.m. Thursday at the Church of the Atonement with Father Frank Stanton officiating.
Burial was in Deerfield Cemetery, Malta.
Miller-Huck Funeral Home in McConnelsville was in charge of arrangements.
Memorial contributions may be made to Deerfield Cemetery, in care of Lucy Westfall, 4533 West State Route 37, Malta, Ohio  43758.

>>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711

>>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711
Published--October 21, 2004
            Blanche ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> Blanche >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Hopton, 87, Woodsfield, Ohio, died Tuesday, at the Monroe County Care Center. She was born January 1, 1917 in Belmont, County, daughter of the late Oliver and Thurza (Neptune) Mayberry. She was a member of Somerton United Methodist Church where she was pianist and organist for 40 years. In addition to her parents, she was preceded in death by a sister, Rosanna Wheatley and a brother, Charles Nelson Mayberry. Surviving are a daughter, Helen (Allen) Wilcox of Somerton, Ohio; two sisters, Jennie (Dick) Huntsman of Barnesville, and Mildred Abel of Canton, Ohio; two grandchildren and five great grandchildren.Visitation, Thursday, 4 to 8 with services at 11 a.m., Friday at the Campbell-Plumly-Milburn Funeral Home, 319 North Chestnut Street., Barnesville, Ohio, with Reverend Rusty Atkinson officiating. Burial follows in Somerton Cemetery. Memorials may be made to the Somerton United Methodist Church or Somerton Volunteer Fire Department.

Mayberry, Glenda Ferrell
Source--Times Leader   ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'>Source--Times Leader >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Martins Ferry, Ohio
Published--October 9, 2004
            Ferrell, ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> Ferrell, >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Glenda Mayberry , 59, of Country Club Road, Saint Clairsville, died Friday, October 8, 2004, at her home. She was born in Beallsville, Ohio on November 17, 1944, a daughter of Frank and Betty Ward Mayberry. Glenda was a retired school teacher for the Union Local School District, having taught for 30 years. She was a committee woman for the Belmont County Republican Party and loved her hobbies and interests, which were traveling, gardening, quilting and painting. She was an accomplished artist and took a very special interest in educating children.She was preceded in death by a stepson, Jimmy Ferrell, and a stepsister, Linda Wallace. Surviving are her husband, James "Jim" Ferrell; children, Nick (Tracy) Kowalski of Nashport, Ohio, Beth Kowalski (Steve Richards) of Circleville, Ohio. Rick (Faye) Ferrell, Stacey (Bryan) Conway and Michelle (Kevin) Hendershot, all of Saint Clairsville; her grandchildren, Ashlen, Kade and Averie Kowalski, Wesley Stoner, Brock and Eberle Ferrell, Alyssa and Jimmy Lodi, and Kyle and Mikayla Hendershot; brothers, Terry (Linda) Mayberry of Colerain, Dennis Mayberry of Raleigh, North Carolina, Dale (Natalie) Mayberry of Ashville, North Carolina, and Mark (Susan) Mayberry of Queenstown, Maryland; sister, Doty (Bill) Sturgill of Crooksville, Ohio; and special pets, Tanner and Baby.Friends will be received from noon to 3 p.m. and 6 to 9 p.m., Sunday, at the Toothman Funeral Home, Saint Clairsville, where services will be held Monday at 11 a.m. with Reverend. Wayne Ickes officiating. Burial will follow in Union Cemetery, Saint Clairsville. Memorial contributions may be made to the Saint Clairsville Public Library, 108 West Main Street, Saint Clairsville, Ohio 43950.

            She ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> She >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 was born February 18, 1919, in Woodsfield to Forrest O. and Retta Cronin Willison. She attended Woodsfield area schools and graduated from Woodsfield High School. She was a member of the Akron Chapter Order of the Eastern Star. She married Denver McCain on July 22, 1939. They moved to Akron, where they lived for many years. After her husband's death, she moved to Michigan.

McCammon, Alexander

            Mr. McCammon was born at Wheeling, ======= style='mso-tab-count:1'> Mr. McCammon was born at Wheeling, >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 West Virginia, September 6, 1931, and was 88 years, 6 months and 20 days of age when he died. He was married to Jane McDonald on October 16, 1862, who preceded him to the Better Land two years ago last December. To this union three sons and two daughters were born. Two sons and two daughters with their families are left to mourn his going, one son having passed to his reward on November 6, 1892.
            Mr. McCammon united with the ======= style='mso-tab-count:1'> Mr. McCammon united with the >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Buchanan Presbyterian church when a young man, and was a loyal and faithful member until the day of his death.

Laselles, on Sunday afternoon at the Buchanan Presbyterian church. Interment in the Buchanan cemetery. Source: The Spirit of Democracy, Thursday, April 1, 1920

            Woodsfield Soldier First Monroe County Viet Nam Casualty
            Mr. ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> Woodsfield Soldier First Monroe County Viet Nam Casualty
Mr. >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 and Mrs. Charles T. McCammon, of Woodsfield, Route 3, received a telegram, last Friday, notifying them that their son, Staff Sergeant Glenn Eugene McCammon, 32, had been killed in fighting on Chu Pong, in Viet Nam, on Wednesday, November 17, 1965.
             Staff Sergeant McCammon, who enlisted in the ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> Staff Sergeant McCammon, who enlisted in the >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Army in 1953, had served both in The Orient and in Europe. He left on August 29, 1965, for Viet Nam and arrived there on Septmber 18.
            He was born February 20, 1933, on ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> He was born February 20, 1933, on >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Woodsfield, Route 3, the son of Charles T. and Mildred Norris McCammon, who survive.

McCammon, Robert Nelson
Source--Monroe County Beacon    Woodsfield, Ohio
======= style='mso-spacerun:yes'> Woodsfield, Ohio >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711
Published--June 1987
 
======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711
McCammon, Robert Nelson, 42, of Lewisville, died June 18 at the Ohio Valley Medical Center, Wheeling, West Virginia. He was born October 8, 1944, in Monroe County, the son of the late Robert T. and Lucy Drake McCammon.
He was a carpenter.
Surviving are his wife, Karen Turney McCammon; one son, Paul, and three daughters, Sandra, Amanda and Angela, all of the home; three sisters, Lucille Christman and Vera Norris, both of Woodsfield, and Wilma McGowan of Denver, Colorado; one brother, James F. McCammon of Route 3, Woodsfield.
Friends were received at the Bauer-Turner Funeral Home, Woodsfield, where services were held June 22 with Reverend David Glass officiating. Burial in the Oaklawn Cemetery, Woodsfield.
CARD OF THANKS--We would like to thank all of our friends, relatives and neighbors for the food, flowers and sympathy during our time of <<<<<<< HEAD sorrow.      THE FAMILY OF ROBERT NELSON ======= sorrow. THE FAMILY OF ROBERT NELSON >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 McCAMMON

McCleary, Jason
Source--Snyder online Obituaries
Published-- March 2002
Birthdate-- December 24, 1919
Death Date-- March 10, 2002
 
  McCleary, Jason Jake , 82, the last of the seven children of Harry and Cora (Riffle) McCleary of Barnesville, Ohio, passed away early Sunday morning, March 10. His brother Don was shot down over Belgium in World War II, and in addition to his parents, Buck, Sis, Marguerite, Rosemary, and Bonnie preceded him in death.
        He met his wife of 62 years, Evelyn Carpenter, at a square dance in Woodsfield where he played the banjo when they were both teenagers. Jake played the fiddle, banjo, and mandolin, but he especially loved his guitar. Jake can be remembered playing his guitar and singing with his children and Evelyns eight brothers and sisters and their children.
        Jake was ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'>
McCleary, Jason Jake , 82, the last of the seven children of Harry and Cora (Riffle) McCleary of Barnesville, Ohio, passed away early Sunday morning, March 10. His brother Don was shot down over Belgium in World War II, and in addition to his parents, Buck, Sis, Marguerite, Rosemary, and Bonnie preceded him in death.
He met his wife of 62 years, Evelyn Carpenter, at a square dance in Woodsfield where he played the banjo when they were both teenagers. Jake played the fiddle, banjo, and mandolin, but he especially loved his guitar. Jake can be remembered playing his guitar and singing with his children and Evelyn s eight brothers and sisters and their children.
Jake was >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 a coal miner and moved to Mount Vernon when he was 19. His first job was as a pressman at Continental Can, formerly Shellmar. Jake was one of the first workers to experiment with a new material, polyethylene, thus beginning a life-long love of the packaging and film business. He moved to Newark in the mid-fifties as the plant manager of Continental Can and relocated to Saint Louis, Missouri, where he was a district sales manager for Chase Bag Company for over thirty years.
        When strokes robbed him of many things he lovedhis job, the guitar, golf, cooking, hunting and fishinghe could still proudly recall in vivid detail each stop ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> When strokes robbed him of many things he loved his job, the guitar, golf, cooking, hunting and fishing he could still proudly recall in vivid detail each stop >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 made by his ship, the USS Lacerta, in the Pacific in World War II where he was a radar man.
        A ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> A >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 near-scratch golfer, he had a hole-in-one on his favorite golf course. Golfing replaced bowling, where he recorded a 279/702 series. He loved to hunt, fish, and play cards with his brothers in law. Books and reading were life-long passions, and World War II and current events were his favorite topics.
        He began ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> He began >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 grilling turkeys and steaks on his Weber grill 40 years ago before barbecuing became a national pastime. Jake loved to cook and he maintained his love for food throughout his life. A pot of soup beans, shrimp cocktail, or a cantaloupe would make his eyes light up.
        A product of the depression and World War II, Jake was a valiant fighter all of his life. The last eight years were difficult, but whenever asked how he felt, Jake would always smile, cock his head to the side, and say, Compared to what?
        Jake is ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> A product of the depression and World War II, Jake was a valiant fighter all of his life. The last eight years were difficult, but whenever asked how he felt, Jake would always smile, cock his head to the side, and say, Compared to what?
Jake is >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 affectionately remembered by his wife Evelyn; daughters and sons-in-law, Joanne and Rod Kiefus, San Mateo, California; Jean and Tim Weisert; Buckeye Lake, Ohio; Janet Sheldon; Overland Park, Kansas; and Joyce Shaffar, Saint Louis, Missouri; 14 grandchildren; and 11 great grandchildren, and many other family members and friends.
        Friends ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> Friends >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 may call from 12 noon to 2 p.m. at the Dowds-Snyder Funeral Home, 201 Newark Road in Mount Vernon 43050 on Wednesday, March 13 where the funeral will be at 2 p.m. Burial in Mount Vernon Memorial Gardens, Mount Vernon, Ohio
         ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Memorial contributions can be made to the Food Pantry Network, 823 Steel Avenue, Newark 43055.

            Mildred R. McClellan, 79, of ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> Mildred R. McClellan, 79, of >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Woodsfield, died Monday (July 3, 2000) at Woodsfield Nursing and Rehabilitation Center.

            She was preceded in death by a grandson, Randy McClellan, and a son-in-law, Clifford Downes.

She leaves her husband, Willie R. >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 McClellan, Woodsfield, whom she married January 1, 1941; two sons, Bill McClellan of Pataskala and Rick (Tammy) McClellan of Grove City; three daughters, Frankie Downes of Lincoln, Delaware, Mrs. Larry (Pat) Strouse of Obetz and Mrs. Bill (Judy) Davis of Columbus; three brothers, T.J. 1981

MARRIAGE

McClelland, Brian William and Cathi Jo Wise

 

     Cathi Jo Wise and Brian William ======= JA'> Cathi Jo Wise and Brian William >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 McClelland were united in marriage Saturday, January 31, 1981 at 2:30 p.m., during a double-ring, candlelight ceremony at the First Presbyterian Church, Barnesville. The Reverend Richard Eshler officiated at the ceremony.

     The bride is the daughter of Mr. ======= JA'> The bride is the daughter of Mr. >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 and Mrs. Samuel E. Wise, Barnesville. The bridegroom is the son of Mr. and Mrs. Robert J. McClelland, Barnesville.

     Maid of honor was Carla Bishop, friend of ======= JA'> Maid of honor was Carla Bishop, friend of >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 the bride. Best man was Bradley McClelland brother of the bridegroom. Ushers were Casey McClelland, brother of the bridegroom, and Todd Wise, brother of the bride. Bridesmaids were Nancy Cook Smith, and Jill Sheppard, friends of the bride. Aimee McClelland, niece of bridegroom, served as flower girl and Jeffrey Wise, nephew of the bride, served as ring bearer. Attending the guest book was Debi Wise Hull, cousin of the bride.

     A reception was held immediately ======= JA'> A reception was held immediately >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 following the ceremony in the church social room with Debbie Wise, sister-in-law of the bride serving as hostess. Valerie Wright, Faye Strouss and Celeste McNabb, friends of the bride aided the hostess.

     The new Mrs. McClelland is a ======= JA'> The new Mrs. McClelland is a >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 1979 graduate of Barnesville High School and attended Belmont Technical College. She is employed with Kinder, Kinder and Hanlon Law offices, St. Clairsville. Her husband is a 1973 graduate of Barnesville High School and a 1976 graduate of the College of Cincinnati. He is employed with the Barnesville Police Department.

     After a brief wedding trip the ======= JA'> After a brief wedding trip the >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 couple is residing in Barnesville.

 
McClelland Named National Award Winner
McClelland, Samantha J.
Source--Barnesville Enterprise      Barnesville, Ohio
======= style='mso-spacerun:yes'> Barnesville, Ohio >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711
Published--April 21, 2004
The United States Achievement Academy has announced that Samantha J. McClelland has been named a United States National Award Winner in Foreign Language.
This award is a prestigious honor very few students attain. The Acadamey recognizes fewer than 10% of all American high school students.
Samantha, who attends Barnesville High School was nominated for this national award by Vibeke Koler, the Barnesville High School German teacher.
"Recognizing and supporting our youth is more important than ever before in America's history. Certainly, United States Achievement Academy winners should be congratulated and appreciated for their dedication to excellence and achievement," said Dr. George Stevens, Executive Director of the United States Achievement Academy.
The Academy selects USAA winners upon the exclusive recommendation of teachers, coaches, counselors, and other qualified sponsors and upon the Standards of Selection set forth by the Academy. The criteria for selection are a student's academic performance, interest and aptitude, leadership qualities, responsibility, enthusiasm, motivation to learn and improve, citizenship, attitude and cooperative spirit, dependability, and recommendation from a teacher or director.
Samantha is the daughter of Brian and Cathi Jo Wise McClelland and granddaughter of Iva Mae Hoff Wise and Irma McClelland all of Barnesville.

            He ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> He >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 was a member of Mt. Vernon Church of Christ; a lifetime member of North American Hunting Club; a member of the National Rifle Association; and a member of Sons of American Legion.

McCollum, of Utica and Jason T. McCollum, of Columbus; daughter and son-in-law Deanna L. and Ken Lightle, of Utica; brothers and sisters-in-law Preston and Iris McCollum, of Mt. Vernon, and Joe and Janet McCollum of Newark; sisters and brothers-in-law Marjorie and Denzil Billman, of Zanesville, Ruth and Harry Barber, of Centerburg, and Bonnie Mechling, of Utica; nine grandchildren; two great-grandchildren; special friend Avanell Beatty and several nieces and nephews.
He is preceded in death by his wife, Elizabeth Jean (Selmon) McCollum; brother Stanley McCollum and sister June Bartenschlag.
            Calling ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> Calling >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 hours will be held 2-4 p.m. and 7-9 p.m. Monday at the funeral home. Contributions may be made to Hospice of Knox County.

            McCombs, ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> McCombs, >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Betty Lee, age 73, of 3rd Avenue, Paden City, died Monday, December 15, 2003, in the New Martinsville Health Care Center. She was a retired school teacher for Wetzel County and Braxton County school systems and a member of the Paden City Christian Church.
            She ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> She >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 was preceded in death in addition to her parents by her stepfather, Brenford Butcher and grandmother, Frances Jane Paxton.
            Surviving ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> Surviving >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 are her husband, Robert V. McCombs; two sons, Philip Tharp of Richmond, Virginia and Jeffery Tharp of Parkersburg; a daughter, Mary E. McCombs Clegg of Clarington; half-brother, Dr. Earl V. Butcher of Columbus, Ohio; and seven grandchildren.
            Friends ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> Friends >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 will be received Friday, December 19, 2003, at the Jarvis Funeral Home, Paden City from 11 a.m. until time of the services at 1 p.m. with Dr. Earl Butcher officiating. Interment in Paden Memorial Gardens, Paden City, West Virginia
Wetzel Chronicle - Wednesday, December 10, 2003.
 
======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711
McConaughy, Cindy--Froehlich
Source--Monroe County Beacon   Woodsfield,Ohio
======= style='mso-spacerun:yes'> Woodsfield,Ohio >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711
Published--September 16, 2004
 
======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711
McConaughy, Cindy and Dave Froehlich are celebrating their marriage with the gracious custom of an open church wedding on October 16 at the Somerton United Methodist Church, at 6:30 p.m.
Cindy is the daughter of the late Gloria Louise McConaughy and Walter and Doris McConaughy, of New Brighton, Pennsylvania.
Dave is the son of Donald and Shirley Froehlich, of Jerusalem.
Cindy and Dave are both employed by Riesbeck's, Barnesville and Woodsfield.
A reception will be held at Somerton Firehouse immediately following the wedding. They are requesting an RSVP
for the reception by phoning 740-757-2259 by October 1. They request no gifts.

McCormack, John F.
             John F. McCormack departed this life on July ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> John F. McCormack departed this life on July >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 29, being at the time of his death 67 years, one month and 12 days old. Mr. McCormack was born near Oil City, Pa, June 7, 1850. He and his family came to this County in the early days of the oil excitement and has resided in Woodsfield for the past ten years and was highly esteemed by all who knew him.
             Besides his wife and three daughters he leaves ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> Besides his wife and three daughters he leaves >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 to mourn his departure, two brothers; Daniel and Mathew, both residing in Oklahoma, two sisters: Mrs. Anna Goeden, Rochester, N.Y. and Mrs. Mary Condon, Oil City, Pa. McCurdy, Mr. Charles M. and Miss Cora L. Walters
               Saturday noon, June 22, 1912, at ======= style='mso-tab-count:1'> Saturday noon, June 22, 1912, at >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 the home of Mr. and Mrs. J. W. Walters of Cranes Nest, was solemnized the marriage of Miss Cora L. Walters and Mr. Charles M. McCurdy.
               The ceremony was performed by the ======= style='mso-tab-count:1'> The ceremony was performed by the >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Reverend Beaver, pastor of the M. E. Church at Cameron, Ohio in the presence of Mr. and Mrs. John Star, Mr. and Mrs. John Norris, Mr. and Mrs. C. B. Workman and their two children, Mrs. Emaline Stephens, Miss Matilda Witschy, Miss Olive Star and Miss Mary Star.
               The bride wore a gown of light ======= style='mso-tab-count:1'> The bride wore a gown of light >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 blue silk trimmed with cream lace and the groom wore a suit of the conventional black.
               The wedding march was played by ======= style='mso-tab-count:1'> The wedding march was played by >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Miss Olive Star, cousin of the bride. After the ceremony and congratulations, a sumptuous dinner was served. Several beautiful presents were received also $12 in money.
               Mr. and Mrs. McCurdy will begin ======= style='mso-tab-count:1'> Mr. and Mrs. McCurdy will begin >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 housekeeping soon at Brentwood, Ohio. They are excellent people having many friends who join in extending congratulations and good wishes.
Source: The Spirit of Democracy, Woodsfield, Ohio, June 27, 1912.

McCurdy, Jere J. - Betty type
 

May 2, 1974

ENGAGEMENT

Miss Pamela McCurdy

Source: Monroe County Beacon

 

     Mrs. Mavis Wilson, of 224 Oaklawn Avenue, ======= style='mso-spacerun:yes'> Mrs. Mavis Wilson, of 224 Oaklawn Avenue, >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Woodsfield, wishes to announce the engagement of her daughter, Pamela Amber McCurdy, to Jerry Lee Nichols, son of Mr. and Mrs. Orin Nichols, of Sardis.

     Miss McCurdy is a student at Woodsfield ======= style='mso-spacerun:yes'> Miss McCurdy is a student at Woodsfield >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 High School and has enlisted in the Women's Air Force. She expects to receive her orders in July.

     Mr. Nichols is in the Air Force in the ======= style='mso-spacerun:yes'> Mr. Nichols is in the Air Force in the >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 medical administration field. He is stationed at Lackland Air Force Base, Texas. Wedding plans are infomplete.

 

 

 
McCurdy, Pamela--Nichols
Source--Monroe County Beacon    Woodsfield, Ohio

Published--September 1974

McCurdy, Ralph Emerson

  Ralph E. (Bus) McCurdy, 38, of ======= JA'> Ralph E. (Bus) McCurdy, 38, of >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Woodsfield, Route 2, died Monday morning, February 1, 1965, at 8:05 o'clock, in Barnesville General Hospital after a three weeks' illness

   He was born at Woodsfield, June ======= JA'> He was born at Woodsfield, June >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 26, 1926, a son of Charles and Cora Walters McCurdy. Mr. McCurdy was a member of the First Methodist Church in Woodsfield, and was employed at Olin Mathieson Chemical Corporation, at Hannibal.

   Surviving are his parents, with ======= JA'> Surviving are his parents, with >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 whom he made his home; one son, Carson McCurdy, and three daughters, Lynn, Pamela and Molly McCurdy of Woodsfield Route 1; four sisters, Mrs. Wilma McIntyre of Watertown, Mass.; Mrs. Eileen Shannon of Van Nuys, California; Mrs. Eva Jean Palmer of Peninsula, and Mrs. Myrna L. Stovall of Avenel, New Jersey. One son, Jere J. McCurdy died July 8, 1964. Funeral services were held at the Michener Funeral Home on Wednesday afternoon at two o'clock, with Rev. Roy Walther officiating. Burial was in Oaklawn Cemetery. Source: The Monroe County Beacon, February 4, 1965.

 
McDiffitt, Lillian Opal
Source--Wetzel County Message Board     West Virginia
======= style='mso-spacerun:yes'> West Virginia >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711
Published--August 1993
McDiffitt, Lillian Opal , 86, of Pine Grove, died Monday, August 9, 1993, in Reynolds Memorial Hospital, Glen Dale. She was a Protestant. She was preceded in death by her husband, Forrest John McDiffitt on October 27, 1977; a daughter, Doris Jean Tuttle; her parents, John and Myrtle Robinson Henthorn. Surviving are five sons, Forrest of New Martinsville, Norman of Rayland, Cecil of Reader, West Virginia., Charles of Walker, West Virginia., and Gary of Pine Grove, West Virginia.; four daughters, Mrs. Robert (Joyce) Cain and Mrs. Jack (Mary Louise) Pegg, both of Glenville, West Virginia., Mrs. John (Maxine) Dobrin of Wellsburg, and Mrs. Keith (Sandra) Phillips of Pine Grove; three half-sisters, Dorothy Sorg of Shadyside, Buena McCoy of East Liverpool Ohio, and Hazel Tenny of Altadena, California; two step-sisters, Mildred Meeks of Marietta and Leone Spencer of New Matamoras, Ohio; 29 grandchildren, 33 great-grandchildren, two great-great grandsons. Friends received 2-9 p.m. Tuesday at Palmer Funeral Home, Pine Grove, where services will be held at 1 p.m. Wednesday. Interment in Knights of Pythias Cemetery, Pine Grove, West Virginia.

McElfresh, Richard K. Dick
            Summerfield, ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'>McElfresh, Richard K. Dick
Summerfield, >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Ohio- Richard K. "Dick" McElfresh, 68, of 50010 State Route 513, Summerfield, died at 4:30 a.m. Tuesday (Sept. 30, 2003) at his home. He was born April 17, 1935, in Carlisle, Ohio, to Kyle and Dorothy Thompson McElfresh. He was a retired military policeman in the U.S. Army serving during the Korean War and the Vietnam War. He was also a member of American Legion Post 415 at Summerfield.
            He is ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> He is >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 survived by his wife, Carolyn Guiler McElfresh, whom he married on Sept. 8, 1982; three sons, Jeremy McElfresh of Buffalo, Ohio, Jason McElfresh of Summerfield and Justin McElfresh at home; one sister, Mrs. Walter (Patsy) Grywalski of Summerfield; and one grandson, Jayden McElfresh of Buffalo.
            He ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> He >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 was preceded in death by his parents; and two brothers, Stanley McElfresh and William McElfresh.
            Services ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> Services >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 are at 2 p.m. Sunday at Brubach-Watters Funeral Home in Summerfield with Frank Love officiating. Burial will follow in Eastern Cemetery in Summerfield with full military graveside services. Friends will be received from 2 to 4 and 7 to 9 p.m. Saturday at the funeral home.
Source: The Marietta Times, dated Thursday, October 2, 2003
 
 McElhiney, ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> McElhiney, >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Pettit, Jeane M.
Source--Times Recorder    Zanesville, Ohio
======= style='mso-spacerun:yes'> Zanesville, Ohio >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711
Published--February 6, 2005
            McCONNELSVILLE ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> McCONNELSVILLE >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 -- Jeane M. Pettit, 87, of 8358 N. Ohio 60, McConnelsville, died at 2:05 p.m. Friday, Feb. 4, 2005, at the Genesis Good Samaritan Hospital in Zanesville.
Born Feb. 26, 1917, in Morgan County, she was a housewife and was baptized in the Church of Christ faith.
She is survived by a daughter, Dorothy (John) Metcalf of Chesterhill; six grandchildren; and one brother, Jerrold McElhiney of McConnelsville.
She was preceded in death by her mother, Bessie Mell McElhiney; father, Howard Curtis McElhiney; husband, Robert W. Pettit; and sister, Mary Wetherell.
Calling hours will be 10 to 11 a.m. Tuesday, Feb. 8, at the Miller-Huck Funeral Home in McConnelsville. Graveside services will be held at 11 a.m. Tuesday, Feb. 8, 2005, at the McConnelsville Cemetery.
Memorial contributions may be made to the Morgan County Humane Society, Box 14, Chesterhill, OH 43728.
Originally published Sunday, February 6, 2005

McFarland, Grace and Mr. Forrest Pfalzgraf
            A ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> A >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 marriage of more that local interest was solemnized Saturday evening, of last week at the home of Mr. and Mrs. E. O. McFarland, when their daughter Miss Grace McFarland became the bride of Mr. Forrest Pfalzgraf.
            The ceremony was performed at 5 oclock by the Rev. J. D. Green, of the Clarington ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> The ceremony was performed at 5 o clock by the Rev. J. D. Green, of the Clarington >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Methodist Episcopal church in the presence of a number of near relatives and friends.
            In the parlor of the home beautifully ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> In the parlor of the home beautifully >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 decorated with flowers arranged, the impressive ring ceremony was read and its sacred vows mutually pledged. The attendants were Miss Freda Burkhalter and Floyd McFarland.
            Following the hearty expression of ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> Following the hearty expression of >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 congratulations and good wishes of those present, a fine wedding dinner was served. In the evening other friends came and gave the newly married couple a fine serenade and were generously treated to cake, lemonade, and cigars.
            Mr. Pfalzgraf who is a son of Mr. and ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> Mr. Pfalzgraf who is a son of Mr. and >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Mrs. John Pfalzgraf is a graduate of Woodsfield High School and a successful teacher. Both he and his bride are members of fine families deserve the happiness and success their friends wish for them.
            They left Sunday for a weeks wedding ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> They left Sunday for a week s wedding >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 trip to Washington, D. C. and on their return will be housekeeping near Sycamore Valley, Ohio. Mr. Pfalzgraf being employed as teacher in the Bethel township high school for the coming year.
Source: The Monroe County Republican, Woodsfield, Ohio, Monday, Sept. 1, 1924

McGarry, Mrs. Ruth Johnston
Source--Newsclipping
Published--June 1977
            Mrs. ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> Mrs. >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Ruth Johnston McGarry, 56, of 206 Center Street, Woodsfield died Friday morning, June 24, 1977, at 10 o'clock at her home after several months illness.
She was born in Miltonsburg, Ohio, July 25, 1920, the daughter of the late Homer and Laura Hardesty Johnston.
Mrs, McGarry was Monroe County Common Pleas Court Stenographer for several years..
Her husband, Robert McGarry, survives.
Services were held Sunday afternoon at one o'clock at the Bauer and Turner Furneral Chapel, with Reverend David J. Wiseman officiating. Burial was in Oaklawn Cemetery, Woodsfield.

Published--December 20, 2001
Hines, Vera McGarry, Woodsfield, will be celebrating her 80th birthday, December 28. She would enjoy hearing from her friends. Her address id C5 Idle Lane, Brandenton, Florida 34208.
She is the mother of four daughters, Betty and her husband Clyde King, Sharon and her husband Jerry Scott of Lewisville, Robin and her husband Joe Bishop and Sue Hines, all of Woodsfield; 14 grandchildren and 13 great-grandchildren.
She and her husband Ellis Hines have been married for 58 years.

McGilton, 94, >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 of Beallsville, Ohio died Wednesday (April 30, 2003) at the Woodsfield Nursing and Rehabilitation Center in Woodsfield. She was born March 4, 1909, in Coats Station, Ohio, to Clarence Holland and Chloe Smith Holland. She had owned a farm near Beallsville, Ohio and was a member of Pleasant Grove United Methodist Church.

McGraw, Robert A.
            Summerfield, ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> Summerfield, >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Ohio - Robert A. McGraw, 72, of Summerfield, formerly of Akron, died Monday morning (January. 26, 2004) at Summit Acres Nursing Home in Caldwell. He was born Dec. 3, 1931, in Akron to Paul B. and Vera C. Lantzer McGraw. He was a former insurance adjuster. He was a veteran serving in the U.S. Air Force. He was a member of Summerfield American Legion Post 415 and First Brethren Church in Ellet, Ohio. He was a longtime supporter of Crypton Brethren Church near Hazard, Ky.
            He is ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> He is >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 survived by his father of Caldwell; one brother, Paul B. (Jean) McGraw of Tennessee; four nieces; one nephew; eight grandnephews; two grandnieces; one great-grandnephew; and one great-grandniece. He was preceded in death by his mother. Services are at noon Saturday at McVay-Perkins Funeral Home in Caldwell with the Rev. Jimmy Rogers officiating. Burial is in Forrest Hill Cemetery in Canton. Military honors will be conducted by Caldwell Veterans of Foreign Wars Post 4721 and Belle Valley American Legion Post 641.
Source: The Marietta Times,, dated Wednesday, January 28, 2004

======= style='mso-spacerun:yes'> Woodsfield, Ohio >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711
Published--Thursday May 6, 1999
 
======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711
McGuire, James B. ,70, Belt Street, Powhatan Point, died April 26, 1999 at his home. He was born, January 7,1929 in Powhatan Point, a son of the late Charles and Drucey Brown McGuire.
He was a retired mail carrier for United Postal Service, a Protestant, and an Army veteran of the Korean War.
Surviving are two sons, James R, of Clarington, Jay P., of Frazeysburg; a daughter, Rebecca J. Ninni, Powhatan Point.

McHugh, James Frank
            James Frank McHugh, 105, of Route 1 , ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> James Frank McHugh, 105, of Route 1 , >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 New Matamoras, Ohio, died Thursday evening Octoberober 13, 1994, at Riverside Methodist Hospital, Columbus, Ohio. He was born June 16, 1889, in Monroe County, near Graysville, Ohio, a son
of the late Lewis and Maggie Swallow McHugh. He was the oldest living person
in Washington and Monroe County.
            He attended Elliott Business School in ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> He attended Elliott Business School in >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Wheeling in his younger days.
During his lifetime he was self-employed and engaged in various occupations
including farming, construction work, timber work, and as a truck driver. He
contributed his longevity to hard work. He was driving truck after he was in
his nineties. He was also a township clerk and a school board member for many
years. He was interested and took an active part in community activities, as
long as health permitted. He helped organize and was a charter member of
Jolly Grange in Brownsville. He was honored in 1993 by County and local
granges as the oldest granger in Ohio. He was a member of the Greenbrier
United Methodist Church.
            He is survived by six children, Helen ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> He is survived by six children, Helen >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Drake and husband, Carl of
Marietta, Ohio; Ruby Bauman of Columbus; Beryl Poulton and husband Ralph of
Columbus; Margie Olson and husband Ivan of Durham, North Carolina; Mildred
McHugh of the home; Frank McHugh of the home; 11 grandchildren; 17
great-grandchildren; 10 great-great grandchildren; one niece, Lucille Lovett
Riley of Mesa, Arizona.
            He was preceded in death by his wife ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> He was preceded in death by his wife >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 of 59 years, Ina Waife Cline McHugh
on January 16, 1970.
             Friends were received October 16 at the ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> Friends were received October 16 at the >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Bauer-Turner Funeral Home where
services were held October 17 with the Reverend Gordon Ferguson officiating.
Burial followed in the Oaklawn Cemetery, Woodsfield, Ohio.
Source: The Monroe County Beacon, Woodsfield, Ohio Thurs., October. 20, 1994

McKelvey, Milton H.
            Milton H. McKelvey aged 63 years, ======= style='mso-tab-count:1'> Milton H. McKelvey aged 63 years, >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 died at Ozark, Ohio September 21, 1919. Deceased was born at New Castle, this County, at which place he grew to manhood. He was married to Miss Ella Read to which union two children were born Ewing, of Denver, Colorado, and Mrs. H. B. Brown of Ozark at whose home he died. He also leaves two brothers; Lee McKelvey of Toronto, Ohio and Everett McKelvey of Laings, besides his widow. Mr. McKelvey had been employed as machinist at Cleveland but ill health compelled him to quit his business and seek relief. The remains were brought to Woodsfield Monday and taken to the home of his sister-in-law Mrs. Lottie Beardmore where thy were tenderly cared for. The funeral services will be held <<<<<<< HEAD at the home of Mrs. Beardmore this (Thursday) afternoon at two oclock; ======= at the home of Mrs. Beardmore this (Thursday) afternoon at two o clock; >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 interment in Oaklawn cemetery, Woodsfield.

McKelvey, Wade
            Woodsfield-- ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> Woodsfield-- >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Wade C. McKelvey, 64 , of Moose Ridge Road, Woodsfield, died Sunday morning (May 11, 1986) at his home.
            He was born October 3,1921, in Monroe ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> He was born October 3,1921, in Monroe >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 County, son of Guy S. and Marie Craig McKelvey. A retired employee of Texas Eastern Corp., Mr. McKelvey was a former representative for Columbia National Life Insurance Company.
            He ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> He >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 was a member of The Presbyterian Church of Woodsfield and a World War ll veteran. Mr. McKelvey was a member of Masonic Lodge 189, OES Lodge 268, VFW Post 5565 of Powhatan, Alladdin Shrine of Columbus, Commandry and York Right Bodies and was a life member of Pearl Harbor Survivors Association.
             He leaves his wife, Eva Jean Winland McKelvey; ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> He leaves his wife, Eva Jean Winland McKelvey; >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 two daughters, Bonnie Heil of St. Clairsville and Mrs. Charles (Connie) McGee of Powhatan; two sons, David McKelvey of The Petterson Nursing Home in Wheeling, West virginia and Gregory McKelvey of Woodsfield; two sisters, Mrs. James (Lenora) Neuhart and Mrs. Norris (Gloria) Whittaker, both of Woodsfield; a brother Guy McKelvey of New Lexington and five grandchildren.
             Friends may call from 9 a.m. to 9 p.m. today ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> Friends may call from 9 a.m. to 9 p.m. today >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 at Bauer-Turner Funeral Home in Woodsfield, where Masonic services will be held at 7 p.m. and OES services will be held at 7:30 p.m. today.
            Services ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> Services >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 will be at 2 p.m. Wednesday at the funeral home with the Rev.
Stephen R. Long officiating. Burial will be in Oaklawn Cemetery in Woodsfield with full military graveside services.

McMahon, Isaac
               Once more the angel has visited the ======= style='mso-tab-count:1'> Once more the angel has visited the >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 vicinity of Mt. Carrick and claimed for its victim, Isaac McMahon, who's occurred July 18, 1903. He was born near Clarington, January 31st, 1828, being at his 75 years, 5 months and 17 days. He lived in the vicinity of Clarington for several years during his youth.
               He afterwards moved to the ======= style='mso-tab-count:1'> He afterwards moved to the >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 vicinity of Mt. Carrick, where he has dwelt for upwards of forty years or more. He was married to Jeanetta Hanlon in 1848. To this union were born 11 children; his wife and four children have gone on before to that land where all is joy and calm.
                He leaves to mourn his loss, one brother, ======= style='mso-tab-count:1'> He leaves to mourn his loss, one brother, >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 seven children, twenty grand children, six great grandchildren and a host of other friends. Mr. McMahon was a good neighbor, an upright citizen and a friend to all who knew him. He will not only be missed in his own home, but will be missed throughout the vicinity in which he lived. He was converted to the Christian church in the Goudy congregation under the influence of the preaching of J. W. Arnold, in the year 1879 and has ever since lived in that faith, that when the time of his departure would come, that he would gain a home in Heaven. Isaac and Jennetta are buried in the Goudy Church of Christ cemetery. Source: Newspaper clipping, Monroe County Ohio, July 1903.

McMahon, Margaret Ellen (nee Schneider)
            Margaret Ellen Schneider McMahon was ======= style='mso-tab-count:1'> Margaret Ellen Schneider McMahon was >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 born at Neuhart Ridge on July 18, 1869, and passed away very suddenly at her home at Kerr Station on September 18, 1933. She had attained the age of 64 years and two months.
            In 1901 she was united in marriage ======= style='mso-tab-count:1'> In 1901 she was united in marriage >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 with John McMahon. Two sons, William and Albert, blessed this union who with their father mourn her sudden death and loss. The day before her death she was her usual self, waiting on her family the same as always. Illness, sudden and acute seized her and death followed shortly.
            Beside her immediate family she leaves ======= style='mso-tab-count:1'> Beside her immediate family she leaves >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 to mourn her death three sisters, Mrs. Catherine Millbaugh, of Lower Salem; Mrs. Louisa Hoff, of Antioch, and Mrs. Anna Christman of Woodsfield, and one brother John Schneider of Woodsfield Route 1, besides a host of other relatives and friends.
            On Wednesday afternoon, September 20, ======= style='mso-tab-count:1'> On Wednesday afternoon, September 20, >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 at 2 o'clock a throng of relatives and friends paid their last tribute of respect to her sterling qualities as a neighbor, sister, friend, mother and wife. Rev. Henry Fox, pastor of St. Paul's Evangelical Church, was in charge of the services and was assisted by Evangelist J. V. A. Traylor, pastor of the Woodsfield Church of Christ.
            The services were opened and closed ======= style='mso-tab-count:1'> The services were opened and closed >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 by the singing of appropriate hymns. Rev. Fox used as his text the 12th verse of the ninetieth Psalm, and showed how the departed had applied her heart unto wisdom in serving her dear ones, her fellowman and her Creator.
            The great abundance of flowers ======= style='mso-tab-count:1'> The great abundance of flowers >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 expressed the high esteem in which she was held by her many relatives and friends and by whom she will be sadly missed. Following the services interment was made in Oak Lawn Cemetery.
            Card of Thanks: We desire in this ======= style='mso-tab-count:1'> Card of Thanks: We desire in this >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 way to express our sincere thanks and appreciation to our many neighbors and friends for the kind deeds and expressions of sympathy extended to us during the short illness and at the time of the death of our dear wife and mother. Such kindness shall always be remembered.--John McMahon and Sons.
Source: Newspaper clipping, Monroe County, Ohio, September 1933.
