McNew, Etta L. Eldridge
Source--Monroe County Beacon     Woodsfield, Ohio
Published--Thursday,  June 17, 2004
    Eldridge, ======= style='mso-spacerun:yes'> Woodsfield, Ohio
Published--Thursday, June 17, 2004
Eldridge, >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Etta Lenoar, 76, of 39389 Straightfork Road, Graysville, died June 8, 2004 at her home. She was born January 24, 1928 in Tazewell, Tennessee, a daughter of the late Wesley McNew and Myrtle McCreary McNew.
    She was a homemaker and a member of Straightfork Chapel.
    Surviving are her husband, R. Howard Eldridge, of Graysville; three sons, H. Ray Eldridge and his wife Wanda, of Graysville; Bruce W. Eldridge and wife, Lynn of Stow, Bobby Joe Eldridge, of Akron; daughter, Mrs. Charles Faye McBride of Akron ;  eight   grandchildren ; 10 great  grandchildren; two brothers, Paul McNew and wife  Mary of Crossville, Tenessee, Willie McNew and wife Erica , of Corpus  Cove
Texas; two sisters, Ruby Lawson, of Jacsboro, Tennessee; Jewel Cox of Cairo, Georgia.  
    Mrs. ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> She was a homemaker and a member of Straightfork Chapel.
Surviving are her husband, R. Howard Eldridge, of Graysville; three sons, H. Ray Eldridge and his wife Wanda, of Graysville; Bruce W. Eldridge and wife, Lynn of Stow, Bobby Joe Eldridge, of Akron; daughter, Mrs. Charles Faye McBride of Akron ; eight grandchildren ; 10 great grandchildren; two brothers, Paul McNew and wife Mary of Crossville, Tenessee, Willie McNew and wife Erica , of Corpus Cove
Texas; two sisters, Ruby Lawson, of Jacsboro, Tennessee; Jewel Cox of Cairo, Georgia.
Mrs. >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Eldridge was cremated and Memorial services were held June 12 at her home on Straightfork Road for family and friends.
    Hadley Funeral Home, New Matamoras was in charge of arrangements. Burial in Akron.

McNinch, Norma L.
Source--Monroe County Beacon    Woodsfield, Ohio
======= style='mso-spacerun:yes'> Woodsfield, Ohio >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711
Published--Thursday October 1, 1998
 
======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711
McNinch, Norma L. O'Malley, 77, of Eisenhower Drive, Bridgeport, formerly of Marlon Street, Bridgeport, died September 28, 1998 in Wheeling Hospital.
She was a member of the Church of Christ, Saint Clairsville.
Surviving are two daughters; Mrs. Donald (Linda) Moffitt, Jr. of Tridelphia and Mrs. William (Alice) Shunk of Jacobsburg; a brother, Joseph O'Malley of Brookside; eight grandchildren; four great-grandchildren; a great-great-grandchild.
She was preceded in death by her husband, Emmett; a daughter, Shirley Pyatt; her parents John and Lula Bishop O'Malley; a brother Bernard O'Malley; two sisters, Virginia Thornburg and Alice Detweiler; a grandson, Donald E. Moffitt.
Friends were received September 29 at Wilson Funeral Home, Brookside, where services were held September 30. Interment in Linwood Cemetery, Blaine.

McVey, Albert D.
               Once more the death angel has ======= style='mso-tab-count:1'> Once more the death angel has >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 visited our home and took from us a loved one. Albert D. McVEY was born April 17, 1865, and departed this life January 28, 1919. He was united in marriage to Clarinda DOUGHERTY. To this union was born seven children.
               His wife and two daughters preceded him to the great beyond. He leaves to mourn his departure three sons, two daughters and one sister. His death was caused from tuberculosis. Everything was done to help him, but to no avail. He will be sadly missed by all.                           -M. ======= style='mso-tab-count:1'> His wife and two daughters preceded him to the great beyond. Medis, John Calvin
            John ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> John >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Calvin Medis, was born into this world in Monroe County, Ohio on October. 1, 1843, parents were Gideon and Huldah Pittman Medis, and died at his brother's, Martin Luther Medis, in Paden City, West Virginia, Octoberober 24, 1921, being aged 78 years and twenty-three days.
            At ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> At >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 the age of eighteen he was born again under the preaching of the documented and honored Nathan W. Cramblett and according to the testimony of those who knew him, he ever lived a faithful Christian life. His late home was in New Brighton, Pennsylvania, but recently went on a visit to his native community and conducted the worship only about two weeks before his death.
            A few ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> A few >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 years ago he sojourned in Paden City for a time and formed many acquaintances and made a good record by attending the worship there. Fifty years ago he was married to Miss Catherine Richner and to them were born five girls and three boys. He came to Paden City to visit his brother and died there, this writer was called to cover the funeral on Tuesday, October 25. The worn out body of Bro. Medis was laid to rest in the cemetery near to await the judgment day.
("The funeral services were held in a small country church, John C. Medis remains were not brought back to PA. for burial. Descendants of John Calvin Medis.) Published October 1921.

Meeker, George H.
            Died: ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> Died: >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 October 22, 1917. Source: Monroe County death records.
 
Meeker, Jane
            Jane Meeker, aged 68 years, an inmate ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> Jane Meeker, aged 68 years, an inmate >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 of the County infirmary, died at that place July 31. The cause of her was the result of burns, which accident occurred June 24, when she was removing a dishpan of water from the Cook stove with her apron which caught fire, and she walked some 30 feet to her dining room table preparatory to wash the supper dishes.
             She did not raise any alarm to let any one ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> She did not raise any alarm to let any one >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 know she was on fire, consequently no one knew of it until she got back into the kitchen when the alarm was raised. Supt. Brown was out at the end of the main hall of the building and when he got to her assistance her clothing was on fire from her feet to the top of her head. He reached for a bucket of water and threw it in her face and breast which succeeded in putting out the flames at once.
            She ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> She >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 received some severe burns which were getting Along as well as could be expected but her age and her physical condition could not revive from the shock. Funeral services were held by W.C. Loper and burial was made at the Infirmary Cemetery, August first.
Source: The Spirit of Democracy, Woodsfield, Ohio, Thursday, August 8, 1918

Meisenheimer, Freda (nee Neuhart)
            Frieda C. Meisenheimer, daughter of the late Frederick and Marie Neuhart, was born in Lewisville, Ohio, January 14, 1891. She was confirmed in St. Peters Evangelical Church, at Lewisville, Ohio. ======= style='mso-tab-count:1'> Frieda C. Meisenheimer, daughter of the late Frederick and Marie Neuhart, was born in Lewisville, Ohio, January 14, 1891. She was confirmed in St. Peter s Evangelical Church, at Lewisville, Ohio. >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Both of her parents died before she reached the age of sixteen. For many years she made her home with her sister, Mrs. Clara Egger, of Lewisville.
            On June 22, 1921, she was united in ======= style='mso-tab-count:1'> On June 22, 1921, she was united in >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 marriage with the Reverend P. Walter Meisenheimer. During the twenty-six years of life in the parsonage, she served faithfully with her husband. Their first five years were spent at Trinity Evangelical Church, Loudonville, Ohio. While here, the two sons, Earl Robert and Charles Walter were born. Their next twelve years of service were in Taylor, Pennsylvania; and since August, 1938, they have been in the Hamburg-Eden charge, residing in Hamburg, New York.
            Here was a busy life, which was ======= style='mso-tab-count:1'> Here was a busy life, which was >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 filled with thoughtful little things, accompanied with a friendly manner and charming smile, that made her unnumbered friends wherever she lived.
            Her greatest joy was to make some ======= style='mso-tab-count:1'> Her greatest joy was to make some >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 child happy with some little kindness - a flower, or a toy. All children greeted her with smiles.
            After a prolonged illness of six ======= style='mso-tab-count:1'> After a prolonged illness of six >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 months, her earthly pilgrimage came to close on January 7, 1948 lacking one week of reaching her fifty-seventh milestone.
            Mourning her passing are her ======= style='mso-tab-count:1'> Mourning her passing are her >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 husband, P. Walter Meisenheimer; her two sons and their families, Lt. Earl R. and Louise Meisenheimer and their daughter, Sharon Marie; Charles W. and Helane Meisenheimer, and their daughter, Jill Helane; three sisters, Mrs. Clara Neuhart Egger, Mrs. Laura Neuhart Hehr and Mrs. Josephine Neuhart Hinderlong, all of Lewisville; her stepmother, Mrs. Amelia Matz Neuhart, and a half-brother, Cyril Neuhart, both of Woodsfield.
            She was preceded in death by her ======= style='mso-tab-count:1'> She was preceded in death by her >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 parents, Frederick and Mary Weber Neuhart; one brother Charles Neuhart and two sisters, , Mrs. Minnie Neuhart McCammon and Mrs. Edna Neuhart Wittenbrook.
            Funeral services were held in St. Peters Evangelical and Reformed Church in Lewisville, Monday afternoon with ======= style='mso-tab-count:1'> Funeral services were held in St. Peter s Evangelical and Reformed Church in Lewisville, Monday afternoon with >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 the Reverend Walter M. Trogler, of Woodsfield, and Dr. Paul Saleske, of Mansfield, officiating. Burial was made in the Friendship cemetery by the Gardner.
Source: The Monroe County Beacon, Woodsfield, Ohio, February 1948.

Mellott, Calvin Miller
            Beallsville- ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> Beallsville- >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Calvin N. Mellott, 84, ofBeallsville, OhioRoute 2, died at 3 p.m. Saturday at his home. A retired farmer, he was born nearBeallsville, Ohio, December 11, 1878, a son of Benjamin Franklin and Lualla Miller Mellott.
            He ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> He >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 was a member of the Methodist Church, 50-year member of Sunsbury Lodge 362, F. and A.M., and for 30 years its secretary, was a member of the Eastern Star, served for 20 years on the Monroe County School Board and also at one time was a member of theBeallsville, OhioDistrict School Board.
            Surviving ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> Surviving >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 are his widow, Mrs. Mary Jeffers Mellott; two daughters, Miss Marie Mellott of Columbus and Mrs. Sara Christman of San Antonio, Tex., and seven grandchildren.
            Services ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> Services >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 will be held at 1:30 p.m. Tuesday at the Methodist Church with Rev. Harvey McPheron assisted by Rev. Dennis Jones, officiating. Burial will be inBeallsville, OhioCemetery. Eastern Star services will be held at 7 p.m. and Masonic services at 7:30 p.m. today at Harper-Campbell Funeral Home.
Source:The Times Recorder, Zanesville, Ohio, October 28, 1963.

his own home and it was a farm. He could read and write. He was a farmer on

William in Adams Twp., Monroe County, Ohio.

            He ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> He >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 was a member of the First Christian Church of Barnesville, the Fraternal Order of Eagles and the Loyal Order of Moose.             Perry ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> Perry >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Wesley Mellott, 74, Woodsfield Nursing and Rehabilitation Center, formerly of Harper Ridge Road, Woodsfield, died Friday, January 23, 1998 in Barnesville hospital. He was born February 22, 1923 near Beallsville, Ohio, a son of the late James and Alice Baker Mellott.
            He ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> He >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 was a retired employee of Baker Farm Equipment near Lewisville, attended United Methodist Church, Jerusalem, a member of American Legion Post 768,Beallsville, Ohio and was an army veteran of World War II.

North Carolina; a step-daughter, Rosalee Manges of Quaker City; a brother James Mellott of Beallsville, Ohio; two sisters, Clarabell Baker of New Castle and Bessie Carpenter of Wilson; 10 grandchildren; a great-grandson.
            Funeral ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> Funeral >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 services will be held today at 2p.m. at Harper Funeral Home, 52728 Ohio Ave., Beallsville, Ohio, with the Rev. Edward Emory Jr. officiating. Burial follows in Boston Cemetery, Boston, Ohio, with full military honors conducted by American Legion Post 768, Beallsville, Ohio.

Mellott, Miss Theodore and Gilbert Christman

            Miss Theodore Mellott, the ======= "Times New Roman";mso-fareast-language:JA'> Miss Theodore Mellott, the >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 daughter of Mr. and Mrs. C. B. Mellott of Beallsville, Ohio R. 3, became the bride of Mr. Gilbert Christman of Fly R. 1, son of Mr. and Mrs. J. W. Christman of Quaker City R. 5 at a quiet but impressive ceremony performed on Saturday morning, January 1, 1938. Minister J. V. A. Traylor, pastor of Woodsfield Church of Christ, officiated at the exchange of marriage vows at his home on Eastern Avenue at 11:45 o'clock.

            The attendants were Cleo ======= "Times New Roman";mso-fareast-language:JA'> The attendants were Cleo >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 M. Christman, a sister of the bridegroom and Asher Mellott, a brother of the bride.

            The bride was attired in ======= "Times New Roman";mso-fareast-language:JA'> The bride was attired in >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 blue velvet with white accessories while her bridesmaid wore a blue dress with white accessories.

             Following the wedding a delicious dinner was ======= "Times New Roman";mso-fareast-language:JA'> Following the wedding a delicious dinner was >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 served at the bride's parents. Mr. Christman and his bride will reside on his farm on Fly Route 1. They have the best wishes of their many friends.

Source: The Monroe County Republican, January 6, 1938

Mendenhall, Ardith Marie (nee Danford)
            Caldwell, ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> Caldwell, >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Ohio - Ardith Marie Mendenhall, 87, of 50621 Route 147, Sarahsville, died Monday (Feb. 1, 1993) at her home.
            She ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> She >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 was born Feb. 28, 1905, in Noble County, daughter of the late Garfield and Tessie Bates Danford. She was a homemaker and owned and operated a family farm with her late husband. Mrs. Mendenhall was a member of Mt. Ephraim United Methodist Church and United Methodist Women. She was a Republican and presiding judge and clerk at the Center East voting precinct for many years and a former Tri-School and Shenandoah Band Mother.
            Mrs. ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> Mrs. >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Mendenhall was preceded in death by her husband John H. Mendenhall, on Dec. 11, 1979; a daughter, Mildread Lucille Mendenhall; two brothers and three sisters.
            She ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> She >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 leaves two daughters; Mrs. Austin (Ruthanne) Hannahs and Mrs. Glen (Wilma Marie) Bates, both of Sarahsville R.D. 1; a son and daughter-in-law, John Wayne and Wilma Mendenhall of Quaker City; nine grandchildren; 22 great-grandchildren; and many cousins, nieces and nephews, brother and sisters-in-law.
            Friends ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> Friends >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 may call 2 to 4 and 7 to 9 p.m. Wednesday at McVey-Perkins Funeral Home, Caldwell, where services will be at 1 p.m. Thursday with the Rev. Marjorie King officiating. Burial will be Mt. Ephriam Cemetery..
Source: The Cambridge Jeffersonian, February 2, 1993
 
Mendenhall, Calvin M.
            Calvin ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> Calvin >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 M. Mendenhall, 75 of 814 Walnut St, Caldwell, died at 5:50 am today January 25 1983 at Good Samaritan Medical Center, Zanesville. He was born November 28, 1907 near Mount Ephraim, son of the late James and Mary Sayre Mendenhall. He was a retired farmer and merchant, having operated the Western Auto Store in Caldwell for a number of years. He was a member of Caldwell First Christian Church F&AM 136 in Sharon and Sharon Grange.
            He ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> He >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 was preceded in death by a son Merritt in 1955 and one grandson John Ramsey in 1951. He leaves his wife, Clarice Danford Mendenhall of the home; three daughters, Mrs Hubert (Jean) Ramsey of Caldwell, Mrs Dana (Geneva) Foraker of Caldwell and Mrs Robert (Janet) Bertman of Elkhard, Ind; 11 grandchildren; 10 great-grandchildren; and one sister Mrs Ida Bates of Caldwell.
            Friends ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> Friends >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 may call at McVay Funeral Home, Caldwell, Wednesday from 2 to 4 and 7 to 9 p.m. Masonic services will be at 7:30 p.m. at the funeral home. Services will be Thursday at 1 p.m. at McVay Funeral Home with Pastor Jim Garrett officiating. Burial will be in Sharon Cemetery.
Source: The Cambridge Jeffersonian Tuesday, January 25, 1983

She and her husband had operated the Western Auto Supply Store in Caldwell for a number of years.

Menkel, Emma Loretta (nee steed)
            Mrs. ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> Mrs. >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Emma L. Menkel, age 74, passed away early Friday morning,
Octoberrober 07, in her new home on South Sycamore Street after an illness
of several weeks.
            She ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> She >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 was born in Monroe County, March 08, 1875, daughter of Henry
W. and Rebecca Steed. She was united in marrage to edward H. Menkel in
1891, and to this union were born five sons and five daughters. Her
husband and two daughters, Gertrude and Pearl preceded her in death.
            Surviving ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> Surviving >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 her are her sons, Roy of Norman, Oklahoma, Clyde and William
of Woodsfield, Harold of Texas, Edward of San Bernardino, California and three daughters, Mrs Edna Gustely of Akron, Mrs. Alma Highman of Woodsfield, and Mrs. Cleo Moore of Canton. Two sisters Mrs. Mary Truex and Mrs. Ola Egger, and one brother Everett Steed, also survive, as well as seventeen grandchildren and seven great-grandchildren.
            She ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> She >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 united with Bush Church of Christ in 1890, and was baptized by
Brother Cramblett. She transfered her membership to the Woodsfield church shortly after moving here, and was a faithful member and worker in the service of the church.
            Her ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> Her >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 devotion to home and family, friends and neighbors was an inspiration to all who knew her and will long be remembered. Funeral services were held in Bauer-Turner funeral chapel Sunday afternoon with evangelist Jack Hawkins officiating. interment was made in Oaklawn Cemetery.
            You will ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> You will >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 notice by E. H. Menkel's ad that he has made a change in his business, having taken his son Clyde into partnership. Clyde who recently returned from overseas was born and raised in Woodsfield andis one of our cleanest and best young men. clyde has established a reputation while in his fathers employ as being one of the best carvers, letterers and all-around workmen in his line. E. H. Menkel has one of the most up-to-date and complete plants for finishing
monumental work to be found anywhere and through courteous and honest
business methods has established a good business. We predict for the new firm a successful future.
 
Menkel, Henry
            A sad ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> A sad >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 loss to the village of Miltonsburg, Ohio, during the past week (July 29, 1889) is the death of Mr. Henry Menkle, who had resided in that place for many years, and by living the life of an honest, upright and kind-hearted citizen, had won the admiration and respect of the entire town and vicinity.
            He ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> He >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 died last monday morning at 1 o'clock, of brain fever, after a short ilness. Mr. Menkle was about 66 years of age, and had been a resident of Miltonsburg about forty years.
             He came to America from Londow, Germany, in ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> He came to America from Londow, Germany, in >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 1844. Deceased leaves a wife, five sons, three daughters and many other friends to mourn his loss. To these the Gazette extends its sympathy.
            The ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> The >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 funeral took place Tuesday afternoon and was conducted by the I.O.O.F., of which the deceased had been a member many years. The funeral is said to have been the largest witnessed in Miltonsburg for years, as hundreds of old friends for miles around were present.

Menkel, Pearl
            Her many friends, young and old were shocked to learn of the death of Miss Pearl Menkel, twelve-year old daughter of Mrs. Emma Menkel at her home on Sycamore street last Tuesday morning (December 4, 1923) at 7:00 oclock, after a short illness from scarlet fever.
            Last ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> Her many friends, young and old were shocked to learn of the death of Miss Pearl Menkel, twelve-year old daughter of Mrs. Emma Menkel at her home on Sycamore street last Tuesday morning (December 4, 1923) at 7:00 o clock, after a short illness from scarlet fever.
Last >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Friday, Pearl, in usual health had given a party for her young girl friends, played Saturday with her young friends, but too sick Saturday night. A private funeral was held this (Wednesday) morning with Bauer & Willison in charge. Interment in Oaklawn cemetery. The bereaved mother and family have the sympathy of many friends.
Source: The Spirit of Democracy, Woodsfield, Ohio, Thursday, December 6, 1923

Mercer, Ellis

He was born September 26, 1927, at Summerfield, a son of the late Chester and Ocie Carpenter Mercer.

Burial was in Oaklawn Cemetery, Woodsfield, Ohio.

1944

DEATH

Mercer, Joseph Rolland

     Pfc. Joseph Rolland Mercer, son ======= JA'> Pfc. Joseph Rolland Mercer, son >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 of Mr. and Mrs. Chester Mercer, of Summerfield Route 2, was killed in action September 28th in the Palau Island, according to a telegram received by his parents from the War Department on October 12th. He would have been nineteen years old October 29th.

     Pfc. Mercer enlisted in the U. ======= JA'> Pfc. Mercer enlisted in the U. >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 S. Marine Corps on his eighteenth birthday, October 29, 1943, at Akron, where he was employed by the Goodrich Rubber Company. He had attended Calais High School.

     On December 23, he reported at ======= JA'> On December 23, he reported at >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Parris Island S. C., for his "boot" training. In March 1944, he spent his only furlough at home, following which he was transferred to New River, N. C. In April he was sent to Camp Elliott, California, and on May 13, 1944, left for the South Pacific, reaching his destination June 22nd.

     Surviving besides his parents ======= JA'> Surviving besides his parents >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 are three brothers and five sisters: Donald, Ellis, Bonnie, Martha Lou, Lodena, Nancy Jane, Emma Rachel and Jimmie; also his grandparents, Mr. and Mrs. Oscar Carpenter of Summerfield Route 2.

 
Mercer, Maralee and W. Ralph Christman

             Miss Maralee Mercer, daughter of Mrs. Ocie ======= "Times New Roman";mso-fareast-language:JA'> Miss Maralee Mercer, daughter of Mrs. Ocie >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Mercer, of Beallsville, Ohio, and Mr. W. Ralph Christman, son of Mr. and Mrs. Walter F. Christman, of Route 3, Woodsfield, were united in marriage in the parsonage of the First Methodist Church in Barnesville, Saturday evening, December 21. The Rev. Fred Shiliz officiated at the double ring ceremony at seven-thirty.

             For her wedding the bride wore a Horne's ======= "Times New Roman";mso-fareast-language:JA'> For her wedding the bride wore a Horne's >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 original gown of Chantilly Lace over satin with three-quarter length sleeves and very full skirt. Her fingertip veil of illusion was held in place by a small crown of sequins and pearls. She carried a white Bible topped with a white orchid with streamers and lovers knots. She carried out the tradition of something old which was her mother's pearl earrings; something new, which was a strand of pearls, a gift of the groom; something borrowed which was her sister's white bible, and she wore a blue garter and a penny in her shoe for good luck.

            The young couple was ======= "Times New Roman";mso-fareast-language:JA'> The young couple was >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 attended by Mr. and Mrs. Bert Bates, of Route 2, Summerfield. Mrs. Bates, the bride's sister wore a lilac ballerina length dress with white accessories and corsage of yellow rosebuds.

            The new Mrs. Christman ======= "Times New Roman";mso-fareast-language:JA'> The new Mrs. Christman >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 attended Calais School and was employed at Campus Shirt Company in Barnesville. Mr. Christman also attended Calais School and is employed with the Olin Marthieson Company near Clarington.

            They are making their home ======= "Times New Roman";mso-fareast-language:JA'> They are making their home >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 in Jerusalem.

 
Mercer, Martha L. and John L. Betts
            Miss ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> Miss >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Martha L. Mercer, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Chester Mercer, of Summerfield, Ohio, Route two, became the bride of Mr. John J. Betts, son of Mr. and Mrs. Frank Betts, of Lewisville, Route one, on Saturday, May twenty-seventh, nineteen hundred and fifty. The wedding took place in the Methodist parsonage at Woodsfield, with the Reverend William M. Miller performing the ceremony.
            The bride chose for her wedding a poudre blue suit with white and navy blue accessories, and a corsage of white orchids. Her only jewelry was her mothers engagement ring and earrings belonging to the bridesmaid.
            The ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> The bride chose for her wedding a poudre blue suit with white and navy blue accessories, and a corsage of white orchids. Her only jewelry was her mother s engagement ring and earrings belonging to the bridesmaid.
The >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 bridesmaid, Miss Clarabelle Kennon, of Barnesville, Ohio wore a pink suit with white and navy blue accessories. Her corsage was of white roses.
            Mr. ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> Mr. >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Edward Christman, of Lewisville, served Mr. Betts as best man. The groom wore a cassino green suit, and the best man a brown pinstripe suit. Both wore a white carnation boutonniere.
            Other ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> Other >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 attendants at the wedding were Mr. and Mrs. Ellis Mercer and Miss Billie Jean Shepherd, of Barnesville, and Clyde Christman of Woodsfield.
            Following ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> Following >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 the ceremony a reception for the immediate members of the family was held at the Bayes Restaurant in Woodsfield. Previous to her marriage, the bride had been employed at the Campus Shirt Factory in Barnesville.
Source: The Monroe County Beacon, Woodsfield, Ohio, May 1950.
 
Mercer, Martha Lou Betts
             Mrs. Martha Lou Mercer Betts, 44, of 3731 Caracas Drive, Westerville, Ohio died Monday afternoon, June 23, 1975, at 2:15 oclock, at Riverside Hospital, Columbus, after a four-day illness.
            She was born April 11, 1931, at ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> Mrs. Martha Lou Mercer Betts, 44, of 3731 Caracas Drive, Westerville, Ohio died Monday afternoon, June 23, 1975, at 2:15 o clock, at Riverside Hospital, Columbus, after a four-day illness.
She was born April 11, 1931, at >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Chatfield, Ohio, the daughter of Mrs. Ocie Carpenter Mercer, of Jerusalem, Route 1, and the late Chester Mercer. She was a former resident of Calais, Monroe County, Ohio.
            Mrs. Betts was a member of the Trinity Lutheran Church at Marysville, Ohio.
 Surviving, in ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> Mrs. Betts was a member of the Trinity Lutheran Church at Marysville, Ohio.
Surviving, in >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 addition to her mother, are her husband, John J. Betts; two sons, Terry Betts, of Marysville, and Juan Betts, of the home; one grandson, Trevor Flynn Betts, of Marysville; four sisters, Mrs. Bonnie Egger, of Marysville; Mrs. Lodena Christman, Mrs. Nancy Crum and Mrs. Emma Bates, of Jerusalem; and two brothers Ellis Mercer, of Jerusalem, Route 1. Two brothers and two sisters preceded her in death. The body was taken to the Postle-Hale Funeral Home in Marysville where friends were received.
            Funeral services were held Thursday afternoon, June 26th, at one oclock in the Trinity Lutheran Church with the ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> Funeral services were held Thursday afternoon, June 26th, at one o clock in the Trinity Lutheran Church with the >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Reverend Donald Bachman officiating. Burial was in Oakdale Cemetery at Marysville.
Source: The Monroe County Beacon, Woodsfield, Ohio, June 1975.

Mercer, Nancy J. Crum
            Nancy J. Crum, (nee Mercer) 60, of ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> Nancy J. Crum, (nee Mercer) 60, of >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 35626 Harper Ridge Road, Jerusalem, Ohio died December 15, 1996, in Druid City Hospital, Northport, Alabama. She was born April 22, 1936, in Calais, Ohio, a daughter of the late James and Ocie Carpenter Mercer.
            She ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'>    She >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 was a member of the Jerusalem United Methodist Church and Order of Eastern Star Chapter 24, Beallsville, Ohio. She was a retired dietary supervisor at American/Woodsfield Nursing and Rehabilitation Center.
            Surviving are her husband, Clayton, whom she married on May 22, 1954; four sons, Reggie and Marlene, of Cottondale, Alabama, Brent and Pat, and Shawn, all of Jerusalem, Brian Buck and Sharon, of Woodsfield; a daughter, Mrs. Tod ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'>    Surviving are her husband, Clayton, whom she married on May 22, 1954; four sons, Reggie and Marlene, of Cottondale, Alabama, Brent and Pat, and Shawn, all of Jerusalem, Brian Buck and Sharon, of Woodsfield; a daughter, Mrs. Tod >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 (Thalia) Kahrig, of Woodsfield; one brother, James Mercer, of Jerusalem and three sisters, Lodena Christman, Mrs. Bert (Emma) Bates, and Ocie McFrederick, all of Jerusalem; and 10 grandchildren.
            ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'>    >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 In addition to her parents, she was preceded in death by an infant daughter, Tama Lodena; three brothers, Donald, Joseph, and Ellis Mercer; four sisters, Betty Mercer, Bonnie Egger, Opal Mercer and Martha Lou Betts.
            Friends ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'>    Friends >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 were received December 19 at the Harper Funeral Home, Beallsville, where services were held December 20, with the Reverend Richard Wilson officiating. Interment followed in Beallsville Cemetery. Eastern Star services were held December 19 at the funeral home.
            Memorial ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'>    Memorial >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 contributions may be made to Sunsbury Lodge 362 Building Fund c/o Bill Davis, 54190 New Castle-Beallsville Road, Beallsville, OH 43716. 
Source: The Monroe County Beacon, Woodsfield, Ohio, December 15, 1996.
 
Mercer, Ocie Pauline (nee Carpenter)
            Ocie Pauline Carpenter Mercer, 77, ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> Ocie Pauline Carpenter Mercer, 77, >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Route 1, Jerusalem, Ohio suffered a heart attack at 11 a.m. January 31, 1982, at the home of her daughter, Nancy Crum. She was born August 3, 1904, at Calais, Ohio, daughter of the late Oscar and Martha Dailey Carpenter. She was a homemaker. Mrs. Mercer was baptized in the Green Pond Baptist Church, Tuscaloosa, Alabama in 1978. She was a member of the Womans Auxiliary Gold Star of Woodsfield. Her husband James Chester Mercer died May 9, 1956.
            She is survived by two sons, Ellis, ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> She is survived by two sons, Ellis, >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 of Malaga, Ohio and Jim of Jerusalem Route 1; four daughters, Mrs. Elwood (Bonnie) Egger of Marysville, Mrs. Ralph (Lodena) Christman, Mrs. Clayton (Nancy) Crum, Mrs. Bert (Emma) Bates all of Jerusalem, 18 grandchildren, 14 great-grandchildren, also one foster sister, Mrs. Earl (Edna) Carpenter of Summerfield, Ohio route 1.
            Five children are deceased, Opal, Betty, Joseph, Donald, and Martha Lou; also two brothers and two sisters.
 Friends called Tuesday 2-4 and 7-9 at the Brubach Funeral home in Summerfield.
             Services were held Wednesday at 1 p.m. at the ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> Five children are deceased, Opal, Betty, Joseph, Donald, and Martha Lou; also two brothers and two sisters.
Friends called Tuesday 2-4 and 7-9 at the Brubach Funeral home in Summerfield.

            James ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> James >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 and Ocie Carpenter Mercer
1930 Ohio Census: Crawford Co., Chatfield District 13 cp 3
James (age 29 yrs.) was living w/ wife, Ocie (age 25 yrs.) and children: Donald (6 yrs.), Joseph (4 yrs.), Ellis (2 yrs.), and Bonnie (7 mo.) on Lykens and New Washington Rd., in Chatfield, Crawford County, Ohio. Mercer, Samuel

            Samuel Donald Mercer, 44, ======= JA'> Samuel Donald Mercer, 44, >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 of Jerusalem Route 1, a former employee of Goodyear Aircraft Company in Akron, died Monday morning, September 16, 1968, at 6:30 o'clock in Barnesville General Hospital where he had been a patient several days with a heart condition.

            He ======= JA'> He >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 was born October 13, 1923, in Monroe County, a son of Mrs. Ocie Carpenter Mercer, of Jerusalem Route 1, and the late Chester Mercer. Mr. Mercer was an army veteran, serving in the late 1940s.

            In ======= JA'> In >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 addition to his mother he is survived by his widow, the former Frances Mellinger; a daughter, Bonnie of the home; a son, Mike of Jerusalem; five sisters, Mrs. Bonnie Egger and Mrs. Martha Lou Betts both of Marysville, Ohio; Mrs. Lodena Christman, Mrs. Nancy Crum and Mrs. Emma Bates, all of Jerusalem; and an uncle, Roy Carpenter of Jerusalem.

            Funeral ======= JA'> Funeral >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 services were held this Thursday afternoon at one o'clock in the Brubach Funeral Home at Summerfield, with Rev. Richard Perkins officiating. Burial was in the Calais Cemetery.

Source: The Monroe County Beacon, September 19, 1968.

Messenger, Michael,Published--May 19, 2004
 Michael ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> Michael >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Messenger has been named senior student for May. He has been a member of Future Farmers of America during all 4 years of high school. This year he has also served the club as president. Michael's other honors include State Future Fathers of America degree, 5 individuals awards in the State Livestock Contest, member of the 3rd place team in the State Livestock Contest, winner of the Belmont County Showman of Showman Contest. He has also attended the State and National Future Farmers of America Conventions. He plans to attend Belmont Tech and become an electrician. Michael's parents are Kathy and Dan Messenger.
 
 
Messenger, Susan Ann and Carl Melvin Davis
Into this holy estate this man and this woman come to be united. The Wedding of Miss Susan Ann Messenger and Mr. Carl Melvin Davis on Saturday, the ninth of July nineteen hundred and seventy-seven at two-thirty o'clock at the Trinity United Church of Christ, Lewisville, Ohio. Minister: The Reverend H. Nippert, III. Organist: Mrs. Nancy Rubel. Source: Marriage announcement.

Miles, Ruth Ellen and Elwood Baker, Jr.
            Saturday evening, June 12, 1954, Miss Ruth Ellen Miles, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Charles Miles, of Batesville, Ohio was united in marriage with Mr. Elwood Baker, Jr., son of Mr. and Mrs. Elwood Baker of Lewisville, Ohio, Route 1. The open Church wedding took place at half after seven oclock with the Reverend Robert Zinmeister performing the double ring ceremony in the Batesville Methodist Church. Wedding music was furnished by Mr. Hubert Watson, of Quaker City, Ohio at the piano, and Mrs. Francis Vaness of Quaker City, the soloist, who sang I Love You Truly, Because and Ill Be Faithful.
            To ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> Saturday evening, June 12, 1954, Miss Ruth Ellen Miles, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Charles Miles, of Batesville, Ohio was united in marriage with Mr. Elwood Baker, Jr., son of Mr. and Mrs. Elwood Baker of Lewisville, Ohio, Route 1. The open Church wedding took place at half after seven o clock with the Reverend Robert Zinmeister performing the double ring ceremony in the Batesville Methodist Church. Wedding music was furnished by Mr. Hubert Watson, of Quaker City, Ohio at the piano, and Mrs. Francis Vaness of Quaker City, the soloist, who sang I Love You Truly, Because and I ll Be Faithful.
To >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 the strains of the traditional Wedding March, the bride entered the Church on the arm of her father who gave her in marriage.
            Preceding ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> Preceding >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 the bride to the altar were her three attendants: Miss Norma Starr, maid of honor; Miss Mary Casey, of Shelby, Ohio, and Miss Marlene Rataiczak, of Martins Ferry.
            Byron Baker, the grooms cousin, of Sharon, Ohio, served as best man, and the ushers were Donald Stephen and Robert Harris, of Barnesville, Ohio.
            For the reception which was held in the brides home, immediately following the ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> Byron Baker, the groom s cousin, of Sharon, Ohio, served as best man, and the ushers were Donald Stephen and Robert Harris, of Barnesville, Ohio.
For the reception which was held in the bride s home, immediately following the >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 ceremony, Mrs. Ralph House, of Canton, Ohio; Mrs. Charles Womer, of North Salem; Mrs. Harold Gregor, of Marietta, Ohio; Mrs. Kathryn Ankrom and Miss Mary House, of Quaker City, Route one, serves as aides.
            Since ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> Since >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 their return from their wedding trip, the bride and groom are residing at 415 East Church street, Barnesville.
            The ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> The >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 new Mrs. Baker is a 1952 graduate of Batesville high school, Batesville, Ohio and is employed at Barnesville Manufacturing Company.
            Mr. ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> Mr. >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Baker was graduated from Lewisville high school in 1947 and served two years in the United States Army. He is now employed as a truck driver for B. K. Stephens of Barnesville.
Source: The Monroe County Beacon, Woodsfield, Ohio, Monday, Aug. 16, 1954.

======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711
Milhoan, Joan B.
Source--Monroe County Beacon   Woodsfield, Ohio
======= style='mso-spacerun:yes'> Woodsfield, Ohio >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711
Published--December 9, 2004
 
======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711
Milhoan, Joan Baker, 74, Canton, died December 1, 2004 in Aultman Hospital, Canton following a brief illness
She was born in Beallsville, September 3, 1930, a daughter of the late Ensel and Bessie Baker.
She had been a resident of Canton since 1951 and was a member of the First Christian Church in Beallsville.
Surviving are  ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'>Surviving are >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 her son and daughter-in-law, Douglas and Jennifer Milhoan; granddaughter, Grace Milhoan, all of North Canton; brother and sister-in-law, Robert and Louise Baker of Cleveland.
In addition to her parents, she was preceded in death by her husband, Donald G. Milhoan, who died June 27, 1994; two sisters, Lillian Goettel and Melba Outland.
Funeral services were held December 6 at Harper Funeral Home, Beallsville, with Wayne Clark officiating.
Burial followed in Beallsville Cemetery.
Memorial contributions may be made to the charity of the donor's choice.

Woodsfield, Ohio, December 28, 1864
               Samuel C. Milhorn and Melissa J. Beaver of Monroe Co. were married Dec. 22, 1864, by John BEARDMORE, Esq. 
======= style='mso-tab-count:1'> Samuel C. Milhorn and Melissa J. Beaver of Monroe Co. were married Dec. 22, 1864, by John BEARDMORE, Esq. >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711
 
Millbaugh, Charles H." Dutch"
            Charles ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> Charles >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 H. ''Dutch'' Millbaugh helped sculpt the local skyline. The Independence carpenter helped build Riverfront Stadium (now Cinergy Field), the Brent Spence Bridge, the PrOctoberer & Gamble building and the W. C. Beckjord power plant in New Richmond, Ohio.
            ''He ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> ''He >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 liked being outdoors and he was a hard worker,'' said a daughter, Ethel Messer of Union.
            ''He ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> ''He >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 came from a hardworking German family, and he was talented at it. He didn't have but a fourth-grade education, but he could read a blueprint as good as anybody else.''
            Mr. ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> Mr. >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Millbaugh died Monday night (4 May 1998) at the Florence Park Care Center. He was 85 years old. Mr. Millbaugh was born and reared in Woodsfield, Ohio. He was noted for the private homes he helped build in Northern Kentucky.
            ''He ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> ''He >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 did the plumbing and the concrete - he could do everything,'' said Mrs. Messer. After he joined Cincinnati Carpenter Union Local No. 2., Mr. Millbaugh helped build local landmarks. He retired about 30 years ago, then managed Edroy Court Apartments in Cincinnati. He was a member of the Independence Baptist Church and enjoyed hunting deer.
            ''He ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> ''He >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 liked horses,'' Mrs. Messer said. ''He wasn't a betting man, but he loved a good horse race and a beautiful horse.
            ''He ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> ''He >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 was very outgoing and friendly. He always made people feel good about themselves.'' Mr. Millbaugh's wife, Martha Stadig Millbaugh, died in 1984.
            Other ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> Other >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 survivors include sons Charles E. Millbaugh of Independence and David Millbaugh of Mishawaka, Ind.; a daughter, Vickie Barnes of Wilder; a stepdaughter, Margaret King of Cincinnati; eight grandchildren, eight step-grandchildren, 15 great-grandchildren, 15 step-great-grandchildren and two step-great-great-grandchildren.
            Services ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> Services >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 will be at 11 a.m. Friday at Allison and Rose Funeral Home in Covington. Visitation will be from 4 to 8 p.m. Thursday at the funeral home. Burial will be in Floral Hills Cemetery in Taylor Mill.
Source: The Kentucky Post - 6 May 1998 (According to SSDI: Charles H. Millbaugh was born on 13 Aug 1912.)
 
Miller, A. B.

Miller, Abraham
            Birth: ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> Birth: >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 December 1, 1835 in Bethel Township, Monroe County, Ohio
Death: March 27, 1906, in Bethel Township, Monroe County, Ohio
Burial: March 1906, Miller Cemetery, Bethel Township, Monroe County, Ohio
Father: Frederick Miller b: September 12, 1810, in York Township, Belmont County, Ohio. Mother: Nancy Sailor b: September 8, 1812, in Guernsey [later Monroe, now Noble] County, Ohio. Marriage: Deborah A. Sailor born: June 26, 1843 in Bethel Township, Monroe County, Ohio. Married: about 1860, in Monroe County, Ohio.

Miller, Andrew and Joan Kuhn
            In St. Josephs Catholic Church, Burkhart, Ohio, Saturday morning, June ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> In St. Joseph s Catholic Church, Burkhart, Ohio, Saturday morning, June >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 seventeenth, nineteen hundred and fifty, Miss Joan Kuhn, the daughter of Mrs. Edna Masciarelli, of Lewisville, Ohio, became the bride of Andrew Miller, son of Mr. and Mrs. Alex Miller, of Harriettsville, Ohio.
            The double ring ceremony and Nuptial High Mass were solemnized at nine oclock by the Reverend Joseph Finan.
            Mrs. Howard Rucker, organist, played the traditional wedding marches for the processional and recessional. Dale Latimer, vocalist, sang Ave Maria at the Offertory, being accompanied by Gene Huffman. The hymn On This Day Oh Beautiful Mother was sung by the Burkhart Girls choir at the conclusion of the ceremony.
            Miss ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> The double ring ceremony and Nuptial High Mass were solemnized at nine o clock by the Reverend Joseph Finan.
Mrs. Howard Rucker, organist, played the traditional wedding marches for the processional and recessional. Dale Latimer, vocalist, sang Ave Maria at the Offertory, being accompanied by Gene Huffman. The hymn On This Day Oh Beautiful Mother was sung by the Burkhart Girls choir at the conclusion of the ceremony.
Miss >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Mary Evelyn Kuhn, maid of honor, wore a gown of blue marquisette over a taffeta slip, styled with a modified hoop skirt.
            Ralph ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> Ralph >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Miller served his brother as best man. Ushers were Ward Wilson and b, of Summerfield.
            A reception was held in the parish Hall. Assisting at the reception were the members of Mrs. Masciarellis club. Immediately following the dinner the gifts were opened. Gene Huffman softly played a medley of appropriate selections during the dinner. In the evening a round and square dance was held. As the bride and groom entered the hall the orchestra played here Comes the Bride.

Miller, Arthur L.
            Woodsfield, ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> Woodsfield, >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Ohio - Arthur L. Miller, 87, of Miller Road died Wednesday (September 10, 2003) at the Morgantown (W.Va.) Trauma Center as a result of a farming accident. He was born November 1, 1915, in Monroe County to Leonard Miller and Anna Hughes Miller. He was a member of St. John the Baptist Catholic Church of Miltonsburg and was a retired carpenter of Local 186 of Steubenville, Ohio. He enjoyed playing cards with his friends, pitching horseshoes and farming.
            He is ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> He is >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 survived by his wife of 63 years, Ruth Anna Gallagher Miller; five sons, David H. Miller at home, Gregory Arthur Miller and his friend, Barb Garey, of Woodsfield, Mark Leon Miller of Woodsfield, Alan Christopher Miller and his wife, Patti, of Stoutsville, Ohio, and Brett Joseph Miller and his wife, Wilda, of Woodsfield; five daughters, Patricia Rush and her husband, Paul, of Woodsfield, Linda Kahrig and her husband, Meredith, of Woodsfield, Wanda Monahan and her husband, James, of Barnesville, Marilyn Ruth Wells of Wooster, and Kimberly Johnston and her husband, Jim, of Powell, Ohio; one sister, Mrs. Elmer (Helen) Thonen of Mount Pleasant, Ohio; 19 grandchildren; and 24 great-grandchildren.
            He ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> He >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 was preceded in death by his parents; one sister, Eloise Archer; and three brothers, Paul, Eugene and Henry Miller.
            Mass ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> Mass >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 of Christian burial will be conducted at 10:30 a.m. Saturday at St. John the Baptist Catholic Church in Miltonsburg with Father David Gaydosik officiating. Burial is in the church cemetery. Friends will be received from 2 to 4 and 7 to 9 p.m. today at Bauer-Turner Funeral Home at 100 S. Paul St., Woodsfield, where a vigil service will be held at 8:30 p.m. today.
Source: The Marietta Times, dated Friday, September 12, 2003.

Miller, Barbara Jean Ackerman     
            Elect Barbara Ackerman, Democrat for Clerk of Courts
            I am ======= 1'>
Elect Barbara Ackerman, Democrat for Clerk of Courts
I am >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Barbara Ackerman, humbly asking for your vote on March 2 for the Clerk of Courts of the Common Pleas. I will bring 12 years experience gained by working in the Clerk of Courts Office for the former Clerk, Dorothy Anderson. I was a hardworking, dedicated and trustworthy County employee who gave 100% to her job. I was proficient in both the legal and title divisions.
            I have been married to my husband, ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> I have been married to my husband, >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 John, for thirty years and have worked for him in our insurance business for the past 18 years. We live on a farm just north of Woodsfield on State Route 800. We have reared two daughters, who are Ohio State University graduates, and who both work and live in Columbus, Ohio.
            I am serving as the treasurer for the ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> I am serving as the treasurer for the >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Monroe County Agricultural Society, a Director and Information Coordinator for the Monroe County Farm Bureau.
            I have worked closely with people in ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> I have worked closely with people in >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 these jobs which gives me the advantage to continue working with the public to serve their needs.
            I have been entrusted to receipt the Agricultural Societys money, pay bills and work with the State Auditors to balance their accounts.
            My managerial skills, computer knowledge and accounting experience all help to make me the best candidate.
            As your Clerk, I would be a courteous ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> I have been entrusted to receipt the Agricultural Society s money, pay bills and work with the State Auditors to balance their accounts.
My managerial skills, computer knowledge and accounting experience all help to make me the best candidate.
As your Clerk, I would be a courteous >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 and professional servant of the County. Thank you for your consideration.
Source: The Monroe County Beacon, dated Thursday, January 22, 2004.

Miller, inducted >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 November 18, 1941, was sent overseas in April, 1942. He was on combat duty nine months in New Guinea, and at present is somewhere in Australia.

Miller, Deborah Ann (nee Kinkade)
             "Once again the unwelcome visitor Death ======= style='mso-spacerun:yes'> "Once again the unwelcome visitor Death >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 has visited our home and chose as its victim Deborah Ann Kinkade, daughter of Andrew and Ann Kinkade. She was born near Woodsfield, Ohio, June 26, 1843, and departed this life on January 17, 1931, being at the time of her death 88 years, six months and twenty-two days.
            "She ======= style='mso-spacerun:yes'> "She >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 was united in marriage to Abraham Miller July 13, 1861. To this union were born seven children, four daughters and three sons. Her husband and one daughter Cynthia preceded her in death several years ago. Those who are left to mourn her departure are Mrs. Isabelle Miller Wise, of Newport, Ohio; William Miller, of Harlem, Montana; Mrs. Henson Jackson, of Rinard Mills; Thomas E. Miller of Wingett Run, Ohio; Rachel Ann and Benjamin of the home; also twenty-two grandchildren, 42 great grandchildren and two great great grandchildren, and a host of other relatives and friends.

He was preceded in death by a brother, >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 David Miller, and a sister, Fannie Miller. Miller, Floyd H. - betty type
Miller, Geneva and Virgil E. Carpenter
             Miss Geneva Miller, the daughter of Mr. and ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> Miss Geneva Miller, the daughter of Mr. and >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Mrs. Adam Miller, of Woodsfield, Route 3, exchanged vows with Sergeant Virgil E. Carpenter, son of Mr. and Mrs. Clifford Carpenter, also of Woodsfield, Route 3, at 1 o'clock Saturday afternoon, March 10th, with Minister J. V. A. Traylor officiating the single ring ceremony at his home on Eastern Avenue, Woodsfield.
             The bride was attired in a jersey and net ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> The bride was attired in a jersey and net >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 floor-length gown of Rose-pink and carried a bouquet of red Roses and white carnations.
             The bridesmaid, Miss Viola Carpenter, of ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> The bridesmaid, Miss Viola Carpenter, of >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Cleveland, sister of the groom, wore a floor length gown of pink lace and chiffon. Her corsage was of sweet peas and carnations. Irvin Carpenter, of Cleveland served as Sergeant Carpenter's best man. Sergeant Carpenter has been in the service since January 16, 1942, training as a paratrooper in Helena, Montana. He spent five months in The North Pacific, and later was sent to North Africia, then to Italy. He was wounded on the Anzic Beachhead in Italy, and is now recuperating at Percy Jones Hospital, Battle Creek, Michigan. Source: The Spirit of Democracy, 1953.

1960

MARRIAGE

Miller, Linda Caroline-Kahrig

     Miss Linda Caroline Miller, ======= JA'> Miss Linda Caroline Miller, >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Arthur L. Miller, of Woodsfield, Route 2, and Mr. Meredith Philip Kahrig, son of Mr. and Mrs. George W. Kahrig, of Lewisville, Route two were united in marriage Saturday morning, May twenty first at ten o'clock at St. John's Church, Miltonsburg. Reverend Howard T. Litts officiated at the double ring ceremony.

     The bride chose a white floor ======= JA'> The bride chose a white floor >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 length gown of nylon and lace with bouffant skirt over nylon net and taffeta skirts. The fitted bodice was designed with a scalloped neckline edged with sequins and had three quarter length sleeves. Her veil was nylon tulle with a crown of nylon lace and seed pearls. She carried a bridal bouquet of white pompons, carnations and pink sweetheart roses with showers of white ribbon and lilies of the valley. Her jewelry was a wristwatch, graduation gift of the groom, and pearl necklace, a gift of her parents. The tradition of something old, new, borrowed and blue was carried out.

      Miss Patricia Ann Miller, ======= JA'> Miss Patricia Ann Miller, >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 sister of the bride was bridesmaid and her dress was pink lace and nylon with pink accessories. She carried a bouquet of pink, white and yellow pompons and carnations.

     Larry James Gallagher of ======= JA'> Larry James Gallagher of >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Barnesville, uncle of the bride served Mr. Kahrig as best man.

      The mothers of the bride and ======= JA'> The mothers of the bride and >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 groom were attired in blue dresses and their corsages were red carnations.

     A buffet luncheon for the ======= JA'> A buffet luncheon for the >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 wedding party and the members of the immediate families was served immediately following the ceremony at the home of bride's parents.

     On Saturday evening, the new Mr. ======= JA'> On Saturday evening, the new Mr. >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 and Mrs. Kahrig were honored with a shower given at Fellowship Hall, Lewisville. They were the recipients of many lovely gifts.

     Mrs. Kahrig is a 1960 graduate ======= JA'> Mrs. Kahrig is a 1960 graduate >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 of Woodsfield High School. Mr. Kahrig is a 1958 graduate of Lewisville High School. They are residing in their new trailer home at Clarington, Ohio where Mr. Kahrig is employed with the Chapin and Chapin Construction Company.

 
Miller, Lucy (nee Wade)
            Lewisville Ohio - Lucy Miller, 61, of ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> Lewisville Ohio - Lucy Miller, 61, of >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 32031 Hartshorn Ridge Road died at 5:07 a.m. Saturday (March 8, 2003) at Grant Medical Center in Columbus. She was born December 14, 1941, in Bergolz, Ohio, to Frank Tennison and Catherine E. Laney Wade. She was a homemaker and a foster mother of 35 years. She was a member of Stafford United Methodist Church at Stafford and Order of Eastern Star 584, Masterton Chapter, at Lebanon, Ohio.
            She is survived by her husband, Henry ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> She is survived by her husband, Henry >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Miller, Jr., whom she married on June 13, 1963; one son, Henry Timothy Lee Miller and his wife, Mary Lou, of Woodsfield; three daughters, Lea Kay Booth and her husband, Jerald, of Whipple, Katrina Misty Dawn Miller at home, and Connie Sue Ramsey and her husband, Robert, of Bedford, Ohio; her father of Summerfield; her mother of Lewisville; three sisters, Bonnie Crock and her husband, Leander, of Caldwell, Saundra Hooper and her husband, Jack, of Cumberland, Ohio, and Sherry Wade of Caldwell; five brothers, Frank Tennison Wade and his wife, Marjorie, of Bergolz, Ohio, Will Wade and his wife, M. Jeannette, of Summerfield, Robert Lee Wade and his wife, Joyce, of Cumberland, Grover Wade of Summerfield and James Newland and his wife, Connie, of Summerfield; her stepmother, Sue Wade of Summerfield; several grandchildren, including Ashley and Marlee Miller, Kourtney and Tanner Booth and Robert Ramsey, Jr.; several nieces and nephews; and countless children whom she raised at the family home.
            Services are at 1 p.m. Tuesday at ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> Services are at 1 p.m. Tuesday at >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Watters Funeral Home in Woodsfield with Pastor Gary Fitzgerald officiating. Burial is in Stafford Cemetery in Stafford, Ohio. Friends will be received from 2 to 4 and 7 to 9 p.m. today at the funeral home. Eastern Star services are at 7:30 p.m. today at the funeral home.
Source: The Marietta Times, Monday, March 10, 2003.

Miller, Margaret E.

Miller/Mueller, Margaret Claus
  The ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> The >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Miltonsburg community suffered a severe loss in the passing of Mrs. Margaret Claus, aged 76, at her home Friday near the noon hour, following a few days suffering of intestinal ailment. Hers was a life of real service to humanity, and her many kindly acts and deeds will find permanent lodgment in the memory of those befriended. Four children are bereft, Dora of the home; Mrs. Gertrude Weber and Mrs. Lewis Christman, of Lewisville; and Mrs. Louise Feldner, of Woodsfield; also two sisters, Mrs. Mary Lohri, of Trail Run; Mrs. Elizabeth Pfalzgraf, of Parkersburg, and one brother John in California.
   Funeral ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> Funeral >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 services in charge of her pastor, Rev. Chester Guam were held at Miltonsburg Evangelical Church on Sunday and were largely attended. We expect to publish obituary next week. Source: The Spirit of Democracy, November 13, 1929.
 

1959

MOTHER'S DAY

Miller, Mary Christman

     Sunday is Mother's Day all over ======= JA'> Sunday is Mother's Day all over >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 the United States, mothers will receive recognition. Even though they may be honored on other occasions during this year - this is different. This is their day!

     A typical mother to be remembered ======= JA'> A typical mother to be remembered >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 this week is Mrs. Mary Christman Miller of Jerusalem. She is like the mother pictured in a poem once written by Mary Dow Brine:

"The woman was old and ragged and gray

And bent with the chill of the winter's day.

The street was wet with a recent snow

And the woman's feet were aged and slow."

     The poem tells the story of a ======= JA'> The poem tells the story of a >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 lad who paused to help the aged lady across the street and his comment to his companions was "She's somebody's mother, boys, you know. For all she's aged and poor and slow."

     ======= JA'> >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Mrs. Mary Christman Miller is somebody's mother. She differs from the poem in the respect that she is not "ragged and poor," and her 88 years have not dimmed her countenance nor her spirit.

     A true mother, this kindly old ======= JA'> A true mother, this kindly old >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 lady lives alone in a neat little cottage. And her time is not idly spent. With deft fingers, she still pieces and quilts bed covers for her grandchildren and great-grandchildren. She has done some for each of her own children.

     Of Dutch descent, Mrs. Miler has ======= JA'> Of Dutch descent, Mrs. Miler has >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 spent her young womanhood and reared her six children in southeastern Ohio. The wife of a hard-working farmer, she never shirked her share of the work -she never hired a baby sitter for her children -she never employed the modern conveniences that help a mother today.

     It is exemplary of her mother heart to show ======= JA'> It is exemplary of her mother heart to show >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 her concern about her loved ones. She has a keen memory and can name each of her 19 grandchildren, tell where they are and what they are doing, and name her 11 great-grandchildren.

     Although her advanced age and ======= JA'> Although her advanced age and >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 years of hard work have left her slightly stooped, she does her quilting without the aid of glasses, and hears very well.

     Each year she has her garden and ======= JA'> Each year she has her garden and >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 does her own housework. Her home reflects the manner in which she has lived her life clean and orderly.

     This Sunday there will possibly ======= JA'> This Sunday there will possibly >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 be many Mrs. Millers honored, there will be many aged mothers honored. But few will be more deserving than this Mrs. Miller whose mother-love is reflected in her countenance and her eyes as she talks of her own children. Toil has knarled the fingers but with a labor of love she stitches quilt, and these will be cherished for many years by those who receive them.

 
Miller, Mary Ann Crock
            Mrs. ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> Mrs. >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Mary Ann Miller, nee Crock, widow of the late John MILLER of Miltonsburg died at the home of her son Andrew Miller in Barnesville, Ohio, April 4, 1922, at 8:55 a.m., aged 75 years, 7 months and 12 days.
            Mrs. Miller was a devoted member of St. Johns Catholic church at Miltonsburg, and a woman of fine character.
            Among ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> Mrs. Miller was a devoted member of St. John s Catholic church at Miltonsburg, and a woman of fine character.
Among >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 the immediate relatives left to mourn her loss are 8 children - Andrew Miller of Barnesville; Mrs. Michael Wahl of Woodsfield Route 3; Edward Miller of Jerusalem Route 4; Mrs. Fred Wahl of Miltonsburg; Sebastian Miller of White Lake, South Dakota; Leonard Miller of Jerusalem Route 4 and Mrs. William Reischman of Barnesville. Also one sister and one brother - Mrs. Michael Fornes of Columbus, Ohio, and Mr. Casper Crock of Woodsfield, besides many other relatives and friends. Two children, Mrs. George Burkhart and Mrs. George Miller preceded her in death.
            Funeral ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> Funeral >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 services were held Thurs. morning, April 6th, at the Church of the Assumption in Barnesville, Ohio, conducted by Rev. William Robben and interment was made at Miltonsburg.
Source: The Spirit of Democracy, Woodsfield, Ohio, Thursday, April 13, 1922.
 
Miller, Mary Elisabeth Latta
               Mary Elisabeth Latta, nee Miller, ======= style='mso-tab-count:1'> Mary Elisabeth Latta, nee Miller, >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 83, of Fort Myers Beach, Florida, formerly of Canton, died Sunday, October 18, at Marymount Hospital in Cleveland. She graduated from Canton South High School and Canton Actual Business College then worked for the Celina Insurance Company before founding the Latta Insurance Agency. She was a past president of the Canton Garden Club and active in Trinity Brethren Church.
               Preceded in death by son Jerry ======= style='mso-tab-count:1'> Preceded in death by son Jerry >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Richard, she is survived by husband Vernon; daughter Betty (Don) Kitchen of Twinsburg; brothers John (Elsie) Miller of East Sparta, and Robert (Jean) Miller of Altamonte Springs, Florida; grandchildren Kelli (Randy) Ross of Indianapolis and Jim Kitchen of Costa Mesa, California; sisters-in-law January Latta and Thelma Latta of Canton; and loving nieces and nephews.
               A memorial service will be at 11 ======= style='mso-tab-count:1'> A memorial service will be at 11 >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 a.m. Saturday with family visitation at 10:30 a.m. at Faith Methodist Church on Post Road in Twinsburg. In lieu of flowers, should remembrances wish to be made, donations can be sent in Mary's name to First Baptist Church, P.O. BOX 2402, Fort Myers Beach, Florida, 33932.
Source: The Canton Repository, October 21, 1998.

Miller, Matthew Dale--Stewart
Source--Monroe County Beacon    Woodsfield, Ohio
Published--Thursday   October 1, 1998
 
======= style='mso-spacerun:yes'> Woodsfield, Ohio
Published--Thursday October 1, 1998
>>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711
Stacy O'dale Stewart and Matthew Dale Miller were united in marriage September 26 at 1:30 p.m. in the Moundsville Baptist Church in Moundsville with Minister T. Thomas Steele officiating a double ring ceremony. The bride was given in marriage by her father.
The bride is the daughter of Larry and Janice (Susie) Stewart of Sardis. The bridegroom's parents are Vickie Wolfe Meyers of Moundsville and Dale Kenneth of Powhatan Point.
Rebecca Stewart was Matron of Honor and (Buddy) Forrest Gallaher, Jr. served as Best Man. Other attendants were Amber Stewart, Sherry Stutzman, Angela Stewart,(in a memorial), Mark Mitchell, Vince Price, <<<<<<< HEAD and  Larry Stewart, Jr.  Summer Jeffers was flower girl and James ======= and Larry Stewart, Jr. Summer Jeffers was flower girl and James >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Jeffers was ring bearer. Floor ushers were Drew Jeffers, Leonard Stewart III, Ricky Stewart and Michael Stewart.
Other bridal services were attended to by Candy Maynard, Jessica Maynard, Shelly Stewart and Stephanie Stewart, in the ballon send-off, guest book and thank you scrolls.
A reception was held at the Captina Sportsman Club in Powhatan.
The bride is a 1996 graduate of River High School and is employed at Ormet Credit Union in Clarington. She is also taking a correspondence course as a veterinarian assistant.
Her husband is a 1995 graduate of River High School and is employed by Lynd-Co, Incorporated.
Following the wedding trip, the couple will reside in Powhatan Point.

Miller, Mildred, nee Phillips
Source--Daily Jeffersonian     Cambridge, Ohio
======= style='mso-spacerun:yes'> Cambridge, Ohio >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711
Published--April 5, 1984
            Mrs. ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> Mrs. >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Mildred Miller,84, of Findlay, formerly of Monroe County, died March 30 in Blanchard Valley Hospital in Findlay. Born September 16, 1899 in Monroe County to John W. and Lane Brown Phillips, she married Fred Miller, January 24, 1917. He died April 7, 1963.
Surviving are two daughters, Mrs. Zelemma Wiseman of Bucyrus , Mrs. Olive Szafranic of Carnegie, Pennsylvania; three sons, Hubert of Mohave Valley, Arizona, Roger of North Baltimore, Heber of Findlay; 21 grandchildren;12 great-grandchildren; two great-great-grandchildren.
Services were held April 3 at Kirk-Patrick Behnke Funeral Home in Findlay. Interment was in Weaver Cemetery, Wood County.

Dick , 68, of Pine Grove, West >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Virginia, died Wednesday, July 20, 1994, at home. He was a retired employee of Consolidated Natural Gas Supply Corporation., Hastings, West Virginia. 1947

VALEDICTORIAN/SALUTATORIAN

Milton, Beulah Mae and Wilda Irene Heft

     Beulah Mae Milton, youngest ======= JA'> Beulah Mae Milton, youngest >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 daughter of Mr. and Mrs. F. O. Milton of Lewisville Route, was chosen valedictorian of the 1947 graduating class of Lewisville High School. Wilda Irene Heft, youngest daughter of Mr. and Mrs. John Heft also of Lewisville Route was the salutatorian.

     Both girls have high scholastic records, and ======= JA'> Both girls have high scholastic records, and >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 are prominent members of the younger set. Beulah and Wilda's plans for the future and indefinite.

     There were twenty-three seniors ======= JA'> There were twenty-three seniors >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 in this year's class, one of the largest ever to graduated form Lewisville High School.

             She was born in Monroe County, March 12, 1894, ======= JA'> She was born in Monroe County, March 12, 1894, >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 the daughter of Abraham Lincoln and Anna House Slack. Mrs. Milton was a member of the Bracken Ridge Methodist Church.

Minder, Betty Lou Hines
               Woodsfield, Ohio - Betty Lou ======= style='mso-tab-count:1'> Woodsfield, Ohio - Betty Lou >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Minder Hines, 64, of South Paul Street died Sunday (Feb. 8, 2004) at Wetzel County Hospital in New Martinsville, West Virginia.
She was born June 19, 1939, in Cameron, Ohio, to Robert Wayne and Grace E. Twinen Minder. She was co-owner of the former Pioneer Motel, Belmont Grill and Restaurant and The Pub in Woodsfield, and also The Arnettie's Restaurant in New Martinsville, W.Va. She was a lifetime member of the Cameron Church of Christ.
               She is survived by her mother of ======= style='mso-tab-count:1'> She is survived by her mother of >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Cameron; one daughter, Shannon of Portland, Ore.; three brothers, Joe Minder of Woodsfield, Robert Dean Minder of Cameron, and Garry Minder of Woodsfield; two sisters, Linda Canter of Lewisville, Ohio, and Mary Ann Robbins of Gastonia, S.C.; five nieces; and three nephews. She was preceded in death by her father; and one brother, Michael "Moe" Minder.
               Services are at 1 p.m. Thursday ======= style='mso-tab-count:1'> Services are at 1 p.m. Thursday >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 at Bauer-Turner Funeral Home at 100 S. Paul St., Woodsfield. Burial is in Cameron Cemetery in Cameron. Friends will be received from 6 to 9 p.m. Wednesday at the funeral home.
Source: The Marietta Times, dated, February 10, 2004.

Miracle, Evelyn and Thurman Weber
            Miss Evelyn Miracle, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Roy Miracle, of Lewisville, Star Route, was united in marriage with Mr. Thurman Weber, son of Mr. and Mrs. Floyd Weber, of near Lewisville, at two-thirty oclock on Sunday afternoon, April twenty-third, in the Methodist parsonage in Stafford.
            Reverend ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> Miss Evelyn Miracle, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Roy Miracle, of Lewisville, Star Route, was united in marriage with Mr. Thurman Weber, son of Mr. and Mrs. Floyd Weber, of near Lewisville, at two-thirty o clock on Sunday afternoon, April twenty-third, in the Methodist parsonage in Stafford.
Reverend >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Merle Long, pastor officiated at the double ring ceremony in the presence of the immediate families.
            The ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> The >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 bride chose her sister, Miss Virgene Miracle, as maid of honor, Earl Weber, of Newark, uncle of the groom served as best man.
            The bride was beautifully attired in a navy blue suit with navy and white accessories. An orchid corsage was chosen for her flower. She carried out the tradition of somethin old, somethin new, somethin borrowed, somethin blue, and a penny in her shoe.
            The ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> The bride was beautifully attired in a navy blue suit with navy and white accessories. An orchid corsage was chosen for her flower. She carried out the tradition of somethin old, somethin new, somethin borrowed, somethin blue, and a penny in her shoe.
The >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 maid of honor wore a gray suit with gay accessories and a corsage of red roses. Both the groom and best man wore light gray suits. Each wore carnation boutonnieres.
            Mrs. ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> Mrs. >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Miracle, Mother of the bride, was attired in a light tan suit with brown accessories and wore a corsage of white accessories and a corsage of red roses.
            The reception following the ceremony was held at the home of the brides parents.
            Mrs. Weber was graduated from Graysville High School, class of 48 and later from Bustin school of cosmetology in Columbus, Ohio.
