Miracle, Marilyn and John W. Stimpert
            On Saturday afternoon, September twenty-third nineteen hundred fifty at three oclock in Sutherland Church, Miss Marilyn Miracle, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> On Saturday afternoon, September twenty-third nineteen hundred fifty at three o clock in Sutherland Church, Miss Marilyn Miracle, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Ivan Miracle, of Clarington, Ohio and Mr. John W. Stimpert, son of Mr. and Mrs. Elmer Stimpert, of Lewisville, Ohio were united in marriage. The Reverend Merle Long of the Stafford charge, read the double ring ceremony in the presence of the immediate family. The Church was beautifully decorated with summer flowers. Miss Ruth Stimpert, sister of the groom, played an instrumental number and the wedding march.
            Given ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> Given >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 in marriage by her father, the bride wore white slipper satin fashioned with a long fitted bodice, closing in front with tiny self-covered buttons. The high neckline and long sleeves were finished with petal collar and cuffs. The full gathered skirt was floor length. The fingertip veil was lace edged and held in place by a ruffled net halo. She carried a white Bible topped with a purple-throated white orchid. For something old she had a handkerchief which <<<<<<< HEAD her great, great grandmother had given to the brides Grandmother Miracle.
            The ======= her great, great grandmother had given to the bride s Grandmother Miracle.
The >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 maid of honor, Miss Joan Mallett, wore light blue taffeta, similarly fashioned with low neck and cap sleeves. She carried an arm bouquet of pink roses with pink satin ribbon streamers.
            Mr. ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> Mr. >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Donald Stimpert served his brother as best man. Both wore grey suits with white carnation boutonnieres.
            At seven oclock in the evening a reception for one hundred guests was held at the home of the brides parents, who then resided in Lewisville. The table was ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> At seven o clock in the evening a reception for one hundred guests was held at the home of the bride s parents, who then resided in Lewisville. The table was >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 centered with a four-tiered wedding cake topped with a miniature bride and groom. For going away the bride wore a wind colored suit with navy accessories and the orchid from her corsage.
            Mrs. ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> Mrs. >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Stimpert is a graduate of Stafford high school and attended Bliss Business college. She is employed with the American Jersey Cattle Club in Columbus, Ohio.
            Mr. ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> Mr. >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Stimpert is a 1946 graduate of Lewisville high school, Lewisville, Ohio, spent three years with the U. S. Army. He is employed with the John Deere Manufacturing Company in Columbus and attending Ohio State university.
 
Miracle, Mildred (nee Warfield)
               Woodsfield, Ohio - Mildred ======= style='mso-tab-count:1'> Woodsfield, Ohio - Mildred >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Warfield Miracle, 97, of the Monroe County Care Center in Woodsfield, formerly of Stafford, died at 7:55 p.m. Saturday (August 17, 2002) at the center.

Miracle and his wife, Rebecca, of Clarington; two daughters, Evelyn Weber and her husband, Thurman, of Woodsfield and Virgene Mulford and her husband, Bush, of Naples, Fla.; nine grandchildren; 15 great-grandchildren; three step grandchildren; and two step great-grandchildren.
               On November. 29, 1924, she ======= style='mso-tab-count:1'> On November. 29, 1924, she >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 married Roy D. Miracle. He died May 18, 1994. She was also preceded in death by one sister, Bernice Odessa Miracle; and one brother, George Earl Warfield.

Miracle, Mr. and Mrs. Roy

Source: Monroe County Beacon, NOV. 21. 1974

 

     The children of Mr. and Mrs. Roy Miracle ======= style='mso-spacerun:yes'> The children of Mr. and Mrs. Roy Miracle >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 are observing their parents' fiftieth wedding anniversary Sunday, December 1st, with an open house. Relatives and friends are invited to visit with Roy and Mildred at Skyvue High School from 2:00 p.m. until 4:00 p.m. The Miracles request "no gifts."

     Mr. and Mrs. Miracle (the former Mildred ======= style='mso-spacerun:yes'> Mr. and Mrs. Miracle (the former Mildred >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Warfield) were married November 29, 1924 by the Rev. M. Danford in CaIdwell, Ohio.

     Both Mr. and Mrs. Miracle are retired school teachers. Mr. Miracle taught forty-five years in Monroe County, and Mrs. Miracle taught in Washington, Noble and Monroe Counties. The couple have lived  all  their  married  life  ======= style='mso-spacerun:yes'> Both Mr. and Mrs. Miracle are retired school teachers. Mr. Miracle taught forty-five years in Monroe County, and Mrs. Miracle taught in Washington, Noble and Monroe Counties. The couple have lived all their married life >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 in

Monroe County. They now live on Lewisville Route 2, near Stafford, where they keep busy with work on the farm and other hobbies. They are members of the Sutherland United Methodist Church and have always been active in church and community affairs.

     Receiving with the couple will be their ======= style='mso-spacerun:yes'> Receiving with the couple will be their >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 three children and their families: Mr. and Mrs. Donald Miracle, of Clarington, Ohio; Mr. and Mrs. Richard (Evelyn) Weber, of Lebanon, Ohio, and Mrs. Bush (Virgene) Mulford, of Naples, Florida. Nine grandchildren and two great grandsons complete the family circle.

 

 
Misch, Louise, nee Loughery
Source-the Herald Star     Steubenville, Ohio
======= style='mso-spacerun:yes'> Steubenville, Ohio >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711
Published--October 27, 2004
            WELLSBURG, ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> WELLSBURG, >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 West Virginia. - Louise Misch, 66, of Wellsburg died Sunday, October 24, 2004 at Allegheny General Hospital in Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania. She was born on September 5, 1938 in Benbush, West Virginia., a daughter of the late Herbert and Grace Carr Loughery. She is also preceded in death by three brothers, Edward, Herbert and Eugene Loughery. Louise was a homemaker and Christian by faith. Surviving is her husband of 45 years, Eugene Misch, whom she married April 3, 1959; three sons, Tom Misch and wife, Dorothy of Wellsburg, Kevin Misch of Columbus, Ohio and Kerry Misch at home; two daughters, Terry Goff and husband, Tom and Marla Jennings, both of Wellsburg; one brother, James "Jimmy" Loughery of Woodsfield, Ohio; three sisters, Susie Burnem of Wellsburg, Ethel Reid of Windsor Heights, West Virginia and Cleo Klages of Wellsburg; and five grandchildren, Amiee Misch, Jamie Goff, Gabriel Clymer, Ella Jen- nings and Richard Jennings. Friends will be received today from 7-9 p.m. and Wednesday, October 27, from 2-4 and 7-9 p.m. at the Chambers Funeral Home, 1030 Main Street, Wellsburg, where services will be held on Thursday, October 28, at 11 a.m. with Pastor James Seabright officiating. Interment will follow in Franklin Cemetery in Wellsburg. Memorial contributions may be made to Hancock County Autism Society of America, 277 Bennett Drive, Weirton, West <<<<<<< HEAD Virginia  26062.

Mitchell, James Richard
            James ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> James >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Richard Mitchell, 65, of Chicago, Illinois, died Aug. 5, 2004. He was born Dec. 31, 1938, a son of the late Kenneth Mitchell and Stella Brownfield Mitchell. He was a graduate of Bellaire High School and The Ohio State University where he earned dual degrees in music in 1961. Upon graduation, he embarked on what would become a 32 year career in shaping lives with the Findlay Ohio City Schools.
            Jim ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> Jim >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 was a gifted and caring teacher, a talented and respected performer. In addition to appearing in numerous orchestras, and being involved with countless musical endeavors in Ohio and the Chicago area, he was a long time principal oboist for the Springfield Ohio Symphony. He was an active Member of the International Double Reed Society and the Northern Illinois Gesneriad Society.                      James was preceded in death ======= style='mso-tab-count:2'> James was preceded in death >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 by his parents. He is survived by a sister, Sue Mitchell of San Francisco, Calif., paternal aunt, Pauline and family; maternal aunts, Bessie, Georgianna, June, and Marylou and families, and life partner, Rob Butler, all of Chicago, Illinois.
            James ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> James >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 had performances dedicated to him by Wheaton Illinois Symphony. He will have a performance dedicated by the Springfield Symphony on Saturday, October 2, 2004, and by the Skokie Valley Illinois Symphony on Sunday, November. 7, 2004. A memorial celebrating Jim's life will also take place in the Chicago area in the near future. A memorial service will be held on Saturday, Sept. 4, 2004, at 1 p.m., at Kelly-Kemp-Braido Funeral Home, 702 East Main St., Barnesville. Interment will follow at Calais Cemetery. In lieu of flowers, please send donations to the Ohio State University School of Music Scholarship Fund.
Source--Times Leader, Martins Ferry, Ohio. Published--September 4, 2004.

Mobberly, Audrey Evalee (nee Woodard)
            Audrey ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> Audrey >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Evalee Mobberly, 87, Lodi, formerly of Pleasant Grove, died June 6, 2002, at Galion Community Hospital, Galion. She was born June 6, 1915, in Graysville, a daughter of Jay and the late Freda Victoria Gray Nalley Woodard.
            She ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> She >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 was a homemaker all her life; was a member of the Pleasant Ridge Church of Christ, Graysville, Colrain Senior Citizens Center for many years, avid traveler and sports fan following Ohio State football and basketball. She enjoyed social events and was fun to be with.
             Surviving, in addition to her father, are two ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> Surviving, in addition to her father, are two >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 daughters and son-in-law, Mary Jane Mobberly, West Salem, Mrs. Charles (Sharon Kay) Robinson, Galion; four grandchildren, Robin R. Robinson, Thomas G. Robinson, Amber M. Means and Rhett E. Bainter; five great-grandchildren, Joshua T. Grieve, Cainon C. Means, Colton S. Means, Haley S. Bainter and Erica R. Bainter; Sister, June Rose Green Moss, Michigan.
            In ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> In >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 addition to her mother who died in 1997, at 100 years of age she was preceded in death by her husband, John Milton Mobberly, whom she married Sept. 21, 1935, and died in 1981; grandson, Jeffrey S. Ray in 1983; brother Roger Green.
            Friends were received an hour prior to ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> Friends were received an hour prior to >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 the service June 18 at Matteson Funeral Home, West Salem; later at the Pleasant Ridge Church of Christ, Graysville, with Rev. Jim Duty officiating. Burial in Pleasant Ridge Cemetery, Graysville.

Mobberly, F. Mabel Earley
            F. ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> F. >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Mabel Earley (nee Mobberly), 85, of 6416 East Ellis, Messa, Ariz., formerly of Monroe County and Wheeling, died Monday October. 4, 1999, in the Mesa Lutheran Hospital.  She was a retired secretary in Wheeling, and a member of the Church of Christ, Wheeling. 
            She ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> She >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 was preceded in death by her husband, Herman W. Earley in 1984; a son, Gerald W. Earley in 1969; her parents, Forrest and Annette Whitacre Mobberly; a sister.  Surviving are a son, Gene, of Mesa, Ariz.; ex-daughter-in-law, Jo Ann Hummel Earley of Lady Lake, Fla.; three grandchildren, Tracy Lyn Kent, Jeffrey Wayne Earley, Paige Ashle Earley; three great-grandchildren, William Ray Kent III, Zachariah Nicolas Earley, Jacob Roberto Earley. 
             Friends received 2-4 and 7-9 p.m. Thursday at ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> Friends received 2-4 and 7-9 p.m. Thursday at >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Watters Funeral Home, Woodsfield, where services will be held at 11 a.m. Friday.  Interment in Pleasant Ridge Cemetery, Graysville.

Mobberly, Forrest B. and Mary Margaret Mobberly (nee Dillon)

            "Two ======= "Times New Roman";mso-fareast-language:JA'> "Two >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Killed in Auto Accident near Newark, Ohio  Mr. & Mrs. Forrest Mobberly succumb after accident.  Mrs. Forrest Mobberly, daughter of Duncan Dillon of S. Main Street was instantly killed in an auto accident Wednesday.  Her husband, son of the late Mr. & Mrs. Milton Mobberly died Wednesday night in a Newark hospital having been critically injured in the wreck. 

            Mr. & Mrs. Mobberly together with Donald Calville, the ======= 1'> Mr. & Mrs. Mobberly together with Donald Calville, the >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 driver, and Miss Ruth Stallings and Mrs. Vincent Mascarilli, all of Steubenville, were enroute to Columbus when the accident occurred.  It is stated that their car skidded on slippery pavement and collided with a truck, near Kirkersville, about 15 miles south of Newark.

            Mr. & Mrs. Mobberly are survived by two children, in addition to many relatives in Woodsfield and Graysville communities.  Mrs. Mobberly was 42.                              The ======= 1'> Mr. & Mrs. Mobberly are survived by two children, in addition to many relatives in Woodsfield and Graysville communities.  Mrs. Mobberly was 42.   The >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 body of Mrs. Mobberly was brought to the home of her father this Thursday morning and the body of her husband will be brought to the Dillon home this afternoon.  No funeral arrangements have been made at this time.   

Source: The Spirit of Democracy, April 4, 1940

Double Funeral Held

            Double ======= "Times New Roman";mso-fareast-language:JA'> Double >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 funeral services held for Mr. & Mrs. Mobberly, victims in an auto accident were held Saturday afternoon.  Short services were held a the home of Mrs. Mobberly's father, Duncan Dillon of S. Main Street at 2:00 and were followed by final rites at the Methodist Church with Rev. Mr. Rogers of Weirton, W.Va. as the principal officiating minister.  Burial was made in Oak Lawn Cemetery in Weirton.

            Mr. & Mrs. Mobberly are survived by two daughters, ======= 1'> Mr. & Mrs. Mobberly are survived by two daughters, >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Mrs. Paul Gilmore of Springboro and Miss Bernadine of the home.

            Surviving Mrs. Mobberly besides her father Duncan Dillon, ======= 1'> Surviving Mrs. Mobberly besides her father Duncan Dillon, >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 are brothers Lawrence or Woodsfield and Guy of Stuebenville.  Surviving Mr. Mobberly, who was the son of late Mr. & Mrs. Milton Mobberly of Graysville, are the following brothers and sisters, Mrs. B. L. Allen, of Independence, Kansas, Mrs. J. W. Allen of Woodsfield, Ohio, Mrs. W. R. Coss, Mrs. Harry Scott, J. Foster Mobberly of Zanesville an Errett Mobberly of Graysville.

 
Mobberly, James F.
            Born: ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> Born: >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 September 1, 1895, died: July 6, 1989, residence: Woodsfield.
Source: Monroe County death records.
 
Marietta Times, Saturday, February 15, 2003
June Hester, nee Mobberly
MEDINA - June Hester, 75, of 323 Springbrook Drive, formerly of Monroe County, died at 12:20 a.m. Friday (Feb. 14, 2003) at Medina General Hospital in Medina.
She was born May 24, 1927, in Graysville to Amos and Ollie Smith Mobberly. She was a homemaker and a member of Medina Church of Christ at Medina.
 
She is survived by one sister, Mona Bigley and her husband, Rolland, of Medina; and several nieces and nephews.
 
She was preceded in death by her first husband, Clyde Anderson Jr.; her second husband, John Hester; her parents; and one sister, Beryl Morrison.
 
Services are at 11 a.m. Monday at Watters Funeral Home, 37501 Ohio 78 West, Woodsfield, with Jim Duty officiating. Burial is in Pleasant Ridge Cemetery near Graysville. Friends will be received from 7 to 9 p.m. Sunday at the funeral home.

Mobberly, Zilva
            Mrs. ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> Mrs. >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Zilva Mobberly, age 80, 1236 Broadview Ave., Monday. Widow of Dr. O. O Mobberly, survived by daughters, Mrs. Ethel Smethers, Mrs. Erma Leonard, Mrs. Elouise Gloyd, all of Columbus, Mrs. Evelyn Hoover, Greenville, Ohio, Mrs. Erlean Skare, Iowa; 14 grandchildren; 13 great grandchildren; sisters, Mrs. Alta Highman, Martinsburg, Ohio, Mrs. Edna DeVore, Illinois, brother Guy Edington, Wadsworth, Ohio. Friends may call at the Deyo-Davis Funeral Home, 1578 W. 1st Ave., after 7 p.m. Wednesday, Funeral 1:30 p.m. Thursday at Pleasant Ridge Church, Graysville, Ohio.
 
Mobberly, Dr. Ollie Ottmer
            Dr. ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> Dr. >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Mobberly, 69, a practicing dentist here for 35 years, died Saturday at his home, 1236 Broadview Ave., He was a graduate of Ohio State University Dental College and was a professor in the college 25 years, leaving there 10 years ago.
            He ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> He >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 was an honorary member and past master of the University Lodge of Masons. Survivors include his wife, Zilva, six daughters, Mrs. Ethel Richarson, Mrs. Elouise Gloyd, and Mrs. Erma Leonard of Columbus; Mrs. Edith Kelley, Laurelville, Ohio; Mrs. Evelyn Hoover, Greenville, Ohio, and Mrs. Erlean Skare, Iowa City, Iowa; nine grandchildren.
            Friends ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> Friends >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 may call at the Deyo funeral home until Tuesday morning when the remains will be taken for services and burial to Pleasant Ridge, Monroe County.
 
Mobberly, Olive Blanche (nee Smith)
            Olive Blanche Mobberly, 94, formerly of ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> Olive Blanche Mobberly, 94, formerly of >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 225 1/2 Wooster St., Lodi, and Monroe County, died at 8:05 p.m., Sept. 17, 1996 in the Meadowview Care Center, Seville.
            She was born at Lewisville, Sept. 15, ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> She was born at Lewisville, Sept. 15, >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 1902, a daughter of the late John and Susan Sloan Smith. She was a home maker and a member of the Medina Church of Christ at Medina.
             Surviving are three daughters, Mrs. Wilbert ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> Surviving are three daughters, Mrs. Wilbert >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 (Beryl) Morrison, Lodi, Mrs. John (June) Hester, Seville, and Mrs. Rolland (Mona) Bigley, Medina; seven grandchildren, and 13 great-grandchildren.
            In ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> In >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 addition to her parents, she was preceded in death by her husband, Amos Mobberly on Aug. 13, 1979; two brothers, Forrest Smith and Raymond Smith; three sisters, Florence Powell, Estella Kochler and Edna House; one half-sister, Etta Wittenbrook; two half-brothers, Jay Devore and Delbert Devore; one granddaughter, Charlene Morrison.

Friends were received until time of services on Sept. 21, at the Pleasant Ridge Church of Christ near Graysville. Burial followed in the Pleasant Ridge Cemetery, Rt. 1, Graysville. Source: Monroe County Beacon, December 26, 1996.

She was born Sept. 21, 1921 at Clarington, a daughter of the late Martin and Della Bonar Gilmore. She was a member of the Clarington United Methodist Church, Clarington.
     Surviving ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> Surviving >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 are one stepdaughter, Michelle Sawyer, Tavares, Fla.; two sisters, Vera Sawyer, Tavares, Fla., June Riley, of Beallsville.

Mobley, Lucy and Mr. Frank R. Simmons
            Frank ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> Frank >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 R. Simmons, son of Mr. and Mrs. Charles Simmons of Laings, and Miss Lucy Mobley, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Charles Mobley, of Woodsfield Route 4, were united in marriage at New Martinsville, West Virginia on June 3, 1930, by F. S. Smith, minister of the Church of Christ.
            On ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> On >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 June 4th they were given a fine wedding dinner at the home of the bride where twenty-five guests were assembled. In the evening they were given a rousing serenade. On June 5th they were again serenaded at New Castle, Ohio.
            On the following Sunday they were given a dinner at the home of the grooms ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> On the following Sunday they were given a dinner at the home of the groom s >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 parents where about thirty guests did ample justice to a fine dinner. Much fun was derived in watching the bride cut the very large wedding cake which was baked by Mrs. George Roth.
            Both ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> Both >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 the bride and groom are well known young people of the Laings community. Mrs. Simmons having attended Green Rural High school for the past two years. Mr. Simmons is a graduate of Green Rural high school and the past year taught the Fairfax school.
            The young couple enjoyed a weeks wedding trip to Akron, Ohio and other points of ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> The young couple enjoyed a week s wedding trip to Akron, Ohio and other points of >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 interest. Mr. Simmons is taking a summer course at Muskingum College at New Concord, Ohio, and about September 1st they will begin housekeeping at Altitude, Ohio where he is reemployed to teach the coming winter.
Source: The Spirit of Democracy, Woodsfield, Ohio, Wednesday, July 2, 1930.

Mobley, Mary Mabel (nee Pfeiffer)

            Mrs. ======= "Times New Roman";mso-fareast-language:JA'> Mrs. >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Mary Mabel Mobley, 63, wife of Vincent Mobley, died at her home in Fulton Sunday night following an extended illness. (1940)  She was born in Monroe County, October 17, 1877, the daughter of Adam and Hannah Jane Pfeiffer and was married to Mr. Mobley at Marietta on November 28, 1894. The family had lived in Fulton for 16 years, moving there from Bedford.  She was a member of the Fulton Methodist church and the Pythian Sisters.

            Surviving ======= "Times New Roman";mso-fareast-language:JA'> Surviving >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 are four children, Addel Mobley, at home, and Mrs. Calvin Buell, of Fulton, and Mrs. Charles Forsley and Dewey F. Mobley, both of Marietta, a foster son, Charles Swartz, of Fulton, two sisters, Mrs. James Gordon (Jordan) of West Virginia, and Mrs. Emma Pfeiffer Briggs of Arkansas, and four brothers, Frank and Arthur of West Virginia, Lewis Pfeiffer, of Sabina, and Joseph Pfeiffer of Marietta.

            Funeral ======= "Times New Roman";mso-fareast-language:JA'> Funeral >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 services were held at the Methodist church in Fulton Wednesday afternoon. Burial was made in the Fulton cemetery, 

 

Mobley, Maud E. Hopton

            Maud ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> Maud >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 E. Hopton, (nee Mobley) 89, of Pfalzgraf Road, formerly of Flint, Mich., died Sunday (June 24, 2001) at the Woodsfield Nursing and Rehabilitation Center.
She was born June 6, 1912, in Monroe County to Charles F. and Elizabeth Agin Mobley. She retired from the J. C. Penney Company at Bay City, Michigan. She was a member of Woodsfield Church of Christ and also the Church of Christ in Flint.
            She ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> She >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 is survived by two sons, Richard Hopton and his wife, Betty, of Woodsfield and Ronald Hopton and his wife, Sandra, of Gaines, Mich.; two daughters, Carolyn Roe and her husband, Sam, of Flint and Marilyn Herman and her husband, Gordon, of Evart, Mich.; one daughter-in-law, Dorothy Hopton of Flushing; two sisters, Gladys Haynes of Rittman and Pearl Piatt of Woodsfield; 12 grandchildren; 19 great-grandchildren; four stepgreat-grandchildren; and two great-great-grandchildren.
            She ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> She >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 was preceded in death by her husband, John E. Hopton, in 1992; one son, Denzel Hopton; her parents; one sister, Lucy Simmons; one brother, Charles A. Mobley; two grandchildren, Barbara Ann Hopton and Vicki West; and two great-grandchildren, Reid Hopton and Maranda Roe.
            Services ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> Services >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 are at 10 a.m. Wednesday at Bauer-Turner Funeral Home, 100 S. Paul St., Woodsfield, with Keith Jones officiating. Burial is in Oaklawn Cemetery in Woodsfield. Friends will be received from 4 to 9 p.m. today at the funeral home.
Source: The Marietta Times, Marietta, Ohio, June 2001.

Moffett, Howard
               Howard Moffett, aged 19 years, of ======= style='mso-tab-count:1'> Howard Moffett, aged 19 years, of >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Toronto, died suddenly Friday, March 9, 1917, while visiting his aunt, Mrs. Herman Seebach of Lewisville, Ohio. He took ill Thursday from appendicitis and died the following day. The remains were taken to Toronto for interment.
Source: The Spirit of Democracy, Woodsfield, Ohio, Thursday, March 15, 1917.
 
Moffett, Oliver
            Oliver ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> Oliver >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Moffett, son of Peter and Martha Moffett, was born near Antioch,Ohio July 4, 1865, and passed away at his home on east church street,Woodsfield, Wednesday evening, January 29, 1941, being at the time of his death 75 years, 6 months and 25 days of age. He lived in Paden city, West Virginia, quite a while before moving to Woodsfield six years ago.
            He ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> He >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 was united in marriage with Edna Eikelberry on July 26, 1905, and to this union two children were born: Mrs. Freda Cecil, of Paden city, and sergeant Everett E. Moffett, of Camp Blanding, Florida.
            Mr. Moffett was a kind husband and father,a good neighbor and true friend.    He was interested in others and always willing to help in the time of need.
            He ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> Mr. Moffett was a kind husband and father,a good neighbor and true friend. He was interested in others and always willing to help in the time of need.
He >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 leaves to mourn, his wife, two children, one brother, J. Wesley Moffett,of Sardis, Ohio, route 1 and six grandchildren. besides these,he leaves other relatives and many friends.
"Sweetly rest from all thy labor,
far from every grief and pain;
we will often think about you,
while we here on earth remain."
            Funeral ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> Funeral >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 services were conducted at the Moffett church by minister J. V. A. Traylor, Saturday afternoon, February 1st, at 2:00 o'clock. Burial was made in the church cemetery.
Card of thanks
            We ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> We >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 desire to thank all who assisted us in any way during the illness and at the time of the death of our husband and father. We appreciate the kindness of those who gave flowers and those who furnished cars and also appreciate the courtesy of Bauer and Turner. We thank brother Traylor for his words of comfort and thank him and Mrs. Traylor for their songs.--Mrs. Moffett and children.
Source:The Monroe County Beacon, dated, February 1941

Monroe, Jake
Source--Toothman Memorial Obituaries    Jacobsburg, Ohio
 Published--November 2002
======= style='mso-spacerun:yes'> Jacobsburg, Ohio
Published--November 2002
>>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711
Monroe , Oscar "Jake" 64, of Shadyside, died Saturday, November 23, 2002 at the Ohio Valley Medical Center, Wheeling. He was born June 12, 1938 at Shadyside, son of the late Joseph Monroe and Sarah K. Richardson Monroe.He was a retired coal miner from Oglebay Norton Mine at Captina; a United States Army veteran of the Vietnam War; and attended the Powhatan Point Church of the Nazarene.In addition to his parents, he was preceded in death by five brothers, Jack Monroe, Howard Monroe, John Monroe, Chester Monroe and George Monroe; and a sister, Naomi Monroe.Surviving are wife, Shirley Palmer Monroe; two sons, Dan Monroe of Shadyside and Chet Monroe of Columbus, Ohio; a daughter, Jeannie Paboucek and her husband Steve of Barnesville; a sister, Katherine Keyser of Jacobsburg; a brother, Tom Monroe of Shadyside; 11 grandchildren; and 3 great grandchildren.Family and friends will be received at the Toothman Funeral Home, Jacobsburg on Monday from 7 to 9 p.m. and on Tuesday from 2 to 4 and 6 to 9 p.m. where services will be held on Wednesday at 2 p.m. with Reverend Don Lawson, Jr. officiating. Burial will follow in Davis Cemetery, Bellaire where Full Military Graveside services will be held.Memorial contributions may be made to the American Cancer Society, 3612 Maple Avenue, Zanesville, Ohio 43702.
 
Monroe, Pauline A.
            Woodsfield, Ohio - Pauline A. Monroe, 83, of Shadyside, died Thursday (July 17, 2003) at Crestview Health Care Center in Belmont County. (Born in 1919)                Friends may call from 9 a.m. ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> Woodsfield, Ohio - Pauline A. Monroe, 83, of Shadyside, died Thursday (July 17, 2003) at Crestview Health Care Center in Belmont County. (Born in 1919) Friends may call from 9 a.m. >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 until time of service at 11 a.m. on Monday at the Bauer-Turner Funeral Home. 100 S. Paul St., Woodsfield, with the Rev. Roger Brown officiating. Burial will be in Oaklawn Cemetery, Woodsfield.
Source: The Daily Jeffersonian, dated Monday, July 21, 2003
 
Montgomery, Maude and Samuel Christman
            On the morning of the 8th. the residence of Mr. & Mrs. William Montgomery, near Mt. Carrick, was filled with guests to witness the wedding of their daughter, Miss Maude Montgomery, to Mr. Samuel Christman. J. N. Agin acted as grooms best man, and Miss Annie Christman as brides maid. The ceremony was performed by the Reverend Henry Lyons, of Antioch.
            After ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> On the morning of the 8th. the residence of Mr. & Mrs. William Montgomery, near Mt. Carrick, was filled with guests to witness the wedding of their daughter, Miss Maude Montgomery, to Mr. Samuel Christman. J. N. Agin acted as groom s best man, and Miss Annie Christman as bride s maid. The ceremony was performed by the Reverend Henry Lyons, of Antioch.
After >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 the ceremony was performed, the bride and groom, followed by the guests, were led to the dining room where the table was laden with every conceivable good thing the appetite might crave. After dinner everybody gathered to the parlor, where some time was spent in social chat, interspersed with vocal music, and a short speech from Honorable H. Lyons.
            The ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> The >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 following is a list of the presents: Mr. and Mrs. David Blatter, bedspread; Hannah S. Griffith, pan of towels; Mrs. Rosa A. Agin, honey dish; Lewis Griffith, fruit dish; Mrs. Rebecca A. Hughs, berry dish; Miss Annie Schneider, pair of vases; Mr. Mahlen Griffith, fruit dish; Mr. George Kindelberger, jelly glass and sugar bowl; Mr. Willie Christman, cake stand; Mr. and Mrs. Fritz Schneider, fruit dish; pitcher, two bread plates and honey dish; Mr. Charley Norris, molasses cruet; Mrs. N. A. Neuhart, 50 cents; Mr. William and Nancy Tracey, $1.50; Miss Katie Fleahman, 25 cents; Mr. Henry Christman, spoon holder and pitcher; Miss Annie Christman, cream pitcher and pair of towels; Mr. Isaac Price, spoon holder, Mr. and Mrs. Joseph Weisend, preserve dish and chair tidy; Mr. John M. Griffith, fruit dish; Mr. William Seamon and Miss Emma Brachtbeller, parlor lamp; Mr. Lewis Christman, pitcher; Mr. Edward Hughs, pitcher and fruit dish; Mr. Lorenzo Truex, towel; Mr. William H. Craig, butter dish; Mr. Fred Kindleberger, cream pitcher; Mrs. A. J. Griffith, berry bowl; Miss Polly Huber, pair of towels; Miss Hulda Bennet, towel; Miss Annie Kindleberger, pair of towels; Mr. and Mrs. E. S. Taylor, bedspread; Mr. William Montgomery, wash stand; Mr. Jacob Schneider, gold dollar; Mr. J. N. and W. A. Agin, half dozen cabinet photographs of bride and groom.
            The ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> The >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 bride and groom extend their thanks to the many guests, and they in return, wish the young couple a pleasant and prosperous journey through life.
-A Guest-

Source: The Spirit of Democracy, Woodsfield, Ohio, Tuesday, September 13, 1887.

Montgomery, Walter J.
     ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Steubenville, Ohio - Walter J. Montgomery, age 60, of Steubenville, Ohio passed away, January. 1, 2004 at West Penn Hospital. He was born May 3, 1943, in West Union, West Virginia, Doddridge County, the son of the late Ora and Bertha (Cottrill) Montgomery. A brother, Jerry Montgomery also preceded him.
            Walter ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> Walter >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 retired from the Weirton Steel Company, where he worked as a system analyst in the General Office Management Services with 33 years of service; was a member of the 25-Year Club of Weirton Steel; the Weirton Steel Management Club; was a Protestant by faith; and was a U .S. Navy veteran.
            Surviving ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> Surviving >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 are his two sons, Scott Montgomery and his wife Tiffany and Jeffrey Montgomery and his wife Gina, both of Steubenville, Ohio; a daughter Tricia Howard and her husband John of Omaha, Nebraska; five brothers, Robert and Glenn of West Union, W.Va., Kenneth of New Martinsville, West Virginia, William of Woodsfield Ohio, and John of Columbia, South Carolina, and two sisters, Rella Dawson, and Mary Lou Dawson of Tyler County, W.Va. He also has four grandchildren. Visitation will be Sunday, January. 4, 2004 from 1-3 and 7-9 p.m. at the Greco-Hertnick Funeral Home, 3219 Main St., Weirton, West Virginia where services will be held Monday at 10 a.m. in the funeral home. Memorial contributions can be made to the American Cancer Society, Hancock County Unit, P.O. Box 2166, Weirton, WV 26062. Share tributes with his family at www.grecohertnick.com.
Source: The Herald Star, Steubenville, Ohio, January 2004.

Mooney, John Davenport and Miss Virginia Shaffer
            The ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> The >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 home of William Shaffer, 828 Liberty street, Franklin, Pa., was the scene on Wednesday evening of one of the most brilliant wedding of the season when his daughter, Miss Virginia Shaffer, became the bride of John Davenport Mooney, son of the late Honorable and Mrs. William Crittenden Mooney, of Woodsfield, Ohio.
             The ceremony was performed at 8:30 by Rev. Dr. ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> The ceremony was performed at 8:30 by Rev. Dr. >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Norris A. White in the presence of 50 guests, including only the members of the immediate families, in the drawing room of the Shaffer home before a bank of palms, ferns, pink gladioli and pink asters.
            The ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> The >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 bride, given in marriage by her father, wore a gown of white crepe satin trimmed with pearls; her veil of duchess lace was fashioned coronet shape. She carried a shower bouquet of lilies of the valley.
            The ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> The >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 bridal party included Miss Frances Shaffer, sister of the bride, a maid of honor, and Herbert Randolph Mooney, brother of the bridegroom, as best man. The maid of honor wore a gown of pink chiffon trimmed with pearls and rhinestones and her corsage bouquet was of pink roses and blue lace flowers.
            During the ceremony an orchestra played the Bridal Chorus from Lohengrin, by Wagner, and the Wedding March by Mendelssohn. Immediately following the ceremony a buffet lunch was served in the dining room, which was artistically decorated with a profusion of brides roses.
            Later ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> During the ceremony an orchestra played the Bridal Chorus from Lohengrin, by Wagner, and the Wedding March by Mendelssohn. Immediately following the ceremony a buffet lunch was served in the dining room, which was artistically decorated with a profusion of bride s roses.
Later >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 in the evening Mr. and Mrs. Mooney left on a motor trip through the White Mountains, the Adirondacks and New York. Upon their return they will make their home in Woodsfield, Ohio.
            Mr. ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> Mr. >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Mooney is a graduate of Yale, class of 1913, is a member of the honorary fraternity at Yale, the Phi Beta Kappa, and is also a member of Zeta Pal. He served as captain of the 308th Ammunition Train during the World War. He is vice president of the Monroe Bank of Woodsfield, Ohio and is a popular member of the younger social set at that place.
            Mr. Mooney has won for his bride one of Franklins most popular and accomplished ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> Mr. Mooney has won for his bride one of Franklin s most popular and accomplished >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 young women. She is a graduate of the Fairmont Seminary, Washington, D. C., and studied music abroad for eight years under Jean de Reske, of Paris. She sang at the Covent Garden, London, and for three years was a member of the Chicago Opera Company. She gave up a brilliant career to devote her time to evangelistic singer gained a wider reputation than she in her chosen work. The processor of a remarkable contralto voice, she has been heard in this city on a number of occasions and has delighted her hearers.
            Mrs. ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> Mrs. >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Mooney received a wealth of beautiful gifts, including silver, linen and crystal. Source: The Spirit of Democracy, Thursday, September. 4, 1924
 
Ms to here #13 ======= mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman";mso-fareast-language:JA'>M s to here #13 >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 above
Mooney, Col. Samuel L.
               A telegram received here Sunday ======= style='mso-tab-count:1'> A telegram received here Sunday >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 announced the of Col. Samuel L. Mooney who was fatally injured in an auto accident near Oceanside, California Sunday. A broken front wheel caused the big machine to run into a ditch. Col. Mooney sustained a fractured skull and died within a short time after he was extricated from his position.
               Mrs. Mooney sustained a fractured ======= style='mso-tab-count:1'> Mrs. Mooney sustained a fractured >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 limb and several other bruises. Mr. Mooney was 86 years of age and had been at Pasadena for the past two years, but was planning to return to the East, when the fatal accident terminated his life. Mrs. Mooney was also seriously injured. The remains will be brought to Woodsfield for interment. He is survived by his <<<<<<< HEAD widow, and grown children as follows:  Congressman William C. Mooney of Woodsfield; Edwin Mooney of Tulsa, Oklahoma; Mrs. F. M. Martin of Woodsfield; Mrs. Dr. E. P. Edmonds of Columbus, Ohio, and Miss Mattie Mooney of New York. Mrs. Mooney who was injured was the second wife of the deceased.

Edmonds of Columbus, Ohio, and Miss Mattie Mooney of New York. Mrs. Mooney who was injured was the second wife of the deceased. >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711

Moore, Edna Mae (nee Gallagher)
               Caldwell, Ohio - Edna Mae Moore, ======= style='mso-tab-count:1'> Caldwell, Ohio - Edna Mae Moore, >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 84, of Summit Acres Nursing Home, formerly of Summerfield, died at 3:10 a.m. Wednesday (November. 6, 2002) at the nursing home. She was born October 10, 1918, near Batesville to Rufus and Amanda Botkin Gallagher. She was a former custodian and cook for the Noble Local School District in Sarahsville. She was a Protestant by faith. She is survived by several nieces and nephews.
               She was preceded in death by her ======= style='mso-tab-count:1'> She was preceded in death by her >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 husband, Elmer Moore, on November. 4, 1974; one son, Robert F. "Fudge" Moore, on December 20, 1995; her parents; five brothers, Owen, Leo, Raymond, Ulrea and Virgil Gallagher; and one sister, Viva Morris. Services are at 1 p.m. Saturday at Brubach-Watters Funeral Home in Summerfield with Frank Love officiating. Burial is in Eastern Cemetery in Summerfield. Friends will be received from 5 to 9 p.m. Friday at the funeral home.
Source: The Marietta Times, Marietta, Ohio, Thursday, November 7, 2002.

Moore, Emma Graham
Emma Adeline Sindeldecker Graham, 88, of Helena, Ohio, died April 2, 1004 at the Good Shepherd Nursing Home, Fostoria, Ohio. She was born January. 25, 1916 in Armstrong, Ohio, daughter of the late Ray and Elizabeth (Schriver) Moore.
            In ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> In >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 addition to her parents, she was preceded in death by her first husband, Lebby Carl Sindeldecker on January. 14, 1987 and her second husband, Arlie Graham; a daughter, Nancy Ridgley and one brother, Lester Moore.
            Surviving ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> Surviving >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 are two sons, James Sindeldecker, Zanesville, Ohio and Richard Sindeldecker, St. Clair, Michigan; one daughter, Patricia Costello, Helena, Ohio; a sister, Freda Lucas, Beallsville, Ohio; a sister-in-law, Helen Farmer, Shadyside, Ohio; 16 grandchildren; 28 great grand- children and 6 great great grandchildren.
            She was a homemaker and a member of the Church of Christ, Beallsville, Ohio.
            Visitation ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> She was a homemaker and a member of the Church of Christ, Beallsville, Ohio.
Visitation >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 will be held, Tuesday, April 6, 2004 from 1 p.m. until time of graveside services, at 2 p.m., at Holly Memorial Gardens Cemetery, Pleasant Grove, Ohio with Revered Jeff Rich officiating.

Moore, Helen E.
            Woodsfield, ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> Woodsfield, >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Ohio-Helen E. Moore, 90, of the Monroe County Care Center, formerly of 105 Hancock Ave., Woodsfield, died Tuesday (November 11, 2003) at the center. She was born February 15, 1913, near Woodsfield to Neander and Helen Gerber Moore. She was a retired clerk for the former K-V Store at Woodsfield with 29 1/2 years of service. She was a member of First United Methodist Church at Woodsfield, where she was a member of the United Methodist Women's Group. She was also a member of Order of Eastern Star 268 at Woodsfield, American Association of Retired Persons Woodsfield Chapter and the Woodsfield Homemakers Club.
            She ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> She >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 is survived by several close friends, including Paul and Marie Ring, Paula Frank and Marc Ring, all of Woodsfield, Matthew Ring of Westerville, and Andrew Ring of Beverly. She was preceded in death by her parents; one sister, Virgie Elliott; and one brother, George Moore.
            Eastern ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> Eastern >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Star services followed by services are at 1 p.m. Thursday at Watters Funeral Home in Woodsfield with the Rev. Roger Brown officiating. Burial is in Oaklawn Cemetery in Woodsfield. Friends will be received from 10 a.m. Thursday until the hour of the services at the funeral home.
Source: The Marietta Times, Wednesday, November 19, 2003
 
Moore, Helen M. (nee Gertler)
               On Wednesday, February 26, 1913, ======= style='mso-tab-count:1'> On Wednesday, February 26, 1913, >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 visited the home of Neander Moore of Coats, Ohio and took from it the beloved wife and mother, Helen Gertler Moore. Those left to mourn her loss are: the bereaved husband, three children, Virgie, George and the infant daughter, Helen Moore, her parents, Mr. and Mrs. Adam Gertler of Ozark, Ohio, two brothers Philip Gertler of Ozark and George Gertler of Noblesville, Indiana, and one sister Mrs. Wellington Moore of Ozark, besides a host of other relatives and friends.
               Mrs. Moore was a devoted wife, a ======= style='mso-tab-count:1'> Mrs. Moore was a devoted wife, a >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 loving mother and a kind neighbor. Their stricken family have the sympathy of the entire community in their bereavement. The funeral services were conducted by the Reverend Bourne on Friday afternoon, February 28, in the M. E. Church at Ozark. Interment being made in the Ozark cemetery.  - F. J. B

Moore, James R.

Moore, Joshua Jason and Jeanette Rosen
Jeanette Rosen of Powhatan Point announces the engagement of her daughter, Bethany Nicole to Joshua Jason Moore, son of Eugene and Melody Moore of Malaga.
The bride-to-be is a 1997 graduate of River High School and a 2001 graduate of Ohio University with a bachelor of science degree in hearing and speech sciences. She received a master of education degree from Ohio University in 2003. She is employed by Union Local School District as an intervention specialist.
Her fiance is a 1994 graduate of Beallsville High School and a 1999 graduate of The University of Akron with a bachelor of arts degree in social studies. He received both a master of arts degree in special education and curriculum and instruction from Muskingum College in 2002. He is an intervention specialist at Mid-East Ohio Career and Technology Center.
An October wedding is being planned. Source: times Leader, martins Ferry, Ohio, Monday, October 18, 2004.

Welsh, of Altamont, New York.

Moore, Lawrence A., Sr.
               Lawrence ======= style='mso-spacerun:yes'> Lawrence >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 A. Moose, Sr., 85, 347 E. 4th Street, Ashland, died December 17, 2002, at his residence.  He was born November 15, 1917, in Woodsfield, and was the son of the late Talbert and Rose Draper Paulus Moose.  He had been a resident of Ashland since moving there in 1945 from Woodsfield.  He was a retired employee of the F. E. Myers Co., where he had worked as a Brass Molder for over <<<<<<< HEAD 30 years.                         
               He was a former Little League ======= 30 years. 
He was a former Little League >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 coach in Ashland and was a member of the Ashland Trotting Association and a former member of the Myers bowling league.  He was a veteran of the U.S. Army serving during WW II as a Sergeant with the Battery D. 4th Coast Artillery.
          Surviving are his wife of 56 years, Betty J. Jones, whom he married December 25, 1945; daughter, Vicki Smith of Ashland; son, Lawrence A. Moose, Jr., of Ashland; four grandchildren; a great-grandson.
          In addition to his parents he was preceded in death by two brothers, Roman P. Moose and Roger Moose.
          There were no calling hours or services.  Graveside services will be held at a later date in the Woodsfield Cemetery, Woodsfield.  Memorial contributions may be made in his memory to Hospice of North Central Ohio, Inc., 1605 CR 1095, Ashland, OH 44805.  Denbow-Primm-Kemery Funeral Home was in charge of arrangements.

Moore, Sadie Jane and Mr. Dean Jones
            On Wednesday, April 25, 1917, at the ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> On Wednesday, April 25, 1917, at the >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 home of Mr. and Mrs. J. H. Moore, in Jerusalem,Ohio, was solemnized the marriage of their daughter Sadie Jane, to Mr. Dean Jones.
            The ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> The >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 bride was attired in a dress of white silk crepe-de-chino while the groom wore the conventional black,and at the appointed hour Mrs. K. P. Simmons, presiding at the piano, played the wedding march, and the young couple entered the room which was decorated appropriately for the occasion, and there in the presence of the immediate members of the families, Rev. K. P. Simmons of Beallsville, Ohio performed the marriage ceremony which made the young couple husband and wife.
            At 3:30 o'clock the young couple and guests made their way into the dining room where an elaborate luncheon had been prepared and all of those present seemed to understand the purpose for which they were there.             
            In the evening the young couple were tendered a shower by about 75 of their friends and received many appropriate and useful gifts. 
======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> At 3:30 o'clock the young couple and guests made their way into the dining room where an elaborate luncheon had been prepared and all of those present seemed to understand the purpose for which they were there.
In the evening the young couple were tendered a shower by about 75 of their friends and received many appropriate and useful gifts.
>>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711
Source: The Spirit of Democracy, Thursday, May 3, 1917

Moore, Mrs. Sharol (Freitag)
Source--The Daily JeffersonianNews Clipping
Published--April  1985
 
======= mso-fareast-language:JA'>Published--April 1985
>>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711
In memory of Mrs. Sharol (Freitag) Moore, who passed away April 7, 1983
 
======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711
Two years ago you called her home,
To a mansion in the sky;
A place you promised to everyone,
If on Your love we would rely.
 
======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711
A wife, a mother, a daughter, a sister, a friend,
Each role she filled quite well;
Until you said, "Well done my child",
Then carried her home with You to dwell.
 
======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711
To know her was to love her,
Each smile, each frown, her laughter, her tears;
From this one You loaned to us,
Are all the things we hold so dear.
 
======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711
The space she filled in each our lives,
The love she gave unsparing;
No mortal person can deny,
It's God's love she was sharing.
 
Sadly missed by:  JIM, KIM AND BRIAN       MOM AND DAD        DAVE, CAROL AND FAMILY
                                GRANT, LOUISE AND PANSY         MR. AND MRS. JAMES ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'>
Sadly missed by: JIM, KIM AND BRIAN MOM AND DAD DAVE, CAROL AND FAMILY
GRANT, LOUISE AND PANSY MR. AND MRS. JAMES >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 DUDLEY AND FAMILY
                                MR. AND MRS. ED ======= style='mso-spacerun:yes'> MR. AND MRS. ED >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 WELKER
Moore, Richard D.
Source--Spirit of Democracy     Woodsfield, Ohio
Published--Tuesday  February 17, 1981
 
======= style='mso-spacerun:yes'> Woodsfield, Ohio
Published--Tuesday February 17, 1981
>>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711
Moore, Richard D. "Rick", 22, formerly of New Matamoras, Ohio was killed at 6 p.m. Thursday in an automobile accident at Maitland.
He was born, January 28, 1959, at Marietta, Ohio, to Roy and Juanita Myers Moore of New Matamoas. He was a 1978 graduate of Frontier High School and Washington County Vocational School.
In addition to his parents, he is survived by his wife, Bonnie Slack , whom he married ,March 29, 1980; two brothers, Roy E. Jr., and Charles M., both of New Matamoras, Ohio; a sister, Mrs. Donalene J. Whitmere of Canal Winchester, Ohio; and grandparents, Mr. and Mrs. Harry Moore of New Matamoras, Ohio.
The Hadley Funeral Home at New Matamoras is in charge of arrangements.

Moore, Thomas
               Thomas Moore, aged 70 years, died ======= style='mso-tab-count:1'> Thomas Moore, aged 70 years, died >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 suddenly at his home on Moose ridge, Woodsfield, Ohio, Sunday morning, April 8, 1916, from heart trouble. The family was getting up when Mrs. Moore notice her husband breathing heavily. She attempted to raise him from the bed when he expired. Deceased was a soldier during the late war of the rebellion. He leaves a wife and many friends. The funeral services were held Tuesday.
Source: Monroe County records and

The Spirit of Democracy, Woodsfield, Ohio, Thursday, April 13, 1916.

Moose, George R.
               George R. Moose, aged 72 years, ======= style='mso-tab-count:1'> George R. Moose, aged 72 years, >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 died at his home near Woodsfield January 2, 1916. Deceased had been in feeble health for some time. Moose, Harry O.
            Harry O. Moose, 59, of Romulus, ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> Harry O. Moose, 59, of Romulus, >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Michigan, formerly of Woodsfield, died Saturday, May 9, 1964, in Wayne County General Hospital, at Wayne, Michigan, after an extended illness. Mr. Moose was born February 20, 1905, at Woodsfield, a son of Mrs. Viola Baker Moose and the late Jacob L. Moose.
             Surviving are his mother and four sisters, ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> Surviving are his mother and four sisters, >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Mrs. Gladys Ricer, of Cleveland; Mrs. Esther Antill, of Woodsfield; Mrs. Mary Moore, of New Matamoras, and Mrs. Velma Tarleton, of Caldwell, and several nieces and nephews.
            Funeral services were held in the ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> Funeral services were held in the >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Bauer and Turner Funeral Chapel on Wednesday afternoon at one o;clock with Rev. Paul Neville officiating. Burial was in Oaklawn Cemetery. Source: Published, May 1964.
 
Moose, James R.

Moose, Lawrence A., Sr.
            Lawrence ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> Lawrence >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 A. Moose, Sr., 85, 347 E. 4th Street, Ashland, died December 17, 2002, at his residence. He was born November 15, 1917, in Woodsfield, and was the son of the late Talbert and Rose Draper Paulus Moose. He had been a resident of Ashland since moving there in 1945, from Woodsfield.
            He ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> He >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 was a retired employee of the F. E. Myers Co., where he had worked as a Brass Molder for over 30 years. He was a former Little League coach in Ashland and was a member of the Ashland Trotting Association and a former member of the Myers bowling league. He was a veteran of the U.S. Army serving during WW II as a Sergeant with the Battery D. 4th Coast Artillery.
     Surviving ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> Surviving >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 are his wife of 56 years, Betty J. Jones, whom he married December 25, 1945; daughter, Vicki Smith of Ashland; son, Lawrence A. Moose, Jr., of Ashland; four grandchildren; a great-grandson. In addition to his parents he was preceded in death by two brothers, Roman P. Moose and Roger Moose.
     There were ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> There were >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 no calling hours or services. Graveside services will be held at a later date in the Woodsfield Cemetery, Woodsfield. Memorial contributions may be made in his memory to Hospice of North Central Ohio, Inc., 1605 CR 1095, Ashland, OH 44805. Denbow-Primm-Kemery Funeral Home was in charge of arrangements.

Morey, Meri C. Welsh
            Lewisville, ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> Lewisville, >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Ohio - Meri C. Welsh, (nee Morey) 56, of 49901 Township 15, Lewisville, died Friday (June 21, 2002) at her home.
            She ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> She >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 was born December 30, 1945, in Vintondale, Pa., to Julius and Martha Harkins Morey. She was a former registered nurse, having worked labor and delivery at St. Ann's Hospital in Westerville, Ohio. She was a member of St. John the Baptist Catholic Church at Miltonsburg, Ohio. She loved gardening, world travel and raising sheep on the farm.
            She ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> She >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 is survived by her husband, Robert F. Welsh, whom she married November. 26, 1966; two daughters, Kathleen M. Hurst and her husband, Byron, of Hudson, Ohio, and Amy Ann Welsh of San Diego, Calif.; one son, Robert P. Welsh and his wife, Michele, of Baltimore, Md.; her father of Vintondale, Pa.; two sisters, Judy Minzer of Fayetteville, Pa., and Amy Gorman of Gettysburg, Pa.; and six grandchildren, Aubri, Cameron and Brandon Hurst, Ethan Welsh, and Autumn and Grayson Welsh. She was preceded in death by her mother and one grandson, Collin Hurst.
            Mass ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> Mass >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 of Christian burial was to be celebrated at 11 a.m. today at St. John the Baptist Catholic Church in Miltonsburg with the Rev. Jason Prati officiating. Burial is in St. John the Baptist Catholic Cemetery.
            Memorial contributions may be made to St. John the Baptist Catholic Church, Miltonsburg-Calais Road, Woodsfield, Ohio 43793; or Washington County Home Nursing Service and Hospice, 900 Third St., Marietta, Ohio 45750-9913.            Watters Funeral Home in Woodsfield is in charge of ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> Memorial contributions may be made to St. John the Baptist Catholic Church, Miltonsburg-Calais Road, Woodsfield, Ohio 43793; or Washington County Home Nursing Service and Hospice, 900 Third St., Marietta, Ohio 45750-9913. Morris, Mr. and Mrs. Adolph Morris
Source--Monroe County >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Beacon   Woodsfield, Ohio
Published--June                                1958
======= style='mso-spacerun:yes'> 1958 >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711
 
On Sunday, June 22nd,                                friends and relatives gathered at the home of Mr.                                and Mrs. Adolph Morris, 503 South High Street, Woodsfield , to help                                celebrate their fiftieth wedding                                ======= style='mso-spacerun:yes'> friends and relatives gathered at the home of Mr. and Mrs. Adolph Morris, 503 South High Street, Woodsfield , to help celebrate their fiftieth wedding >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 anniversary.
Mr. and Mrs. Morris                                were married on June 25, 1908, in Tyler County,                                West Virginia. They were the parents of nine                                children, one ======= style='mso-spacerun:yes'> were married on June 25, 1908, in Tyler County, West Virginia. They were the parents of nine children, one >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 son being deceased.
At noon dinner was                                served to the following guests: Mr. and Mrs. W.G.                                Drake, Mr. and Mrs. Raymond Drake and daughter,                                Mr. and Mrs. John Crawford and daughter, Mr. and                                Mrs. Clarence Morris, all of Barnesville; Allen                                Huntsman, of Belmont, Mr. and Mrs. Earl Huntsman                                and family, Mr. and Mrs. Junior Longdon and                                family, Mr. and Mrs. Walter Matz and family, Mr.                                and Mrs. Gene Hossman and daughter, Mr. and Mrs.                                Clyde Matz and family, Mrs. Kathryn Piatt and son,                                Mr. and Mrs. Paul Wilson and Troy Cranmore of                                Ashland; Mr. and Mrs. William T. Matz and daughter                                of Toronto.
Mrs. Diana Morris,                                Mr. and Mrs. Vernon Kirkbride and son, all of                                Quaker City; Doy and Nettie Brown and family, Mrs.                                Anna Belle Ullom, Mrs. Edna Ward and family, Mrs.                                Bob Mellott and daughter, Mrs. Johnnie Huntsman                                and son, Mrs. Cora Ankrom and son, Mr. and Mrs.                                Elmer Morris and family, Mrs. Estelle Lendon and                                family, Mrs. Elsie Shelvy, Mrs.Henry Showalter and                                daughters, Mary Reischman, Mrs. George Wilson, Mr.                                and Mrs. David Eddy, Mr. and Mrs. Ermie Morris and                                family.
Those who sent                                presents, being unable to attend, were Mrs. Hazel                                Saffle and Kate Eddy, of Woodsfield ; Mr. and Mrs.                                Lemuel Barker, Mr. and Mrs. Joe Jenkins, of Paden                                City; Eva Piatt and the Truax                                Children.
Mr. and Mrs. Morris                                received many lovely gifts and cards for which                                they wish to ======= style='mso-spacerun:yes'> served to the following guests: Mr. and Mrs. W.G. Drake, Mr. and Mrs. Raymond Drake and daughter, Mr. and Mrs. John Crawford and daughter, Mr. and Mrs. Clarence Morris, all of Barnesville; Allen Huntsman, of Belmont, Mr. and Mrs. Earl Huntsman and family, Mr. and Mrs. Junior Longdon and family, Mr. and Mrs. Walter Matz and family, Mr. and Mrs. Gene Hossman and daughter, Mr. and Mrs. Clyde Matz and family, Mrs. Kathryn Piatt and son, Mr. and Mrs. Paul Wilson and Troy Cranmore of Ashland; Mr. and Mrs. William T. Matz and daughter of Toronto.
Mrs. Diana Morris, Mr. and Mrs. Vernon Kirkbride and son, all of Quaker City; Doy and Nettie Brown and family, Mrs. Anna Belle Ullom, Mrs. Edna Ward and family, Mrs. Bob Mellott and daughter, Mrs. Johnnie Huntsman and son, Mrs. Cora Ankrom and son, Mr. and Mrs. Elmer Morris and family, Mrs. Estelle Lendon and family, Mrs. Elsie Shelvy, Mrs.Henry Showalter and daughters, Mary Reischman, Mrs. George Wilson, Mr. and Mrs. David Eddy, Mr. and Mrs. Ermie Morris and family.

Morris, Adolph S.                 
            Woodsfield---Funeral services for ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'>Morris, Adolph S.
Woodsfield---Funeral services for >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Adolph Spencer Morris, 81, a retired Woodsfield farmer, will be held at 2.p.m. Tuesday (11 April 1964) at the Gardner Funeral Home by minister James Gallagher. Burial will be in Calais cemetery.
            Mr. Morris died at his home Saturday at 10 a.m. following a ======= 1'> Mr. Morris died at his home Saturday at 10 a.m. following a >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 short illness. He leaves 106 survivors. He was born in Monroe County March 31, 1883, a son of Thomas and Susan Merle Morris and was a member of the Church of Christ.
            Mr. Morris leaves his widow, Emma : a son Clarence of Ashland; ======= 1'> Mr. Morris leaves his widow, Emma : a son Clarence of Ashland; >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 seven daughters, Mrs. Edna Huntsman of Toronto, Mrs. Estelle Lendon, of Lewisville, Mrs. Nellie Matz; Mrs. Kathryn Peat, Mrs. Bertha London, all of Ashland, Mrs. Vestal Morris and Mrs. Nettie Brown, both of Woodsfield; two sisters, Mrs. Jennie Drake of Barnesville and Mrs. Annabelle Peat of Applecreek; three brothers, Alva of Kingston, John of Cambridge and Nora (Dora) of Fly and 35 grandchildren and 57 great-grandchildren. One son Russell is deceased.
     Friends may call at the funeral home.

Morris, Andrew

Morris, Andrew Spencer
            Andrew ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> Andrew >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Spencer Morris, son of Andrew J. and Elizabeth Beardmore Morris, was born at Sycamore Valley on September 7, 1878, and departed this life at Memorial Hospital, Marietta, Ohio, on November 25, 1949, being at the time of his death 71 years, 2 months and 18 days of age.  On October 8, 1898, he was united in marriage with Pearl Zelda Kinkade, of near Sycamore Valley, Ohio.
            To ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> To >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 this union were born nine children, six sons and three daughters.  On January 21, 1894, he obeyed the gospel under the teaching of Elder Ezra Barkes of near Graysville, and remained faithful until death.  October 15, 1911, Brother Morris was appointed deacon of the Pleasant Ridge Church of Christ, and he faithfully attended the duties of this office for more than thirty-eight years. On July 27, 1949, his faith to duty was rewarded by being appointed to the Eldership which position he was filling at the time of his death.
            He ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> He >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 was preceded in death by his father and mother, two brothers and five children as follows: Earl, Maywood, Edward, William and an infant son.
Mr. Morris leaves to mourn his departure his wife, Mrs. Pearl Kinkade Morris; one son, Isaac Morris of Mantua, Ohio; three daughters, Mildred Okey and Myra Anderson of Graysville, and Ethel Bishop, of Woodsfield; one brother, George Morris of Illinois; one sister, Anna Mobberly, of Sycamore Valley; fourteen grandchildren and two great-grandchildren, besides a host of other relatives and friends.
            In ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> In >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 the death of Brother Morris the family has lost a kind husband and father, the community a good friend and neighbor, and the church a true and loyal worker.  On Wednesday, November 30, he was laid to rest in the beautiful cemetery at Pleasant Ridge, almost in the shadow of the church where he had labored and worshipped for more than fifty years. May we all live so as to meet beyond the shadows.
            Funeral ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> Funeral >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 services were held in the Pleasant Ridge Church of Christ at one o'clock, with Minister J. M. Cochran and Forrest Mobberly officiating.
Source: Obituaries of Monroe County, Ohio, Volume 2, page 16.

Morris, Bernice Rush
Rush, Bernice  ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'>Rush, Bernice >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 (nee--Morris)
Source--Wheeling News Register      Wheeling, West Virginia
======= style='mso-spacerun:yes'> Wheeling, West Virginia >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711
Published--February 1, 2005
RUSH, Bernice E. Morris, 90, formerly of Stelmar Apartments., Wheeling, died Saturday, January 29, 2005 in Peterson Rehabilitation Hospital and Geriatric Center, Wheeling, West Virginia. Bernice was born October 29, 1914 in Marshall County, daughter of the late Charles and Stella Riggle Morris. She was a member of the Wheeling Fellowship Hall of Jehovah Witness. In addition to her parents, she was preceded in death by her husband, Edward Russell Rush, whom she married on May 22, 1937 in New Martinsville, West Virginia; two brothers, Reed and Charles Glenn Morris; four sisters, Elsie Morris, Jeane Becker, Alta Klages, and Marie Friend. Survivors include 13 nieces and nephews. Friends will be received at the Kepner Funeral Home, 166 Kruger Street, Elm Grove, Monday 3-7 p.m. Friends are invited to attend services Tuesday at 11 a.m. in the Chapel at Greenwood Cemetery with Mr. William Johns officiating. Interment in Greenwood Cemetery.
 
Morris, Beryl (nee Williams)              
            Mrs. Beryl Morris, 82, of Salesville ======= 2'>
Mrs. Beryl Morris, 82, of Salesville >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Route 1, wife of Philip Thomas Morris, president of Quaker City Savings and Loan company and former superintendent of school here, died unexpectedly at 7:30 p.m. Saturday (March 14, 1970 ) at her home following an apparent heart attack.
             She was born July 26, 1887, on Salesville, ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> She was born July 26, 1887, on Salesville, >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Route 1, Guernsey County, a daughter of T. J. and Emily Heidelbach Williams. Mrs. Morris was a member of Salesville United Methodist Church.
            Surviving in addition to her husband are two nieces and a nephew. Three sisters and a brother are deceased.
            Services will be held at 1:30 p.m. ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> Surviving in addition to her husband are two nieces and a nephew. Three sisters and a brother are deceased.
Services will be held at 1:30 p.m. >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Tuesday at Eberle Funeral Home with Rev. Alan Teter officiating. Burial will be in Friends Cemetery at Quaker City. Friends may call 2 to 4 and 7 to 9 p.m. at the funeral home.
 
Morris, Betty Lou and John F. Crum

            Miss Betty Lou Morris, ======= JA'> Miss Betty Lou Morris, >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Ermie Morris of Woodsfield, Route 3, and John F. Crum, son of Mr. and Mrs. Raymond J. Crum, of Summerfield Route 1, were united in marriage on Saturday, October nineteenth, at St. Michael's Catholic Church in Carlisle. The Rev. Rudolph Wargo officiated at the double ring ceremony at half after nine o'clock in the morning.

   The altar was decorated with vases ======= JA'> The altar was decorated with vases >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 of pink mums. Miss Euncie Horton was organist.

   The bride, given in marriage by ======= JA'> The bride, given in marriage by >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 her father, wore a floor-length gown of Chantilly Lace. It was designed with a sabrina neckline and long sleeves tapering to points over her hands. The bouffant skirt was made of tiers of Chantilly Lace and net. A crown of pearls and organza petals held her elbow length veil of French silk illusion. Her only jewelry was strand of pears, a gift of the bridegroom, and her bridal bouquet was of pink and white roses with ivy, and a crystal rosary.

   She carried out the tradition of ======= JA'> She carried out the tradition of >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 something old, new, borrowed and blue and a penny in her shoe.

    Mrs. Glen Burkhart, sister of the ======= JA'> Mrs. Glen Burkhart, sister of the >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 bridegroom, was matron of honor. She wore a dress of pink taffeta brocade with matching circular veil, and carried a colonial bouquet of pink and white carnations.

   Glen Burkhart served Mr. Crum as ======= JA'> Glen Burkhart served Mr. Crum as >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 best man.

   The bride's mother chose a navy ======= JA'> The bride's mother chose a navy >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 blue dress with black accessories. Mrs. Crum was attired in a blue and white silk dress with black accessories. Each wore a corsage of white carnations.

   Following the ceremony, a dinner ======= JA'> Following the ceremony, a dinner >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 for the immediate family was served at the home of the bride's parents.

   A shower was held in the evening, ======= JA'> A shower was held in the evening, >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 for one hundred and fifty guests at the home of the bride. Centering the bride's table was a four-tiered wedding cake decorated with pink roses and topped with a miniature bride and groom.

   Hostesses at the dinner and shower ======= JA'> Hostesses at the dinner and shower >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 were Mrs. Lela Christman, Miss Kay Christman, Miss Merle Crawford and Mrs. Gertrude Kahrig, all relatives of the bride.

   The bride is a graduate of Skyvue ======= JA'> The bride is a graduate of Skyvue >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 High School Stafford. She is employed by Highlights for Children at Columbus, Ohio,

   Mr. Crum is a graduate of ======= JA'> Mr. Crum is a graduate of >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Summerfield High School and is employed by Westinghouse at Columbus.

   Leaving for her honeymoon, the ======= JA'> Leaving for her honeymoon, the >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 bride wore a navy and white suit with black accessories and a corsage from her bridal bouquet.

   Mr. and Mrs. Crum are now living ======= JA'> Mr. and Mrs. Crum are now living >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 at 232 West Ninth Avenue, Columbus.

Crawford, >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Beulah M., 83, of 501 Plum Street, Summerfield, died July 7, 2004, in Marietta Memorial Hospital,
Marietta. She was born near Calais, September 16, 1920, a daughter of the late Dory and Alda Wickham Morris.
    She was a homemaker and a member of Seneca Valley Church of Christ, Calais.
    Surviving ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> She was a homemaker and a member of Seneca Valley Church of Christ, Calais.
Surviving >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 are a daughter, Lucile English of New Matamoras; son, Eugene Crawford and his wife, Eleanor, of
Summerfield; brother Freeman Morris, of Sardis; three sisters, Gladys Salisbury, of Sardis, Mary Riggs, of New
Matamoras, Ellen Nolen, of North Carolina; two grandchildren, Cecile English and her fiance, Ryan Watters and
Tiffany English; seven step-grandchildren; 15 step-great-grandchildren; several nieces and nephews.

  She was ======= style='mso-spacerun:yes'> Woodsfield, Ohio
Published-- March 2000
Morris, Bonnie Celebrated her fifthieth birthday anniversary on March 7, 2000.
She was >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 surprised with a birthday party on March 10, given by her mother,
Mary Riggs, Patty McConn and the staff of MACO Workshop.
  Bonnie, who ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> Bonnie, who >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 has been confined to a wheelchair for 34 years, has attended the
MACO Workshop for 26 years and attended the WASCO Workshop in Marietta for four years.
She loves going to the workshop and enjoys her work.
  Bonnie loves going shopping with her friend Patty McConn and eating out.
  She is the daughter of John and Mary Riggs of New Matamoras.

Morris, Byron L. and Miss Myra Jean Claus

Morris, son of Mr. and Mrs. Ermie Morris of Woodsfield, Route 3, were united in marriage on Saturday evening, July fifteenth, 1967. The vows were exchanged at 6:15 p.m. at the home of Minister J. V. A. Traylor who performed the double ring ceremony. Attending the wedding were the couple's parents and the bride's grandmother, Mrs. Laura Claus; also, Mrs. David Lallathin, of Akron, Ohio, sister of the bridegroom, and Mrs. Robert Morris, of Barnesville, Ohio. Mrs. Floyd Crawford, sister of the bride, was matron of honor. Mr. Robert Morris, of Barnesville, served his brother as best man.
            Following ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> Following >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 the ceremony a reception was held at the Beallsville, Ohio High school, with over one hundred friends and relatives attending. Serving as hostesses were the bride's sisters, Mrs. Floyd Crawford and Miss Darlene Claus; and Miss Evelyn Kress, Mrs. Clara Schumacher and Miss Sharon Decker.
            The ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> The >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 bride is a graduate of Beallsville, Ohio High School,Beallsville, Ohio, Ohio and the School of Cosmetology at Cambridge, Ohio. She is employed at Akron, Ohio. Mr. Morris is a graduate of Skyvue High school and is employed by the Pepsi Cola Company in Akron. He served two years in the U. S. Army, one year being spent in Korea.
            Mr. ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> Mr. >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 and Mrs. Morris are making their home at 407 East Archwood, Akron, Ohio. Source: The Monroe County Beacon, Woodsfield, Ohio, dated, July 15, 1967

Morris, Chester L.
Source--News Clipping
Published--September 2003
 Morris, Chester ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> Morris, Chester >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 L., 79, passed away peacefully after a brief illness, September 22, 2003 in Oklahoma City, Oklahoma.
He was born to Dory and Alda Morris on March 11, 1924 in Fly, Ohio
He served his country in the United States Navy during World War II and retired form the United States Postal Service in 2000.
He is survived by his wife, Mildred Morris; three sons, Victor Morris and his wife Theresa, Kenneth Seales and wife Martha, and David Seales; three daughters, Ellen Dorow, Gail Wade and husband Jimmy, and Linda Snider and husband Ron; nine grandchildren; nine great-grandchildren; and many other relatives and friends.
He is preceded in death by his parents; and grandson Bennie Hawkins.
Funeral services will be held 2:00 p.m. Wednesday, September 24, 2003 in the Resthaven Funeral Home Chapel with interment following in Resthaven Memory Gardens.
Resthaven Funeral Home    South West  104th at Walker
