            He ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> He >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 had resided in Ashland for 40 years, moving here from Woodsfield, Ohio.
Mr. Morris was employed as a professional tree trimmer for Nelson Tree Service, retiring in 1977. He was a former employee of Philway Products Co. in Ashland.
            On ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> On >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Nov. 18, 1933 he married Bertha M. Huntsman who survives him. He is also survived by five sisters; Edna Huntsman of Toronto, Ohio; Nettie Brown and Estelle Schaub of Woodsfield; Kathryn Piatt and Bertha Longdon of Ashland.

Morris, Clyde
Source--News Clipping
Published--1996
 CUMBERLAND--Services will be 11 a.m. Friday at ======= style='mso-spacerun:yes'> CUMBERLAND--Services will be 11 a.m. Friday at >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Tom Funeral Home, Cumberland, for Clyde Ellsworth Morris ,67,
of Cumberland, who died Tuesday at Good Samaritan Medical Center, Zanesville.
The Reverend Raymond Grudier will officiate. Burial will be in Warnock Cemetery, Warnock.
Friends may call from 2 to 4 and 7 t0 9 p.m. today at the funeral home.
He was born June 19, 1928, in Woodsfield, son of the late Thomas "Dory" Theodore and Alda Wickham Morris.
He was a retired mechanic from Ziler's Garage, Caldwell, after 34 years of service. He was a member of Harmony Christian Church, Cambridge, and the Byesville American Legion. He was a Army veteran of the Korean War.
He leaves his wife, Nancy R. Baumgardner Morris, whom he married August 6, 1955; two brothers, Chester Morris of Oklahoma City and Freeman Morris of Woodsfield; five sisters, Mrs Ervil (Beulah) Crawford of <<<<<<< HEAD Summerfield, Mrs.Lloyd  (Grace) Henthorn ======= Summerfield, Mrs.Lloyd (Grace) Henthorn >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 and Mrs. Edward (Gladys) Salisbury, both of Sardis, Mrs. John (Mary) Riggs of New Matamoras and Mrs. Don (Ellen) Nolen of Chadburn, North Carolina; several nieces and nephews.

Morris, Dorothy Hannahs
Source--Times Leader    ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'>Source--Times Leader >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Martins Ferry, Ohio
Published--December 21, 2004
Dorothy Jane Hannahs, nee Morris, 56, of Summerfield, Ohio, died Sunday December 19 2004 at Barnesville Hospital. She was born July 16, 1948 in Barnesville a daughter of the late Elmer and Vesta Morris. Dorothy was a homemaker and a member of the Calais Independent Baptist Church. In addition to her parents she was preceded in death by two brothers Jessie and Dale Morris. Surviving are her husband Edsel Hannahs, a daughter Tina (Kevin) Doty of Barnesville, two sons Edsel Jr. Hannahs and Fred (Shannon) Hannahs, all of Summerfield, three grandchildren Jason Doty and Austin Doty of Barnesville, David Doty of Summerfield, a sister Clara Crawford of Dover, Ohio and a brother Roger Morris of Piedmont, Ohio.Friends will be received Wednesday 2 to 4 and 6 to 8 p.m. at Kelly-Kemp-Braido Funeral home 702 East Main Street, Barnesville where services will be held Thursday, 11 a.m., with Reverend Matt Zurowski officiating, burial in Calais Cemetery. Donations may be made to the David Doty Scholarship Fund 29838 Miltonsburg Calais Road,. Summerfield, Ohio 43788.

Hettig on March 5, 1978, Along with two sons, John Melvin Hettig and Byron Dale Hettig; a half brother and a half sister are also deceased.
               Surviving are: one son, Paul ======= style='mso-tab-count:1'> Surviving are: one son, Paul >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Hettig of the home; four daughters, Mrs. Everett (Carolyn) Pittman of Bowling Green, Kentucky, Mary Hettig of the home, Mrs. George (Linda) Larrick of Cumberland, Ohio and Mrs. Michael (Donna) Packard of Burbank, Ohio; nine grandchildren.
               Private funeral services were ======= style='mso-tab-count:1'> Private funeral services were >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 held Tuesday, June 11, 1985, at 1 p.m. in the Watters Funeral Home, Woodsfield with the Reverend John Powell officiating. Final resting place is Bracken Ridge Church Cemetery, Route 2, Lewisville, Ohio.
Source: The Monroe County Beacon, Woodsfield, Ohio, June 10, 1985.
 
Source: The Times Leader, Martins Ferry, OH dated Tuesday, August 12, 2003
Edna A. Huntsman, nee Morris
 
Edna A. Huntsman, 94, of Toronto, passed away Sunday, Aug. 10, 2003 at the Crestview Health Care Center, St. Clairsville, Ohio. She was born May 2, 1909 in Middlebourne, W. Va., the daughter of the late Adloph and Emma Jean Barker Morris.
Edna was affiliated with the North River Ave., Church of Christ in Toronto; a member of the Toronto V.F.W. Auxiliary Post No. 6906. Edna retired from the former Skippers Haven Yacht Club of Toronto.
 
In addition to her parents, she was preceded in death by her husband, Harry Earl Huntsman, who passed away in 1955 and whom she married Nov. 24, 1928; three sons, Charles H. (1936), Francis M. (1969) and Harry L. Huntsman (2002); one daughter, Martha Howell (1967); two brothers, three sisters, four grandsons and one great-great grandson.
 
Surviving are two sons, Marvin Huntsman, Sacramento, Calif., and Joseph Huntsman, Milledgeville, Ga.; five daughters, Sylvia Spencer and husband Clifford, Toronto and Betty Baker and husband Harold, Caldwell, Ohio, Thelma Hicks, Channelview, Texas, Edna Lucas and husband Francis, Bethesda, Ohio and Janet Rock and husband, James, Toronto; three sisters, Kathryn Piatt, and Bertha London, both of Ashland, Ohio and Nettie Brown, Woodsfield, Ohio; sister-in-law, Bertha Morris, Ashland, Ohio; several grandchildren, great grandchildren and great-great grandchildren.
 
Friends and family will be received for visitation 2 to 4 and 6 to 8 p.m., Tuesday, at the Clarke Funeral Home, 302 Main St., Toronto.
 
The Toronto V.F. W. Auxiliary will conduct services at the funeral home on Tuesday at 7 p.m.
 
A funeral service will be held, 11 a.m., Wednesday, Aug. 13, 2003 at the funeral home with Pastor Robert Hanze officiating. Burial will follow at the Island Creek Cemetery, Church Road, Toronto.
 
Memorial contributions in memory of Edna may be sent to the Crestview Health Care Center Activity Fund, 68637 Bannock Road, St. Clairsville, Ohio 43950.

Morris, Esther (nee Moore)
            Funeral ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> Funeral >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 services for Mrs. Esther Morris, aged thirty years, who was found dear early Sunday evening at the home of her father, G.P. Moore, of Quaker City route, were conducted Tuesday forenoon in the Bates Hill Christian Church by Rev. Fred Dentist.
             Interment was made in the church cemetery. The ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> Interment was made in the church cemetery. The >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 deceased had been afflicted with epilepsy for some time and as there was a bruise on her head it is supposed that she suffered an attack and fell, striking her head and had later laid down across the bed where her father, who had been away from home, found her upon his return. Besides the father she is survived by one brother Earl, of Quaker City and two sisters, Mrs. Earl Carpenter, of near Calais and Mrs. Hayes Bates, of Whigville. Morris, Ethel and Mr. Thurman Bishop
            Miss Ethel Morris, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Spencer Morris, of Graysville, Ohio, Route 1 and Mr. Thurman Bishop, son of Mr. and Mrs. John Bishop, Sr., of Woodsfield Route 1 were united in marriage on Saturday afternoon, December 31, 1929. The ceremony was performed at 2:30 oclock by Minister J. V. A. Traylor, pastor of the Woodsfield Church of Christ, at his home on Eastern avenue.
            The bride was dressed in Royal blue with accessories to match. A wedding dinner was served at the home of the brides parents on Sunday, January 1st.
            For the present the couple will make their home with the bridegrooms parents. Many ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> Miss Ethel Morris, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Spencer Morris, of Graysville, Ohio, Route 1 and Mr. Thurman Bishop, son of Mr. and Mrs. John Bishop, Sr., of Woodsfield Route 1 were united in marriage on Saturday afternoon, December 31, 1929. The bride was dressed in Royal blue with accessories to match. A wedding dinner was served at the home of the bride s parents on Sunday, January 1st.

 Sardis - Grace ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> Sardis - Grace >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 L. Henthorn, 79, of Township 512, Sardis, died Wednesday (January 30, 2002) at her home.
She was born April 16, 1922, in Belmont County, Ohio, to Dory and Luetta Wickham Morris. She was a member of Brownsville Church of Christ.
She is survived by her husband, Lloyd Henthorn of Sardis, whom she married 55 years ago; one son, Paul Henthorn of Sardis; four daughters, Sara Huff of Hayesville, Ohio, Millie Haney of Sardis, and Marlene Terwilliger and Shirley McCaslin, both of Woodsfield; two brothers, Freeman Morris of Sardis and Chester Morris of Oklahoma; four sisters, Beulah Crawford of Summerfield, Gladys Salisbury of Sardis, Mary Riggs of New Matamoras and Ellen Nolan of North Carolina; 12 grandchildren; 18 great-grandchildren; and one great-great-grandson.
            She was preceded in death by her parents and one brother, Clyde Morris.

Services >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 are at 1 p.m. Friday at Bauer-Turner Funeral Home, 100 S. Paul St., Woodsfield, with Minister Warren Kinney officiating. Burial is in West Union Cemetery near Sardis. Friends will be received from 2 to 9 p.m. today at the funeral home.

Morris, George A. G.
            We have a copy of his certificate of ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> We have a copy of his certificate of >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 death filled out by Georgiana Morris, his second wife. His age is listed as 90 years 7 months and 18 days, and he died of pneumonia (lobar) December 27, 1922. It says he is a retired farmer who was born in Noble County, Ohio. Georgiana indicated that she did not know the names or birthplaces of his parents. The words "pension copy issued" is stamped on this death form indicating he served in the Civil War.
 His obituary read:        Death of A. Morris
                Had Been a Resident of Topeka for Fifty-Two Years
             "George A. Morris, 90, for fifty-two years ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> His obituary read: Death of A. Morris
Had Been a Resident of Topeka for Fifty-Two Years
"George A. Morris, 90, for fifty-two years >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 a resident of Topeka, died Wednesday afternoon at his home, 1528 North Van Buren street. Born in Mabel County [this should be NOBLE County], Ohio, he came to Kansas in its early days, and for many years was a farmer.
             "He retired from active work many years ago, and since that time has made his home in Topeka.
             "He is survived by his widow, Mrs. ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> "He retired from active work many years ago, and since that time has made his home in Topeka.
"He is survived by his widow, Mrs. >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Georgiania [sic] Morris, and five children: Mrs. Freeman Sardou, Sarah E. Morris and Mrs. R.K. Hyatt, of Topeka; James Morris, Old Mexico; and Mrs. Luella Whiteside, Carthage, MO."
Source: Death Certificate and Obituary
 
Morris, Grace L. Henthorn
               Grace L. Henthorn, (nee Morris) ======= style='mso-tab-count:1'> Grace L.             Surviving are his wife, Hazel Ady, whom he married January, 27, 1968; three daughters, Dianna Morris, Sharon Morris, Januaryice Morris; two sons, Jesse Junior Morris II, Jason Morris; two grandchildren, David and Casey Morris; two sisters, Mrs. John (Clara) Crawford and Mrs. Edsel (Dorothy) Hannahs; two brothers, Dale ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> Surviving are his wife, Hazel Ady, whom he married January, 27, 1968; three daughters, Dianna Morris, Sharon Morris, Januaryice Morris; two sons, Jesse Junior Morris II, Jason Morris; two grandchildren, David and Casey Morris; two sisters, Mrs. John (Clara) Crawford and Mrs. Edsel (Dorothy) Hannah s; two brothers, Dale >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Morris and his wife Almeta, Roger and his wife Barbara. Emal Allen officiating. Burial was at Hillcrest Memorial Gardens. Memorial contributions may be made to the First Church of Christ in Rittman.
 
Morris, John A.
            John ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> John >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 A Morris, Wednesday morning at about 2 o'clock at his home in this township. Mr Morris was born in Monroe county Ohio, March 22, 1825, and consequently would have been 60 years old on the 22d of next March had he lived. He has been a citizen of this community several years and is well known to a large number of our readers. He was taken sick the latter part of last August and has been a great sufferer ever since. His disease seems to have been consumption, aggravated, no doubt, by kidney troubles from which he has suffered more or less for a number of years.
His funeral occurred yesterday and he was buried at Pleasant Valley cemetery, nine miles south of here in Sedgwick county by the side of a brother of Mrs Morris buried there a few years ago.
The deceased was a member of the church for about 30 years, twenty years of which time he was a member of the Christian church, with which he was connected at the time of his death. He left assurance behind him that he died in the faith of the gospel and hence has only been transferred from the church militant to the church triumphant. He leaves behind an' aged companion and several grown children to mourn his taking off. The sympathies of a large circle of neighbors go out to the bereaved family.
Card of Thanks: The family of John A Morris desire to express their heartfelt thanks to their neighbors for the uniformly kind treatment during all the period of sickness of the husband and father.
Source: Page 3 of the Halstead Kansas Independent
Friday, February 6, 1885 edition

Morris, Kenneth E.
             Pfc. Kenneth E. Morris, son of Mr. and Mrs. ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> Pfc. Kenneth E. Morris, son of Mr. and Mrs. >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Ermie Morris, of Woodsfield, Route 3, is now stationed with a mortar squadron at Lai Kai, Vietnam. Pfc. Morris received his basic and advanced training at Fort Jackson, South Carolina. In December, he spent a 21-day furlough at home, following which he reported to the Replacement Center at Oakland, California. His address is: Pfc. Kenneth E. Morris, U.S. 51-879-340, Company C 1/18 Infantry, APO San Francisco,
California 96345. Source:The Monroe County Beacon, February 1968.

Latta, (nee Morris) daughter of Harry G. and Mary Morris was born Sept. 6, l837, near Calais and passed away May l3, l927, aged 89 years, 8 months, and 7 days. [wife of John Copeland Latta] She was united in marriage to John Coplan [Submitter s note: Usually seen as Copeland] Latta March 16, 1861. To this union was born eight children.

Morris, Myrna Lorena Anderson

Zanesville, >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Ohio - Myra Lorena Anderson, (nee Morris) 96, of Zanesville, formerly of Graysville, died Tuesday (June 24, 2003) at the Woodsfield Nursing and Rehabilitation Center.
             She was born March 7, 1907, near Graysville to ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> She was born March 7, 1907, near Graysville to >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Andrew Spencer Morris and Zelda Pearl Kinkade Morris. She was a member of the Pleasant Ridge Church of Christ for more than 80 years. She married Cars Alexander Anderson on September 1, 1927. He died April 13, 1983.
            She ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> She >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 is survived by two daughters, Mrs. Ray (Rosalie) Coss and Mrs. Fred (Ruth) Woodyard, both of Zanesville; one son, Willis Anderson and his wife, Betty, of Graysville; two sisters, Mrs. Orpha (Mildred) Vess of Lower Salem and Mrs. Ray (Ethel) Sullivan of Columbus; eight grandchildren; 15 great-grandchildren; and three great-great-grandchildren.
            In ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> In >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 addition to her husband, she was preceded in death by her parents; and six brothers, William Alfonzo Morris, Earl Morris, Edward Morris, Isaac Morris, Maywood Morris and an infant brother.
            Services ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> Services >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 are at 2 p.m. Friday at Bauer-Turner Funeral Home at 100 S. Paul St., Woodsfield, with Minister Harold Kinney officiating.
            Burial ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> Burial >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 is in Pleasant Ridge Cemetery near Graysville. Friends will be received from 2 to 4 and 7 to 9 p.m. Thursday at the funeral home.
Source: The Marietta Times, dated Wednesday., June 25, 2003.

Morris, Phillip T.
               Phillip T. Morris, 96, of ======= style='mso-tab-count:1'> Phillip T. Morris, 96, of >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Cambridge, Ohio died Saturday, April 10, 1982 at Guernsey Memorial Hospital, Cambridge, following a brief illness.
               He was born in Monroe County, ======= style='mso-tab-count:1'> He was born in Monroe County, >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Ohio on May 22, 1885, son of the late Charles T. and Barbara Christman Morris. He was preceded in death by his wife, Beryl Williams, in 1970.
               He attended Muskingum College and ======= style='mso-tab-count:1'> He attended Muskingum College and >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 was a graduate of Ohio Northern University. He was a retired teacher and educator and a member of Stop 9 Church of Christ, Byesville, Ohio.
               He leaves a brother, Rodney ======= style='mso-tab-count:1'> He leaves a brother, Rodney >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Morris of Cambridge, Ohio; and two sisters, Mrs. Sherman Dearth of Warren, Ohio and Mrs. Freda Swank of Quaker City, Ohio. A sister and three brothers are deceased. Friends called Monday at Scott-Atkinson funeral home, where services were Tuesday with Evangelist Abe Miller officiating. Burial was in Friends Cemetery, Quaker City.
Source: The Journal-Leader, Caldwell, Ohio, Thursday, April 15, 1982.

R.M. (Mac) Morris, 84, died early Thursday in the home of his daughter, Mrs. Jacob Rubel, Summerfield, route 2, following a six-week illness.

     Funeral will be held Sunday afternoon at 2 o'clock from the Seneca Valley Church of Christ.  Burial will be in Calais cemetery. The body ======= JA'> Funeral will be held Sunday afternoon at 2 o'clock from the Seneca Valley Church of Christ. Burial will be in Calais cemetery. The body >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 will be returned to Mrs. Rubel's residence Saturday afternoon from the Eberle Funeral Home in Quaker City.

     His death occurred exactly one ======= JA'> His death occurred exactly one >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 year after the death of his wife, Mrs. Alice Carpenter.

     The son of Henry and Anna ======= JA'> The son of Henry and Anna >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Carptenter Morris, he was born in Monroe County, Oct. 27, 1864, and had spent his entire life in that community.

     Besides Mrs. Rubel, Mr. Morris ======= JA'> Besides Mrs. Rubel, Mr. Morris >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 is survived by three-granddaughters and three great-granddaughters.

[Source: The Times Recorder, Zanesville, Ohio, Friday, February 4, 1949, p. 14]

Morris, Robert Eugene and Dorothy Lee Hoff
            Miss Dorothy Lee Hoff became the bride of Robert Eugene Morris in a ceremony performed Saturday evening, April twenty-third, 1960 at St. Peters United Church of Christ (Evangelical and Reformed), Lewisville, Ohio.
            The bride is the youngest daughter of Mr.  ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> Miss Dorothy Lee Hoff became the bride of Robert Eugene Morris in a ceremony performed Saturday evening, April twenty-third, 1960 at St. Peter s United Church of Christ (Evangelical and Reformed), Lewisville, Ohio.
The bride is the youngest daughter of Mr. >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 and Mrs. Ernest Hoff, of Lewisville, Route 2. The groom is the oldest son of Mr. and Mrs. Ermie Morris, of Woodsfield, Route 3.
            The Reverend George W. Varns officiated at the double ring ceremony and sang the Lords Prayer at the close of the ceremony. Mrs. Amos DeWitt presented a one-half hour of nuptial music.
            Given ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> The Reverend George W. Varns officiated at the double ring ceremony and sang the Lord s Prayer at the close of the ceremony. Mrs. Amos DeWitt presented a one-half hour of nuptial music.
Given >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 in marriage by her father, the bride chose a floor-length gown of acetate-nylon lace over acetate taffeta.
            Miss Sara Rose Morris, sister of the groom, was her only attendant.
            Richard ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> Miss Sara Rose Morris, sister of the groom, was her only attendant.
Richard >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Weber, cousin of the bride, served as best man. Ushers were Byron Morris, brother of the groom, and Robert Weber, cousin of the bride. The candles were lighted by Donald Weber, cousin of the bride.
            Immediately ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> Immediately >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 following the ceremony, a reception for over two hundred guests was held at Fellowship Hall, near Lewisville. Assisting at the reception were Miss Charlotte Mobley, Miss Alice Reich, Miss Betty Lou Morris, Mrs. Willard Weber, Mrs. Francis Heft and Miss Ruth Hinderlong. Miss Betty Lou Morris, sister of the groom, presided over the guest book.
            Mr. and Mrs. Morris are graduates of Lewisville High School, class of 1957. Mrs. Morris is employed with the Campus Shirt Company at Barnesville, Ohio. Mr. Morris is employed by Robert Butlers Trucking, of Barnesville. The couple is ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> Mr. and Mrs. Morris are graduates of Lewisville High School, class of 1957. Mrs. Morris is employed with the Campus Shirt Company at Barnesville, Ohio. Mr. Morris is employed by Robert Butler s Trucking, of Barnesville. The couple is >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 residing in their newly purchased home at 325 Hunts Avenue, Barnesville.
Source: The Monroe County Beacon, Woodsfield, Ohio, Monday, June 20, 1960.

Morris, Rodney Dale and Miss Linda Lou Wade

            Wedding ======= JA'> Wedding >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 vows were exchanged by Miss Linda Lou Wade, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Thomas Wade of Barnesville, and Mr. Rodney Dale Morris, son of Mr. and Mrs. Ermie Morris of Woodsfield Route three, on Saturday afternoon, June twentieth. The double ring ceremony was performed by Minister J. V. A. Traylor at his home at five o'clock with members of the immediate families present.

            The ======= JA'> The >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 bride wore a street length gown of silk organza over taffeta with an empire waistline and long sleeves. Her shoulder length veil was held by a floral band. She carried a bouquet of white carnations on a white Bible, a gift of the bridegroom. Miss Almeta Hayes, friend of the bride, was maid of honor. She wore a turquoise gown identical to the bride's. Her bouquet was of blue tinted carnations. Mr. Kenneth Morris, brother of the bridegroom, served as best man. The reception was held at St. John's Parish Hall, Miltonsburg, immediately after the ceremony. Reception hostesses were Mrs. LaVern Christman, Mrs. Danny Watson, Mrs. Lela Christman and Mrs. Ed Gillespie. Miss Sharon Strous was in charge of the guest book and Mrs. David Lallathin registered the gifts.

   A dance followed the reception ======= JA'> A dance followed the reception >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 with music by the County Serenaders. Mrs. Morris is a graduate of Barnesville High School. Mr. Morris is a graduate of Skyvue High School and is employed by Landmark in Bethesda. The couple is residing at 210 South Broadway, Barnesville.

   Out of town guests were from Mansfield, ======= JA'> Out of town guests were from Mansfield, >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Cadiz, Akron, Massillon, Bethesda, Flushing, Columbus, North Lawrence, Port Washington, Ashland, Quaker City, Shelby, Lewisville and Westerville.

Source: The Monroe County Beacon, September 2, 1970

Morris, Pvt. Russell A.
            Mr. and Mrs. Adolph Morris, of ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> Mr. and Mrs. Adolph Morris, of >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Lewisville, Route 2, received a telegram from the War Department on March 19th, stating their son, Pvt. Russell A. Morris was killed in Germany on March 3rd.
            Private Morris, who entered service ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> Private Morris, who entered service >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 October 14, 1942, received his basic training in North Carolina, sailing for overseas December 26, 1942. He was wounded in Italy where he spent six months in the hospital, returning to the States in February 1944. Following his recovery he received additional training in Texas, and again sailed for overseas in February 1945. He landed in Belgium on February 25th and on March 3rd was killed.
            Russell was born July 3, 1921, at ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> Russell was born July 3, 1921, at >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Harrisville, W. Va. He leaves to mourn his sad departure, his father and mother, Adolph and Emma Morris; one brother and seven sisters, Clarence Morris and Mrs. Edna Huntsman of Belmont; Mrs. Estelle Lendon and Mrs. Vesta Morris both of Woodsfield, Route 3; Mrs. Nellie Matz of Lewisville, Route 2; Mrs. Kathryn Leasure, of Stafford; Mrs. Bertha Longdon, of Louisville, Ky., and Nettie of the home; also a host of other relatives and friends.
 
======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711
Here at last, and over yonder
Just within the pearly gates
Watching still for loved ones coming
Now our son and brother waits.
 
======= style='mso-spacerun:yes'> >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711
When we, too, shall cross the river
And on earth we no Longer roam
May we reunite together
Safe at last in that bright home.
Card of Thanks
  We wish to ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> We wish to >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 take this opportunity to thank all our neighbors and friends for their kind words, and letters and cards of sympathy we received after the of our son and brother. Such kindness can never be forgotten. Mr. and Mrs. Adolph Morris and Children. Source: Published:1945

Morris, Sarah J. Okey
            The ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> The >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 family of R. W. Pope of this place received a telegram last Thursday, announcing the death of Mrs. Sarah J. Okey, (nee Morris) widow of Charles Okey, which occurred at her home in Corning, Iowa, on April 21, from a stroke of paralysis. Mrs. Okey was a daughter of the Honorable James R. Morris, founder of The Spirit of Democracy, and spent her early life in Woodsfield, where she <<<<<<< HEAD will be better remembered as Sister Morris. Her husband, Charles Okey, died ======= will be better remembered as Sister Morris. Her husband, Charles Okey, died >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 several years ago. She had many friends here, where she was universally respected and highly esteemed. Source: The Spirit of Democracy, Thursday, April 29, 1920.

Morris, Sara Rose and David Lallathin

            Miss ======= JA'> Miss >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Sara Morris daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Ermie Morris of Woodsfield Route 3, and David Lallathin, son of Mr. and Mrs. Donald Lallathin of Clarington Route 1, were united in marriage on Saturday, February fifteenth.

            The ======= JA'> The >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 vows were exchanged at half after one o'clock in the afternoon with Minister J. V. A. Traylor performing the double ring ceremony at the his home. The couple's parents were in attendance.

            The ======= JA'> The >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 bride chose for her wedding a ballerina length gown of white lace and chiffon. The fitted bodice was designed with a round neckline and long sleeves and the full skirt was chiffon over satin. A crown of pearls and organza petals held her elbow length veil of French silk illusion. Her only jewelry was a strand of pearls, a gift of the bridegroom. Her white Bible was topped with an orchid with white satin streamers. She carried out the tradition of something old, new, borrowed and blue and a penny in her shoe.

            Mrs. ======= JA'> Mrs. >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 John Crum, sister of the bride, was matron of honor. She wore a dress of light blue chiffon and satin with a lace jacket, and a matching rose design veil. She carried a colonial bouquet of pink carnation. Graydon Lallathin served his brother as best man.

            The ======= JA'> The >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 bride's mother chose a navy blue dress with black accessories. The groom's mother was attired in a beige dress with a brown jacket, with which she wore brown accessories. Both mothers wore a corsage of white carnations.

            The ======= JA'> The >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 bride is a graduate of Lewisville High School, Lewisville. She was formerly employed by The Columbus Dental Mfg. Co., at Columbus.

            Mr. ======= JA'> Mr. >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Lallathin is a graduate of River High School, Hannibal, and the Andrew Barber College, at Columbus.

            He is now employed by ======= JA'> He is now employed by >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Antonie's Barber Shop in Akron. Mr. and Mrs. Lallathin are now residing at 605 East Avenue, Akron, Ohio.

Morris, Sara Nolen
TABOR CITY, North Carolina. - Sara Ellen Morris Nolen, 68, of Tabor City, North Carolina, died Saturday (November 13, 2004) at her residence.
Sara was preceded in death by her parents, Theodore and Alda Wickman Morris, and her husband, Donald Nolen.
She is survived by two daughters, Barbara Rush of Thornton, West Virginia., and Dianna Watts of Nakina, North Carolina ; two sons, Joseph Morris of Tabor City, North Carolina., and Brent Nolen of Marietta; two sisters, Mary Riggs and Gladys Salisbury, both of Monroe County; one brother, Freeman Morris, also of Monroe County; and nine grandchildren.
Friends are invited to attend memorial graveside services at 11 a.m. on Wednesday (November 17) at High Ridge Cemetery in Bellaire, Ohio.
Local arrangements are by the Bauknecht Altmeyer Funeral Homes and Crematory, 441 37th Street, Bellaire, Ohio.
Source--Marietta Times      Marietta, Ohio. Published--November 16, 2004
 
======= style='mso-spacerun:yes'> Marietta, Ohio. Published--November 16, 2004
>>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711
Morris, Shirley A.

Morris, Thomas J.
            Thomas James Morris, 29, of 65527 Lake ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> Thomas James Morris, 29, of 65527 Lake >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Road, Cambridge, died October 11, 1994, at Guernsey Memorial Hospital, Cambridge. He was born in Canton on April 14, 1965, son of Herman and Marjorie Bennington Morris. He was owner of Morris Construction of Cambridge and was a Protestant by faith.
            Surviving in addition to his parents ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> Surviving in addition to his parents >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 of Quaker City, are his wife, Carla Mathers Morris of the home;one son, Justin Morris of the home; three brothers, Charles Morris and Dale Morris, both of Quaker City,and William Morris of Cambridge; two sisters, Mrs. James (Louise) Sarchet of Old Washington and Mrs. Robert (Brenda) Speicher of Hendrysburg; his grandmother, Wilda Bennington of Lore City; several nieces and nephews.

Joseph Pearce officiating, Burial was made in Friends Cemetery, Quaker City. Source: Published--October 1994.

Morris, Thomas Jefferson
            The ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> The >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Morris family Bible lists his birthday as July l3, 1845. He lived on a farm over the hill from the Latta homestead. His children went to Fox Hollow School. Some of them are on the picture I have of the class of 1893. Pictured there are Dolph, Lydia, Belle, Grover and John Morris. He is not mentioned in the 1880 Federal Census of Monroe County. Perhaps he had moved because the children of him and his second wife Susanna were born from 1881 through 1890.
    Tom Morris ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> Tom Morris >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 was the last one buried on the plot on the Latta farm in Monroe County. The family had to get special permission to do it. Don and I visited this cemetery in 2002. His stone was about 12 feet from the main line of the rest of the family. About 10 x 14 inches showed above the ground. It was still standing. Each of the engraved lines was centered
 T. J.
 Morris
 1845-1921
            The records regarding his children ======= style='mso-spacerun:yes'> T. J.
Morris
1845-1921
The records regarding his children >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 were given to Elsie by the grandchildren of Thomas J. Morris of the second marriage to Susannah. They gave William Morris as a son of this marriage. [She questioned whether he should be entered there or as a son of the first marriage since he was born in January 1879, and Thomas J. and the second wife were not married until July 7, 1879. I entered him with the first wife until we find her date of death. Perhaps she died in childbirth.]
            We have a copy of his certificate of ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> We have a copy of his certificate of >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 death. The informant was his son Alva Morris who did not know the birthplace of Thomas J.'s father or mother (Henry or Mary Kinkade Morris). The cause of death was gastro enteris catarrh. It said the disease was contracted "at home.

Morris, William W.
            While not unexpected by the family and ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> While not unexpected by the family and >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 friends the of William W. Morris came as a distinct shock to the community last Tuesday.
            For two years he battled courageously ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> For two years he battled courageously >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 and cheerfully against the steady encroachment of his ailment and while at times he seemed to improve yet it was a losing fight and in the afternoon on the day mentioned his tired spirit forsook its temple and winged itself away to eternity.
            William Walton Morris was born in Center Township seventy-one years ago the twenty-third of last July.
            Formerly a carpenter and farmer by ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> William Walton Morris was born in Center Township seventy-one years ago the twenty-third of last July.
Formerly a carpenter and farmer by >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 occupation, he moved to Woodsfield in 1892, assuming the superintendency of The Children"s Home, which position he held for eight years, after which he conducted The Morris House.
             In this latter capacity he enjoyed the ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> In this latter capacity he enjoyed the >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 acquaintance of a wide circle of friends and patrons. Mr. Morris was a consistent church man, a member of the official board of The Methodist Church.
            He leaves a wife, daughter, three ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> He leaves a wife, daughter, three >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 grand children, an adopted son, three stepdaughters and a host of friends to mourn his.
            A kindly, genial man, an honest, ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> A kindly, genial man, an honest, >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 upright christian gentleman, has gone from our midst to test the promises of the future.
            Interment was had in Oak Lawn Cemetery ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> Interment was had in Oak Lawn Cemetery >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 where he rests beside the two daughters who preceded him, awaiting the call triumphant.
            The hope that animated him, the life ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> The hope that animated him, the life >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 he led, the charity and love he bore his fellowman, is his epitaph, far more enduring than any words that might be written or carved in marble, because that hope and that love and that life will leave its impress upon the world Long after earthly things shall have disappeared in the wreck of mortar and the <<<<<<< HEAD crash of worlds.  -A Friend-
======= crash of worlds. -A Friend- >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711
Source: The Spirit of Democracy, Woodsfield, Ohio, August 15, 1918.
 
Morris, William L.
            William L. Morris, 79 East Canton, died ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> William L. Morris, 79 East Canton, died >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Wednesday, June 6, 2001, at Manor Care, Belden Village, following an extended illness. He was born in Shadyside and has resided in the Canton area most of his life.
             He worked as a powerhouse engineer for Pioneer ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> He worked as a powerhouse engineer for Pioneer >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Foods for 28 years and then was employed by Ford Motor Company in Indianapolis, Indianna for 11 years, retiring in 1988. He served with the U.S. Merchant Marines during World War ll and was an active member of the Canton Baptist Temple and Ambassador Sunday School Class. Mr. Morris was also a member of the Stark County Gem and Mineral Club, Sugarcreek Valley Chapter of the Archaeological Society of Ohio, National Rifle Association, and U.S. Veterans, Canton Hall of Fame Chapter.
            He was preceded in death by his parents, Sanford and Kathleen Morris; brothers, James and Robert Morris.
            He is survived by his wife Wilma M. ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> He was preceded in death by his parents, Sanford and Kathleen Morris; brothers, James and Robert Morris.
He is survived by his wife Wilma M. >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Morris to whom he was married for 57 years; his sons and daughters in law, Larry L. and Nancy Morris and Gregory R. and Jeanette Morris both of East Canton; daughter and son in law, Janet C. and Gerald Newell of Louisville; grandsons, Aaron P.Morris, Brandon W. Morris, David L. Newell and Robert D. Newell; sisters, Martha Skaggs of Logan, Betty Sturgill of St. Clairsville and Januaryalene Kindelberger of Navarre; sister in law, Patricia Morris of Canton and numerous nieces and nephews.
             Funeral services will be conducted today at 8 ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> Funeral services will be conducted today at 8 >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 p.m. in the Reed Funeral Home, Canton, with Dr. Harold Henniger officiating. Graveside services will be Friday at 11.a.m. at Powhatan Cemetery, Powhatan Point. Calling hours are tonight from 6.p.m. until time of services.

Morris, William W.
            William W. Morris, aged 70 years, died ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> William W. Morris, aged 70 years, died >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 at his home on Main Street, Tuesday afternoon. Mr. Morris had been in very poor health for over a year and endured great suffering at times.
            He ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> He >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 was well known to many people of Monroe County, having been superintendent of the childrens home for several years and proprietor of the Morris Boarding House for a number of years. He leaves a wife and one daughter, Mrs. William Schumacher and three step-daughters, Mrs. Archie Cooper and Misses Lizzie and Minnie Rose of the home. Two daughters, Mrs. S. V. Steward and Miss Amy Morris preceded him to the grave.
            The ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> The >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 funeral services will be held this Thursday afternoon at 3:30 from the home. Source: The Spirit of Democracy, Woodsfield, Ohio. August 8, 1918
 
Morris, Wilson Henry
            Wilson and some of his children are ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> Wilson and some of his children are >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 buried at Merrill Ridge Church Cemetery, near Rinard Mills, Monroe County, Ohio. Elizabeth Hinton has pictures of the church and stones.
            Wilson Henry Morris (20 Mar 1827 - 1 July 1921)                                                  Wilson Morris"
            Catharine Fedorchak's Family Research ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> Wilson Henry Morris (20 Mar 1827 - 1 July 1921) Wilson Morris"
Catharine Fedorchak's Family Research >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 in Monroe Co., Vol. II, Part II: "In the 1860 census Henry Morris can be found on page 132, Family No. 619. His three oldest sons are on page 514 in Wayne Township, families 1061 - Wilson, married to Hannah Jane LONG. . . Also on page 38 of this volume: "Wilson Morris died in Monroe Co. at the age of 94 and some of his descendants live near Rinard's Mills on Route 26." Elsie Bonam gave me a handwritten receipt signed by Wilson: "August 28th <<<<<<< HEAD 1860  Received of H. G. Morris three ======= 1860 Received of H. G. Morris three >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 hundred and seventy-five dollars to pay on land. Elsie Bonam's notes: "Wilson married Hannah Jane Long about 1858. She died November 16, 1878, at the age of 38 years and 23 days, believed to be the daughter of Jacob Long and Hannah. No marriage record is available of Wilson Morris and Hannah Jane Long because several fires in Monroe County, Ohio."                            
======= style='mso-tab-count:3'> >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711
Application to Probate Filed: Wilson Morris deceased July 13th. A.D. 1921...................instrument of writing, purporting to be the last Will of Wilson Morris of Washington Township, in this County, deceased, was produced in open Court for Probate, and there being no widow it is now ..........the said Will be filed, and that due notice thereof and of the application to admit the same to Probate and record be given in writing, James Morris, Frank Morris, Evaline WILLIAMS, Jacob Morris, Newton Morris and Melissa Hall, and by publication for 3 weeks in The Spirit of Democracy to Thurman Morris, Clesson Morris, Oral [?] Morris and Webster PRATT next of kin of the testator. ^ (except the last family whose address is unknown .............the State of Ohio five days prior thereto; that said application will be for hearing before this Court, on the 6th day of August A.D. 1921 at 10 A.M. and <<<<<<< HEAD this cause is continued.  O. P. C?assil, Probate Judge" [or perhaps Gassil?]
            His ======= this cause is continued. O. P. C?assil, Probate Judge" [or perhaps Gassil?]
His >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 death record found in Vol. 1, page 98 of Washington Twp., Monroe County, gave this information:
date of death - July 1, 1921, date of birth - March 20, 1827
place of birth - Ohio, cause of death - acute gastritis
color - white; sex - male; occupation - farmer
parents' name - Henry Morris, by whom reported - R. H. Latta M.D.
            Wilson and some of his children are ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> Wilson and some of his children are >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 buried at Merrill Ridge Church Cemetery, near Rinard Mills, Monroe County, Ohio. Elizabeth Hinton has pictures of the church and stones.

Morrison, Beryl O. (nee Mobberly)
            Beryl ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> Beryl >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 O. Morrison, 79, of the Horn's Nursing Home, Wooster, formerly of Monroe County and Lodi, died Aug. 26, 2002, at the nursing home. She was born at Sycamore Valley, October. 14, 1922, a daughter of the late Amos and Olive B. Smith Mobberly. She was a homemaker and a member of the Medina Church of Christ in Medina. Surviving are two daughters, Martha Warner, Shirley Boreman, both of Wooster; two sons, Phil Morrison, Florida, Lonnie Morrison and his wife, Wileen, Strongsville; two sisters, Mrs. John (June) Hester, Medina, Mrs. Rolland (Mona) Bigley, Medina; eight grandchildren; six great-grandchildren.

Morrow, Elizabeth
            The ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> The >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 following account of the funeral of Miss Elizabeth Morrow was taken from Daily Times of Beaver, Pennsylvania:
            The funeral of Miss Elizabeth Morrow, of Rochester, was held Saturday afternoon at 2:30 oclock from the residence of Mr. and Mrs. John W. Dowell, 90 Dewey ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> The funeral of Miss Elizabeth Morrow, of Rochester, was held Saturday afternoon at 2:30 o clock from the residence of Mr. and Mrs. John W. Dowell, 90 Dewey >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 avenue. The services were conducted by Rev. Dr. W. A. Atkinson, pastor of the First Presbyterian church. The singing was by Miss Esther Heller, Miss Mae Dunivan and John W. Hartzel. Beautiful floral tributes were in evidence. Burial was in the Beaver cemetery. The pallbearers were E. M. HAYS, J. W. Hartzel, J. H. Muir and Mr. Packard. Miss Morrow was well known in the Beaver Valley. She was a graduate of Mt. Union college. For years she was a teacher in the Toronto Conneaut, Ohio schools. She afterward went to Switzerland where she was graduated from the University of Zurich and later was a teacher three years in the Monaca public schools. A brother, Will Morrow, lives in St. Louis, <<<<<<< HEAD Missouri
            Miss ======= Missouri
Miss >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Morrow was born and raised in Monroe County and was the daughter of the late Mr. and Mrs. Thomas Morrow. She was one of the most efficient teachers ever sent from the County. For over fifty years she gave her time and energy to the betterment of humanity. About three years ago her heart failed her and she was compelled to give up her life work.
Source: The Spirit of Democracy, Woodsfield, Ohio, Thursday, March 27, 1924

Mosbacker, Kruthaup, Evelyn, nee Mosbacker
Source--Times Leader        Martins Ferry, Ohio
Published--August  ======= style='mso-spacerun:yes'> Martins Ferry, Ohio
Published--August >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 16, 2004
Evelyn Lydia Kruthaup, 75, of 5495 Ansteatt Road, Batavia, Ohio, died Saturday, August 14, 2004 in the Woodsfield Nursing and Rehabilitation Center, Woodsfield, Ohio. She was born at Batavia, Ohio, on March 23, 1929, a daughter of the late Elton and Olive Bauer Mosbacker. She was a retired Realtor; a former bookkeeper for Dorney Plumbing at Hyde Park, Ohio and was a former salesperson for Longaberger Baskets in Dresden, Ohio. She was a member of the Woodsfield Church of Christ, Woodsfield, Ohio and was a member of the V.F.W. Ladies Auxiliary in Williamsburg, Ohio. She enjoyed playing pool and euchre in her spare time. In addition to her parents, she was preceded in death by her husband, Henry Kruthaup and a brother, Kenneth Mosbacker. Surviving are one daughter, Mrs. Jeff (Merna) Bettinger of Woodsfield; two sons, Henry Kruthaup Jr., of Batavia, Ohio and Kenneth Kruthaup and his wife, Rae Lynn of Morrow, Ohio; brother, Mervin Mosbacker of Brownsville, Texas; five grandchildren, Carley and Leah Bettinger, Crystal, Marissa and Logan Kruthaup and several nieces and nephews. At the family's request, her body was donated to the Willed Body Program at Ohio University, Athens, Ohio.A visitation will be held at the Maham Funeral Home, 187 North 2nd Street, Williamsburg, Ohio, from 6 to 9 p.m., Friday, August 20, 2004. Local arrangements by Watters Funeral Home, 37501 State Route 78 West, Woodsfield, Ohio.

Cattaraugus, New York, died Friday September 22, 2000 near Woodsfield, following injuries sustained in a tractor accident.
            He ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> He >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 was born July 25, 1931, in Gowanda, New York, son of the late C. Wesley and Alta (Manning) Mosher. Mr. Mosher was a retired farmer and a Nazarene by faith. He was preceded in by a grandson, Neil Wesley Howard Mosher. He leaves his wife, Hope (Vincent) Mosher, whom he married July 21, 1951; three daughters, Mrs. Carl (Ruthi) Johnson of Woodsfield, Charlene Casserman of Barberton and Belinda Beaune of Omaha, Neb.; three sons, William Mosher of Barberton, Jerald Mosher of Troy, Ill. and Charles W. Mowder, Freda

2002
DEATH
Name:   Golda M. ROTH, nee Mowder
======= style='mso-tab-count:1'> Golda M. ROTH, nee Mowder >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711
Source: Estes Park Trail Gazette
Estes Park, Colorado, Dec. 4, 2002
Contributor: Jim Simmons
               Golda M. Roth, 100, of Longmont, ======= style='mso-tab-count:1'> Golda M. Roth, 100, of Longmont, >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Colo., died on Friday, Nov. 22, 2002, at the Applewood Nursing Home in Longmont, Colo.
 
Roth was born in Woodsfield, Ohio, on May 22, 1902, to Lizzie (Yoss) and John Mowder.
 
She attended Ohio University for two years.
 
On June 14, 1928, she married Robert Okey Roth in Woodsfield, Ohio.
 
She taught grade school and at Wheaton College in Center Township for 15 years, retiring in 1967.
 
With her husband, she owned and operated the Lazy R Cottages in Estes Park for several years.
 
She was involved with activities at the Wild Basin Restaurant and Lodge and Roth's Family Restaurant.
 
She lived in Scottsdale, Ariz., for 10 years and lived in Estes Park for 16 years.
 
She was a member of Allenspark Community Church.
 
She was preceded in death by her parents, husband Okey Roth, who passed away in 1990, three brothers and one sister.
 
Survivors include her son Rex Roth and his wife Shirley of Estes Park; and daughter Robyn Thornton and her husband James of San Jose, Calif.
 
Services will be held at 2 p.m. on Sunday, Nov. 24, 2002, at the Allenspark Community Church with Rev. Rex Roth officiating.
 
Cremation has taken place, and burial will be at the Mountain View Cemetery in Longmont, Colo.
 
Contributions may be made to the Allenspark Community Church, in care of Allnutt Funeral Service, 1302 Graves Ave., Estes Park, CO 80517.

            He ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> He >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 was born June 23, 1943, in Pomeroy to Willard and Agnes Wilson Mowery. He was a coal miner with Ohio Valley Coal Company, Number 6 Mine, at Alledonia. He was a Protestant by faith.
            He is ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> He is >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 survived by his wife, Linda Moore Mowery, whom he married April 8, 1970; three sons, Timothy Mowery and his wife, Marie, of Columbus, Troy Mowery of Woodsfield and Corey Mowery of Columbus; three brothers, Jack and Kenny Mowery, both of Pomeroy, and James Mowery of Columbus; five grandchildren, Justin Mowery, Jocelyn Mowery, Layken Mowery, Joey Mowery and Johnny Mowery; and several nieces and nephews.
            He ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> He >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 was preceded in death by his parents; one brother, Junior Mowery; and two sisters, Judy VanConney and Joann Weirs.
            Services ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> Services >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 and burial will be at the convenience of the family. There is no visitation. Watters Funeral Home in Woodsfield is in charge of arrangements.
Source: Marietta Times, Marietta, Ohio, October 1, 2001.

            Miss Evelyn Fisher, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Merle Fisher, of Lewisville, Ohio, became the bride of Mr. Donald Moyer, son of Mrs. John Loftus, 677 Hayes Avenue, Youngstown, Ohio, at 6:30 oclock Saturday evening, October first, 1955 in a double ring ceremony read by ======= style='mso-tab-count:1'> Miss Evelyn Fisher, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Merle Fisher, of Lewisville, Ohio, became the bride of Mr. Donald Moyer, son of Mrs. John Loftus, 677 Hayes Avenue, Youngstown, Ohio, at 6:30 o clock Saturday evening, October first, 1955 in a double ring ceremony read by >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 the Reverend Lane McCammon, in the Presbyterian Manse at Woodsfield, Ohio.
            The only attendant of the bride was ======= style='mso-tab-count:1'> The only attendant of the bride was >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 her cousin, Miss Louis Weber, of Lewisville, Ohio. Mr. Joe Moyer, of Youngstown, attended his brother as best man.
            A reception, following the ceremony, ======= style='mso-tab-count:1'> A reception, following the ceremony, >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 was held at Fellowship Hall, near Lewisville, which about one hundred and fifty guests attended. The hostesses were Mrs. Willard Weber, Mrs. Lucille Nicalek, Misses Jean Mallonee, Joan Castello, Elvira Claus, Norma Murphy, Lillian Salem and Eileen Weber.
            The newlyweds took a trip through ======= style='mso-tab-count:1'> The newlyweds took a trip through >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 the East, including Washington, D. C., Luray Caverns, Arlington, Virginia, Winchester, Virginia, and many other places of interest.
            Out-of-town guests were present from ======= style='mso-tab-count:1'> Out-of-town guests were present from >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Newark, Zanesville, Columbus, Youngstown, and Barnesville, Ohio, and Wellsburg, West Virginia.
            They are now residing at 640 Market ======= style='mso-tab-count:1'> They are now residing at 640 Market >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Street, Apartment 7, Youngstown, Ohio.
Source: The Monroe County Beacon, Thursday, December 15, 1955

Mozena, Michelle Suzanne and Randall Alan Christman
               Michelle Suzanne Mozena and ======= style='mso-tab-count:1'> Michelle Suzanne Mozena and >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Randall Alan Christman were united in marriage at 4 p.m., June 12, at Saint John's United Church of Christ, Powhatan Point, with Pastor Keith Jones officiating. Parents of the bride are Mr. and Mrs. Victor Mozena of Woodsfield. Parents of the groom are Mr. and Mrs. Samuel T. Christman of Woodsfield and Mr. and Mrs. Roger Lohr of Gainesville, Florida.
                Katelyn Christman, daughter of the groom and ======= style='mso-tab-count:1'> Katelyn Christman, daughter of the groom and >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 the late Leslie Christman, served as maid of honor and David Weisand was best man. Other attendants were Michael Mozena, Jennipher Mozena, Julie Jones, Joyce Perkins, Linda Wade and Bobbi Cannon. Tori Cannon was flower girl and Samuel C. Christman, son of the groom and the late Leslie Christman, served as ring bearer. A reception followed at the Saint John's United Church of Christ fellowship hall.
               The ======= style='mso-spacerun:yes'> The >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 bride is a graduate of Woodsfield High School and a graduate of Baldwin-Wallace College with a bachelor of science degree in speech pathology. She also graduated from Clarion University of Pennsylvania with a master of science degree in speech pathology. She is employed by the Switzerland of Ohio Local School District as a speech therapist.
               Her ======= style='mso-spacerun:yes'> Her >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 husband is a graduate of Woodsfield High School. He has attended Ohio University and served in the United States Air Force. He is employed as a maintenance worker. Following a wedding trip to Mackinaw Island, Michigan, the new family will reside in Woodsfield.
Source: The Times Leader, Martins Ferry, Ohio, Monday, June 14, 2004.

Mueller, Margaret Claus
    The ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> The >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Miltonsburg community suffered a severe loss in the passing of Mrs. Margaret Claus, nsee Mueller, aged 76, at her home Friday near the noon hour, following a few days suffering of intestinal ailment. Hers was a life of real service to humanity, and her many kindly acts and deeds will find permanent lodgment in the memory of those befriended. Four children are bereft, Dora of the <<<<<<< HEAD home;  Mrs. Gertrude Weber and  Mrs. Lewis Christman, of Lewisville; and  Mrs. Louise Feldner, of Woodsfield; also two sisters, Mrs. Mary Lohri, of Trail Run;  ======= home; Mrs. Gertrude Weber and Mrs. Lewis Christman, of Lewisville; and Mrs. Louise Feldner, of Woodsfield; also two sisters, Mrs. Mary Lohri, of Trail Run; >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Mrs. Elizabeth Pfalzgraf, of Parkersburg, and one brother John Miller in California.

Chester Guam were held at Miltonsburg Evangelical Church on Sunday and were largely attended. We expect to publish obituary next week. Spirit of Democracy, November 13, 1929

Murray, Travis C.
Source--Monroe County Beacon    Woodsfield, Ohio
======= style='mso-spacerun:yes'> Woodsfield, Ohio >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711
Published--July 11, 1985
 
======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711
A 12 year old Ostrander boy who died at Memorial Hospital of Union County, June 26, after he was electrocuted at a residential swimming pool may have saved the life of a friend by warning him to get out of the water.
Travis C. Murray, 15049 Bellepoint Road, was transported to the hospital by the Marysville emergency squad  and pronounced dead by 7:25 p.m. A report ======= style='mso-spacerun:yes'> and pronounced dead by 7:25 p.m. A report >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 filed by the hospital's emergency department attributed Murray's death due to cardiac arrest stemming from electrocution.
According to officials from Union County Sheriff's Department , Murray was cleaning a pool when an electric motor fell into the water. The boy had accidentally hit a hose in the water that was attached to the motor, creating electric shock waves.
Murray yelled to a friend who was helping him clean the pool to get out. The friend was apparently not injured officials said.
Murray's father, Carmel, was outside when the accident happened and heard the two boys screaming for help. The father ran to the pool and immediately unplugged the motor, according to officials.
Travis Murray was a student at Fairbanks Middle School. He was born August 30, 1972 in Marysville to Carmel E. and Janet K. (Fluharty) Murray , who survive.
Murray would have been the treasurer of his eighth grade class. He was also a member and captain of the QFM-96
baaseball team and was active in dog showing.
Also surviving are a brother, Clay King, at home, and grandparents, Mr. and Mrs. Carl Kinzy of Beallsville, grandmothers, Luda Stambaugh of Paintsville, Kentucky and Mrs. Vessie Byrd, Bowerston; and great-grandfather, L.V. Pittman of Cadiz.
Services were held June 29 at the Ingram Funeral Home in Marysville with the Reverend David Scott officiating. Interment in Millcreek Cemetery.
Memorial contributions may be made to Children's Hospital, Columbus, Ohio.

Muth, Franz
            Franz ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> Franz >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Muth "Frank" was born on October 24, 1819 in Langenbieber, Germany. He died on February 16, 1896 in Monroe County, Ohio. He was buried in Chapel Hill Catholic Cemetery, Monroe County, Ohio. He married Margetha Kaiser
            1860 ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> 1860 >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Census: 44 year old Hessian-born farmer "Francis Muet" lived in Stock Township, Noble County, Ohio with is 44 year old wife, Margaret and five children: John (8), Andrew (6), Francis (4), Matilda (3), and Adam (1). The children were all born in Ohio; and the oldest three attended school. The neighboring farms in the census were those of Joseph Crum and John Roehrig.

Myers, Mrs. Annie Myers (nee Wait)
            Mrs. Annie Pearl Myers, 72, of 76 Ridgecrest Road, Bethlehem, Wheeling, W. Va., died in Wheeling Hospital on Monday afternoon, September 12, 1966, at four oclock. Va., died in Wheeling Hospital on Monday afternoon, September 12, 1966, at four o clock. Myers, Frances M.
            Miss Frances M. Myers, daughter of ======= style='mso-tab-count:1'> Miss Frances M. Myers, daughter of >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Mr. and Mrs. O. E. Myers, died at her home on Eastern avenue Friday, February 6, 1925, after a lingering illness from tuberculosis, aged 20 years, 9 months and 10 days.
            She was born April 26, 1904, and came to Woodsfield with her family in 1923. She was a member of St. Sylvesters ======= style='mso-tab-count:1'> She was born April 26, 1904, and came to Woodsfield with her family in 1923. She was a member of St. Sylvester s >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 R. C. church. The funeral services was held in that church at 9:00 A. M. Monday, February 9th, and the body was laid to rest in the cemetery of that church immediately afterwards. The Rev. J. B. Donahie conducted the service. W. P. Galbraith served as funeral director.
            She leaves beside her father and ======= style='mso-tab-count:1'> She leaves beside her father and >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 mother, one sister, Mrs. Charles Hoover of Cleveland. Her father, O. E. Myers is a son of the late A. Myers and her mother, a daughter of the late Daniel Wire Dougherty.
Source: The Spirit of Democracy, Woodsfield, Ohio, Thursday, February 12, 1925.
